loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more provisions and drinks

loans.name: Mukarama

texts.ru: Сулаймонова Мукарама проживает в районе Вахдат. Возраст, 45 лет. Замужем, имеет 4 детей. Муж, строитель. Сама Мукарама более 5 лет занимается торговлей, она в основном продает детскую одежду. Кредит берет для увеличения товараоборота.
texts.en:
Mukarama S. lives in the Vahdat district. She is 45 years old, married and has 4 children. Her husband is a construction worker. Mukarama has been involved in retail sales for over 5 years. She primarily sells children's clothing. She is requesting the loan in order to increase goods turnover.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increasing goods turnover

loans.name: Sabali Group

texts.fr:
Sabali est un regroupement de 5 femmes (3 mariées et 2 veuves) ayant une moyenne d’âge de 37 ans, 3 enfants et  vivant la plupart dans des familles polygames à Hamdallaye  un des quartiers de la ville de Sikasso, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle et sont à leur premier  prêt. 
Elles font la vente de condiments alimentaires, de cola et de  chaussures.
Avec leur prêt, elles comptent acheter, 3 paquets de condiments alimentaires, 1panier de cola et 5 douzaines de paires de chaussures en plastique. 
Elles s’approvisionnent au grand marché de Sikasso ville et dans les villages avoisinants. Elles vendent à domicile, dans les marchés et dans les quartiers de façon ambulante, au comptant  et souvent à crédit à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.
 Elles envisagent réaliser chacune un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 20.000FCFA dont une partie sera utilisée pour l’épargne et les besoins de la famille, l’autre partie sera investie dans les activités.
texts.en:
Sabali is a grouping of five women (three married and two widowed) who average 37 years of age and have an average of three children; the majority live in polygamous families in Hamdallaye, one of the districts of the town of Sikasso, the third administrative region of Mali. They are collaborating with the micro-finance institution, Soro Yiriwaso, in order to satisfy their customers' needs and are on their first loan. They sell condiments, cola and shoes. With their loan they are planning to buy three packets of condiments, one basket of cola and five dozen pairs of plastic shoes. They get their supplies at the big market in Sikasso town and in the neighboring villages. They sell at home, in markets and walking around the districts, for cash and often on credit, to a customer base made up of men and women. They envisage making an average monthly profit of 20,000 FCFA each, of which part will be used for savings and family needs, and the rest invested in their business.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of various items

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of millet

loans.name: Georges

texts.en:
Georges is a 47-year-old married man with three children. He has been working for the past 12 years as a garden arranger. He works at the request of his customers, organizing their gardens and applying pesticides, etc. His children contribute with him to cover the family expenses. 

He already has taken a loan from Ameen and he has been a reliable borrower with on-time repayments throughout his loan cycle. He has also decided to repay his full loan amount several months early. Today, Georges is requesting a new loan of $2,000 to purchase a new developed herb cutter to expand  his business productivity and meet his customers’ demands.

loans.use: purchase a new developed herb cutter

loans.name: Soutoura Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe Soutoura (3 femmes mariées et une veuve) ont en moyenne 45 ans, 4 enfants et  vivent dans des familles polygames à Hamdallaye  un des quartiers de la ville de Sikasso, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle et sont à leur dixième  prêt solidaire. Tous les prêts précédents ont été bien remboursés. 
Elles font la vente de condiments alimentaires, de  poissons,  de sucre, de cola  et des fruits et légumes etc.
Avec leur nouveau prêt, elles comptent acheter, 5 paniers de poissons séchés, 2 paniers de cola, 6 sacs de 50 kg de sucre et 2 chargements de charrette  en oranges. 
Elles s’approvisionnent au grand marché de Sikasso ville et dans les villages avoisinants. Elles vendent à domicile, dans les marchés et dans les quartiers de façon ambulante. Elles vendent au comptant souvent à crédit à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.
 Elles envisagent réaliser chacune un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 45.500FCFA dont une partie sera utilisée pour l’épargne et les besoins de la famille, l’autre partie sera investie dans les activités.
texts.en:
The members of the Soutoura group (three married women and a widow) average 45 years of age, have an average of four children and live in polygamous families iin Hamdallaye, one of the districts of the town of Sikasso, the third administrative region of Mali. They are collaborating with the micro-finance institution, Soro Yiriwaso, in order to satisfy their customer demand and are on their tenth group loan. All their previous loans have been paid without incident. They sell condiments, fish, sugar, cola, fruit and vegetables etc. With their new loan they are planning on buying five baskets of dried fish, two baskets of cola, six 50kg bags of sugar and two barrowloads of oranges. They get their supplies at the large market in Sikasso town and in the neighboring villages. They sell at home, in markets and walking around the various neighborhoods. They sell for cash and often on credit to a customer base composed of men and women. They are expecting to make an average monthly profit of 45,500 FCFA each, of which part will be used for savings and family needs and the rest invested in their business.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of various items

loans.name: Ayikoélé

texts.en:
Ayikoélé M., age 49, lives and works in the Hédzranawoé district of Lomé, Togo, selling a variety of products. Specifically, she sells oil, corn, flour, rice, sugar, and homemade fritters. She began her business in 2005. 

She is now asking for her first loan from WAGES. She will use this loan to purchase two barrels of cooking oil, two sacks of flour, one sack of sugar, one sack of rice, and other general products needed to meet her customers’ demands. 

Mrs. M. is married and has two children.

loans.use: To purchase oil, flour, sugar, and rice

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Market gardening

loans.name: Mangalika

texts.en:
Mangalika is a 35-year-old married woman living with her husband and daughter in the town of Kamburugamuwa in southern Sri Lanka.

Mangalika has a tailoring business which her husband helps her with, and they have been running this business for two years now. They are both very hardworking and hope to develop their business further and eventually create job opportunities for others in the community.

Mangalika is seeking a 15,000 LKR loan from BRAC Sri Lanka to help her purchase cloth for her tailoring business.

Thank you for taking the time to consider supporting this Sri Lankan loan!

loans.use: To purchase cloth for her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Increasing her stock of grocery products

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchasing a supply of smoked fish

loans.name: Ayélé

texts.en:
Since 2008, Ayélé Z. has run a grocery store in the Agoé district of Lomé, Togo. She is now in need of additional stock, which she usually purchases in the Grand Marché of Lomé. As a result, she is asking for her first loan from WAGES. She will use this loan to purchase beauty products, milk, spaghetti, soaps, and a local alcoholic beverage called sodabi. 

With help from you and WAGES, Ms. Z.’s business will continue to grow. 

Ms. Z. is 36 years old and single with no children.

loans.use: To buy beauty products, milk, spaghetti, soap, and sodabi to sell

loans.name: Abdulato

texts.ru: Назаров Абдулато проживает в районе Вахдат. Возраст, 40 лет. Женат, имеет 2 детей. Жена, домохозяйка. Сам Абдулато занимается торговлей. Он продает запасные части автомашины. Этим видом бизнеса занимается уже 8 лет. Кредит берет для увеличения товараоборота.
texts.en:
Abdulato N. lives in the Vahdat district. He is 40 years old, married and has 2 children. His wife is a homemaker. Abdulato is involved in retail sales. He sells automotive spare parts and has been involved in this business for 8 years. He is requesting the loan in order to increase goods turnover.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increasing goods turnover

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Selling traditional fabrics, dry groceries and cereals

loans.name: Purificación

texts.es:
La  Sra. Purificación es Viuda y tiene 4 hijo de los cuales 2 ya están casados  y 2 aun están en la escuela primaria, viven el barrio Fátima de Ciudad del Este.

Purificación  tiene una despensa bien surtida y de buena ubicación en el barrio. Ya que se encuentra a una cuadra de la universidad nacional. Ella se inició hace varios años con muy poca mercadería que poco a poco fue aumentando con el pasar de los años. Hoy día ella tiene una despensa bien surtida y buenos precios, con una clientela formada.
Mediante su trabajo y la ayuda de sus hijos quienes son muy trabajadores ella puede cubrir todos los gastos del hogar.

En esta ocasión se solicita el crédito para la compra de mercaderías que le hace falta en su negocio como azúcar, fideos, aceites  y otros.
texts.en:
Purificación is a widow and has four children. Two of them are already married and the other two are still in school. The family lives in the Fatima neighborhood of Ciudad del Este, Paraguay. Purificación owns a small but well-stocked grocery store in her neighborhood. It is in a good location, just a block from a public university. She began her business several years ago with just a few products and has increased her stock of merchandise bit by bit over the years. Today she sells a large variety of products at good prices and has a steady base of customers. Thanks to her hard work and the help provided to her by her children, who are also very hard-working, she is able to provide for her family. Purificación is asking for this loan to buy merchandise that she needs for her store, such as sugar, pasta, cooking oil and other products.

Translated from Spanish by Catherine Fountain, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise: sugar, rice, pasta, soaps and other products.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy pharmaceutical products

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Sell yams

loans.name: Ruthe Francisco

texts.pt:
Ruthe Francisco N. nasceu na cidade de Maputo, Província de mesmo, sul de Moçambique tem 37 anos de idade solteira e mãe de 2 filhos de 13 e 10 anos de idade, todos vão a escola. Fez somente 5ą classe não continuou devido a falta de condições financeiras. Vive na casa própria com os seus filhos e não sustenta mais ninguém.
Nunca saiu da cidade de Maputo, desenvolve o seu negócio nesta cidade há mais de 10 anos. A sua actividade é vendedora ambulante de roupa diversa, não possui nenhum empregado e tem um rendimento de cerca de 10.000.00mt que aplica nas despesas de casa e ainda poupa algum no Xitique (sistema tradicional de poupança rotativa).
Nunca teve empréstimos em outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku através da sua amiga dona Ana que também é cliente desta instituição. Este é o seu 4º empréstimo no valor de 20.000.00mt, com o qual pretende comprar produtos (roupa diversa) para aumentar a quantidade da sua mercadoria. Os empréstimos anteriores foram de 10.000.00mt, 12.000.00mt e 15.000.00mt, os quais foram para a área de comércio e habitação. 
No futuro gostaria de solicitar mais empréstimos para concluir a sua casa e oferecer melhores condições de habitabilidade.
texts.en:
Ruthe Francisco N. was born in the city of Maputo, in southern Mozambique. She is 37 years old, and a single mother of two children 13 and 10 years old. Both attend school. She only completed fifth grade due to lack of funds. She lives with her children in her own house, and has no other dependents. She never left Maputo, and has run her business in the the city for over 10 years. She sells clothes as a street vendor, and has no employees. She uses her monthly income of around 10,000 MZN for household expenses and manages to same some in a Xitique (a traditional revolving savings sistem). She has never taken out loans from other banks, and learned about Hluvuku through her friend Ana who is also a client of the organization. This is her fourth loan, for 20,000 MZN, which she intends to use to buy products (clothing and others) to increase the quantity of her stock. The earlier loans were for 10,000, 12,000 and 15,000 MZN for improvements to her home and place of business. In the future she would like to apply for additional loans to complete her house and improve her living conditions.

Translated from Portuguese by David Kaisel, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase and sale of clothing

loans.name: Ablan Marie

texts.fr:
Cette dame  est âgée de 53 ans, elle a commencé en 2006 le commerce en détail de pagnes, elle a associé à ce commerce la vente de détail de poissons fumés. Le stock de marchandises dont elle dispose actuellement ne lui permet pas de satisfaire sa clientèle grandissante raison pour laquelle elle s’adresse à WAGES pour solliciter un premier crédit afin d’acheter une vingtaine de pagnes et une dizaine de paniers de poissons.
Elle est mariée et mère de 04, enfants, avec le revenu de son commerce elle contribue aux dépenses familiales.
texts.en:
This lady is 53 years old. In 2006 she started a retail business selling pagnes, to which she added the retail selling of smoked fish. The stock of merchandise currently available does not allow her to satisfy the increasing number of customers. For this reason she approached WAGES to request a first credit loan to buy 20 pagnes and ten baskets of fish. She is married, mother of four children, and with her earnings helps to manage family expenses.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy pagnes and smoked fish

loans.name: Sani

texts.en:
Sani B. runs a dry cleaning business called “Dar Es Salaam” in Lomé, Togo. He has been working in this business since 2007 and is now ready to open a second location. He has asked for a loan from WAGES in order to purchase a counter, a display case, tables, chairs, and any other items needed in order to successfully set up this new store. 

With this loan, Mr. B. will continue to prosper and provide for his family's wellbeing.  

He is 35 years old and divorced with three children.

loans.use: To purchase supplies needed to open a second dry cleaning location

loans.name: Beatriz Rafael

texts.pt:
Beatriz Rafael Chaquela T. nasceu na cidade de Maputo, Província de mesmo, sul de Moçambique tem 55 anos de idade viuva e mãe de 5 filhos de 32, 31, 30, 29 e 15 anos de idade, o mais novo vai a escola. Fez 12ą classe e formação de professores. Vive na casa própria com os seus 2 filhos menores e não sustenta mais ninguém.
Nunca saiu da cidade de Maputo, trabalha no Ministério da Educação como docente desde 1974, afecta no Distrito de Boane. Não possui nenhum empregado e tem um salário mensal de 5.585.00mt, que aplica nas despesas de casa e ainda poupa algum na sua conta bancária
Já teve empréstimo em outro banco (BIM), conheceu a Hluvuku através da sua amiga que também é cliente desta instituição. Este é o seu 4º empréstimo no valor de 17.000.00mt, com o qual pretende comprar material de construção (cimento, areia, ferro, pedra e chapas de zinco) para dar continuidade com o melhoramento da sua residência. Os empréstimos anteriores foram de 10.300.00mt, 10.400.00mt e 13.500.00mt, para a mesma actividade. 
No futuro gostaria de solicitar mais empréstimos para concluir a sua casa e oferecer melhores condições de habitabilidade.
texts.en:
Beatriz Rafael was born in the city of Maputo, in the Province of the same name, South of Mozambique. She is 55 years old, a widow and mother of children who are 32, 31, 30, 29 and 15 years-old. The youngest is in school. She completed 12th grade and teacher's certificate. She lives in her own house with her two youngest children and doesn't support anyone else. She has never left Maputo. She works with the Ministry of Education as a teacher since 1974 in the Boane District. She does not have any employees and earns 5.585.00mt per month, which goes to household expenses and a savings account. She has had loans with another bank (BIM). She came to know Hluvuku through her friend who is also a partner of the same institution. This loan, in the amount of 17.000.00mt is his fourth. She intends to buy building materials (cement, sand, iron, stone and tin screens) in order to continue her home improvements. The previous loans were for 10.300.00mt, 10.400.00mt and 13.500.00mt and were all applied towards the same activity. In the future, she would like to request more loans to finish her house and provide better living conditions.

Translated from Portuguese by Betyna Almeida-Covarrubias, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of building materials (cement, sand, iron, stone and tin screens)

loans.name: Tomasa

texts.es:
La Sra. Tomasa es madre soltera tiene 3 hijos menores que aún están cursando el nivel primario educativo ella vive en el barrio boquerón II con sus hijos.
Tomasa tiene una despensa bien surtida y es la única del barrio.
Ella se inicio hace varios años con muy poca mercadería que poco a poco fue aumentando con el pasar de los años hoy día ella tiene una despensa bien surtida y con buenísima clientela ya que es la única despensa que se encuentra en su comunidad.
Ella es una persona muy trabajadora y dedicada a sus hijos. El crédito solicitado fue para la artículos para a venta como azúcar, pastas, aceites y otros.
texts.en:
Tomasa is the single mother of three minor children who are still in the primary educational level at school. She lives in the Boquerón II neighborhood with her children. Tomasa has a well stocked grocery store, and it is the only one in the neighborhood. She started several years ago with very little merchandise. She increased it little by little as the years went by. She now has a well stocked grocery store with good customers. It is the only grocery store to be found in her community. She is a hard-working person, and she is devoted to her children. The loan was for products to sell like sugar, pastas, oils, and others.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy various merchandise like sugar, rice, noodles, different soaps, and other items

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy food products

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Sell food products

loans.name: Akoua

texts.fr: Mariée et mère de 02 enfants, cette femme vit avec sa famille dans le quartier de  attiégou à lomé. Pour contribuer aux dépenses de son foyer elle s’est lancée en 2005 dans le commerce de charbon de bois. Ses 4 années d’expérience dans ce commerce lui ont permis de faire une bonne gestion, en cette saison de pluie qui vient de débuter, une partie de son stock de marchandises a été détruite, par la pluie, elle veut se réapprovisionner et sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour acheter 25 sacs de charbons de bois.
texts.en:
Married and mother of two children, this woman lives with her family in the Attiégou neighborhood of Lomé. In 2005 she started a business retailing charcoal to contribute to household expenses. After four years’ experience she learned to manage the process well, but at the beginning of the rainy season she lost part of her merchandise to the weather. She wants to resupply her stock and is requesting a loan from WAGES to buy 25 bags of charcoal.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy charcoal

loans.name: Dicia Amelieta

texts.pt:
Dicia Amelieta T. nasceu na cidade da Matola, Província de Maputo, sul de Moçambique tem 33 anos de idade solteira e mãe de 2 filhos de 11 e 08 anos de idade, todos vão a escola. Fez somente 8ą classe não continuou devido a gravidez precoce. Vive na casa própria com os seus filhos e não sustenta mais ninguém.
Nunca saiu da cidade da Matola tem um negócio próprio há mais de 10 anos, vende mais óleo, ovos, arroz e outros. Não possui nenhum empregado e tem um rendimento de cerca de 3.500.00mt por semana, que aplica nas despesas de casa e ainda poupa algum na sua conta bancária.
Nunca teve empréstimo em outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku através da sua amiga que também é cliente desta instituição. Este é o seu 1º empréstimo no valor de 15.000.00mt, com o qual pretende comprar produtos (arroz, óleo, ovos, massas e outros) para aumentar a quantidade e diversificar ainda mais a sua mercadoria. 
Compromete se a pagar devidamente este empréstimo para poder aceder a outros, no futuro gostaria de solicitar mais empréstimos para concluir a sua casa e oferecer melhores condições de habitabilidade a seus filhos, assim como custear despesas de ensino superior.
texts.en:
Dicia Amelieta was born in the city of Matola, in the Maputo Province, South of Mozambique. She is 33 years old, single and the mother of two children who are 11 and 8 years old. They are both in school. She only went to school until the 8th grade due to a teen pregnancy. She lives in her own house with her children and doesn't support anyone else. She has never left Matola. She has had her own business for more than 10 years. She sells mostly cooking oil, eggs, rice and others. She does not have any employees and earns around 3.500.00mt per week, which is applied towards household expenses and a savings account. This is her first loan, in the amount of 15.000.00mt, aimed at purchasing products (rice, cooking oil, eggs, pasta and others) to increase the quantity of and diversify her inventory. She commits to pay this loan on time to be able to request others. In the future, she would like to request more loans to finish her house and offer better living conditions for her children, and to also pay for college.

Translated from Portuguese by Betyna Almeida-Covarrubias, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase and sale of products (rice, cooking oil, eggs, pasta and others)

loans.name: Rachidatou

texts.fr:
Cette dame dynamique exerce comme activités génératrices de revenu  le commerce de détail de produits génériques, elle s’approvisionne au grand marché de Lomé. ce  commerce marche très bien pour elle, elle veut l’agrandir. Elle demande à WAGES un premier prêt pour pouvoir s’acheter des produits génériques. Ainsi elle pourra réaliser de meilleures recettes.
Elle est mariée et mère d’un enfants.
texts.en:
This dynamic lady’s revenue-generating activity is the retail commerce of generic or no-brand products that she buys at the main market in Lomé. She is so successful in her business that she wants to expand. She is requesting a first credit loan from WAGES to buy more generic products, so that she can increase her profits. She is married and mother of one child.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy generic (no-brand) products

loans.name: Tohir

texts.ru: Зиёдуллоев Тохир проживает в городе Душанбе. Возраст, 42 года. Женат, имеет 4 детей. Жена, домохозяйка. Живет вместе с родителями. Предостовляет услугу, такси. Опыт в данной сфере, большой. Он перевозит людей с одного места на другое. У него автомашина (тангем). Кредит берет для ремонта автомашины, чтобы предоставить безопасную услугу.
texts.en:
Tohir Z. lives in the city of Dushanbe. He is 42 years old, married and has 4 children. His wife is a homemaker. They live together with his parents. Tohir provides taxi service. He has a lot of experience in this field. He owns a minivan and transports people from one place to another. Tohir is requesting the loan for car repairs in order to provide safe service.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Car repairs

loans.name: Casimiro Francisco

texts.pt:
Casimiro Francisco B. nasceu no Distrito de Chibuto, Província de Gaza, sul de Moçambique tem 37 anos de idade casado e pai de 4 filhos de 15, 10, 4 e 2 anos de idade, os 2 mais velhos vão a escola. Fez somente 8ą classe não continuou devido a falta de condições financeiras. Vive na casa própria com a sua família e sustente a mãe que vive com ela.
Saiu de Chibuto para Boane na Província de Maputo a procura de melhores condições de vida. Tem um negocio próprio há mais de 8 anos, é serralheiro e possui um estaleiro de material de construção. Possui um ajudante, tem um rendimento de cerca de 5000.00mt por mês, que aplica nas despesas de casa e ainda poupa algum na sua conta bancária.
Já teve empréstimo no NOVO BANCO e dividiu não continuar por vários motivos. Conheceu a Hluvuku através de amigo que também é cliente desta instituição. Este é o seu 1º empréstimo no valor de 15.000.00mt, com o qual pretende comprar material (cimento, pregos, parafusos, material eléctrico e outros) para diversificar e aumentar a quantidade de seu material no estaleiro. 
Compromete se a pagar devidamente este empréstimo para poder aceder a outros, no futuro gostaria de solicitar mais empréstimos para ampliar o seu estaleiro e concluir a sua casa e oferecer melhores condições de habitabilidade a sua família.
texts.en:
Casimiro Francisco was born in the Chibuto District in the Gaza Province, South of Mozambique. He is 37 years old, married and the father of 4 children who are 15, 10, 4 and 2 years old. The two oldest are in school. He only went to school until the 8th grade and didn't finish due to lack of financial resources. He lives with his family in his own house and supports his mother who lives with him. He left Chibuto to go to Boane, in the Maputo Province, to look for better living conditions. He has had his own business for more than 8 years. He is a locksmith and sells building materials. He has one helper and earns around 5.000.00mt per month, which goes towards household expenses and a savings account. He has requested a loan with Novo Bank and decided not to continue for various reasons. He came to know Hluvuku through his friend who is also a partner of the institution. This loan, in the amount of 15.000.00mt, is his first. He intends to buy building materials (cement, nails, screws, electric material and others) in order to diversify and increase his inventory. He is committed to paying this loan on time in order to be able to request other loans. In the future, he would like to request more loans to increase the size of his business, finish his house and provide better living conditions to his family.

Translated from Portuguese by Betyna Almeida-Covarrubias, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase and sale of supplies (cement, nails, screws, electric materials and others)

loans.name: Afi

texts.fr:
cette dame est une femme très dynamique car elle continue par exercer son commerce de produits alimentaires qu’elle exerce depuis 1990. Avec ce qu’elle gagne elle contribue aux dépenses de sa famille.
Le stock dont elle dispose actuellement ne lui permet pas de satisfaire tout ses clients, elle veut rehausser son stock et sollicite par conséquent de WAGES un crédit pour l’achat de 2 petits paniers de pommes de terres, des carottes, des tomates, des macaronis et d’autres imprévus.
Elle est mère de 03 enfants.
texts.en:
This woman is very dynamic as she has been carrying out her business selling food products since 1990. With the money she earns, she contributes to the family's expenses. The stock which she has at present is not sufficient to satisfy all her customers and she would like to increase it. She is therefore applying to WAGES for a loan for the purchase of two small baskets of potatoes, carrots, tomatoes, macaroni and other items that she has not anticipated. She is mother to three children.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of food products

loans.name: Massan

texts.en:
Massan T. works in the Grand Marché of Hédzranawoé, where she sells charcoal. She has been in this business since 1980. The combination of her busy location and the necessity of her products ensures that demand remains high. 

This will be her first loan from WAGES, which she will use to purchase 20 sacks of charcoal and resupply her stock. This loan will help Mrs. T. take care of her family expenses and help her business grow. 

She is married and has five children.

loans.use: To purchase charcoal for resale

loans.name: Judite Mateus

texts.pt:
Judite Mateus L. nasceu no Distrito de Manjacaze, Província de Gaza, sul de Moçambique tem 41 anos de idade casada e sem filhos. Fez somente 7ą classe não continuou porque depois de casar o marido não deixou. Vive na casa do serviço do marido que é militar e quadro do Ministério da Defesa. Sustenta sua mãe enviando dinheiro para despesas de casa.
Saiu de Manjacaze para Boane na Província de Maputo em casa da irmã em 1985. Tem um negocio próprio há mais de 9 anos, não possui nenhum empregado e no seu negocio consegue um rendimento de cerca de 4.500.00mt por mês, que aplica nas despesas de casa e ainda poupa algum na sua conta bancária.
Já teve empréstimo na Associação de crédito TCHUMA e dividiu não continuar por vários motivos. Conheceu a Hluvuku através de seu vizinho que também é cliente desta instituição. Este é o seu 3º empréstimo no valor de 15.000.00mt, com o qual pretende comprar produtos (refrescos, cerveja, vinho e outros) para diversificar e aumentar a quantidade da sua mercadoria. Os empréstimos anteriores foram de 5.000.00mt e 13.000.00mt, ambos para a mesma actividade. 
Compromete se a pagar devidamente este empréstimo para poder aceder a outros, no futuro gostaria de solicitar mais empréstimos para aplicar no seu negócio e com os lucros ampliar a sua casa, oferecendo melhores condições de habitabilidade a sua família.
texts.en:
Judite Mateus L. was born in the district of Manjacaze, Gaza Province, in southern Mozambique. She is 41 years old, and married with no children. She only finished 7th grade, and had to leave school when she married her husband. She lives in her husband's service worker house. He is in the military and works for the Ministry of Defense. Judite supports her mother by sending her money to cover her expenses. In 1985 she left Manjacaze for Boane in Maputo Province, to live with her sister. She's had her own business for more than 9 years. She has no employees and her business brings in about 4500 meticals a month, which she uses for household expenses, and she's able to save a little in her bank account. She's had one loan with the TCHUMA Credit Association and decided not to continue there for a number of reasons. She learned about Hvuluku from a neighbor who is also a Hvuluku client. This is her third loan, in the amount of 15,000 meticals, which she will use to buy products (soft drinks, beer, wine, etc.) to diversify and increase the stock she carries. Her earlier loans were for 5000 and 13,000 meticals,which she used for the same purpose. She's committed to paying this loan off on time so that in the future she'll be eligible for others. She'd like to request additional loans for her business in the future, and then use the profits to expand her house and offer her family better living conditions.

Translated from Portuguese by Andrea Rosenberg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy and sell products (soft drinks, beer, wine, etc.)

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase and sale of spare parts

loans.name: Uralbek

texts.en:
For the past 12 years, Uralbek has worked in agriculture, raising animals. He raises cattle, which he cares for with great care, since it is thanks to them that he can cover his household expenses. Uralbek showed us his animals with great happiness as his cattle were about to be vaccinated against the various sicknesses that affect that type of livestock. 

Uralbek considers his work very important, which is why he is currently seeking a loan in order to purchase additional young cattle so that he can earn more money in the future. This will help him generate additional income for his family. We appreciate your support for Uralbek’s projects.     

 
More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes being a key post along the Silk Road and the location of the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists, and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. Known for its epic mountain passes, the country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. Even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture, and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93 percent of the country is mountainous, leaving only 7 percent of arable land. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj.

loans.use: To purchase young cattle to expand the business

loans.name: Chalgash

texts.ru: Искандаров Чалгаш проживает в районе Яван. Возраст, 51 год. Женат, имеет 5 детей. Образование высшее "Педогог". Преподает в средней школе. Кроме того занимается растениеводством. При доме имеет небольшой участок земли, где выращивает овощи. В этой области уже 20 лет. Кредит берет для закупа семян и минеральных удобрений. Сейчас посевной сезон и клиент хочет закупить качественные семена, чтобы получить хороший урожай для продажи.
texts.en:
Chalgash I. lives near Yavan. He is fifty-one years old, married with five children. He has a degree in Education and teaches in secondary school. In addition to teaching, he is a farmer. On a piece of land next to his home, he has grown vegetables for over twenty years. He is asking for a loan to purchase seeds and fertilizer. Currently, during the planting season, he wants to buy high quality seeds to get a better harvest and sales.

Translated from Russian by Susan Savkov, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Becky

texts.en:
Becky sells foodstuffs, drinks and groceries at retail prices to her customers to make a living. She loves this business because of the opportunity to interact with customers.

She is 41 years old and married with five children. Her eldest child is 14 years old and her children attend school which makes her happy. She has been in this business for eight years. She hopes to grow her business. Becky is asking for a loan amount of 150,000 NGN to purchase more foodstuffs and drinks to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs and drinks to sell

loans.name: Adzaguenou Ayao

texts.en:
Adzaguenou Ayao D. lives and works in the Hédzranawoé district of Lomé, selling motor oil. He purchases his supply from the Grand Marché of Lomé and then sells his product in the slightly smaller Grand Marché of Hédzranawoé. 

Since the main method of transportation in Lomé is by motorcycle, the demand for Mr. D.’s product remains high. He has been in this business since 2006 and is now asking for his first loan from WAGES. He will use this loan to purchase 10 barrels of motor oil for sale in order to satisfy customer demand.

He is single and does not have children.

loans.use: To purchase motor oil for sale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a large amount of secondhand products

loans.name: Silvestre

texts.pt:
Silvestre C. nasceu no Distrito de Chibuto, Província de Gaza, sul de Moçambique tem 40 anos de idade casado e pai de 5 filhos de 14, 13, 08 e gémeos de 4 anos de idade, destes os 3 mais velhos vão a escola. Fez somente 8ą classe não continuou porque foi incorporado no serviço militar obrigatório. Vive na casa própria com a sua família sustenta sua mãe vive com ele.
Saiu de Chibuto para Maputo no distrito de Boane quando esteve a cumprir com o serviço militar. Depois de desmobilizado começou a trabalhar numa escola tipo orfanato (casa do Gaiato) como estofador, actividade que aprendeu com o pai ainda jovem. Não possui nenhum empregado, conta com ajuda do seu filho e tem um rendimento de cerca de 5.000.00mt por mês, que aplica nas despesas de casa e ainda poupa algum na sua conta bancária.
 Nunca teve empréstimo em outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku através de seu vizinho que também é cliente desta instituição. Este é o seu 2º empréstimo no valor de 13.000.00mt, com o qual pretende comprar material de (pregos, nadas, molas e outros) para dar continuidade com a sua actividade. O emprestimo anterior foi de 2.500.00mt, para serviços. 
No futuro gostaria de solicitar mais empréstimos para aplicar na área comercial e concluir a sua casa, oferecendo melhores condições de habitabilidade a sua família.
texts.en:
Silvestre C. was born in the district of Chibuto, Gaza Province, in southern Mozambique. He is 40 years old and married. He has five children: a 14-year-old, a 13-year-old, an 8-year-old, and 4-year-old twins. The three older children attend school. He only finished 8th grade and left school to fulfill his compulsory military service. He lives in his own house with his family, and also supports his mother, who lives with them. He left Chibuto for Maputo in the district of Boane, where he remained to complete his military service. After leaving the military he started working in an orphanage school (Casa do Gaiato) as an upholsterer, a trade he learned from his father when he was young. He doesn't have any employees, and instead relies on his son's assistance. He brings in about 5000 meticals a month, which is enough to cover household expenses and also save a little in a bank account. He's never received loans from other banks. He learned about Hvuluku from his neighbor, who is also a Hvuluku client. This is his second loan, in the amount of 13,000 meticals, which he will use to purchase materials (nails, springs, etc.) to continue his work. His previous loan was for 2500 meticals. He'd like to request additional loans in the future, to be used in his business and also to finish his house and offer his family better living conditions.

Translated from Portuguese by Andrea Rosenberg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase supplies for furniture repair (nails, springs, etc.)

loans.name: Komiljon

texts.en:
M. Komiljon is 28 years old. He is married with two children. Komiljon is providing taxi services in his car. He has been in this business for the last 10 years. Komiljon always tries to provide high quality service but at the same time keep the prices attractive for the customers. Komiljon is doing his best to make his business stable and profitable, as he is the main breadwinner in his family. He is ready to work from early morning until late night in order to keep his customers and obtain new ones. Currently his car needs to be repaired. For this reason, Komiljon requests 7500 Somoni. He thanks everyone supporting him and promises to repay the loan in a timely manner. 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the fourth millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase spare parts.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.es:
La señora Gloria G.  es madre soltera, con 5 hijos menores de edad.
El copetín y la pequeña despensa   montaron gracias a un pequeño capital que había  ahorrado durante varios años. Anteriormente se dedicaba a la venta de ropas.
Quiere comprar mercaderías  al por mayor, así consigue más barato  y tiene un margen importante de ganancia.
La señora Gloria  es una persona muy activa, cuenta con un carácter muy agradable. Manifiesta que quiere mejorar su negocio y su casa  ya que es la fuente de su ingreso,  en su domicilio  tiene su local de venta, pero sin descuidarse del capital de su negocio, para ello solicito el crédito para la compra de los artículos para vender.
texts.en:
Gloria G. is a single mother with 5 dependent children. She was able to open a small snack bar and grocery store thanks to a small amount of capital she had saved over several years. Previously she had worked selling clothing. She would like to buy wholesale merchandise for her business, so that she can obtain it more cheaply and achieve a significant profit margin. Gloria is a very active person with a very agreeable nature. She reports that she would like to improve her business and her home, since it is her source of income: she operates her shop in her home. However, she does not want to neglect the capital needed for her business, and thus she is requesting the current loan to buy merchandise to sell.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying soft drinks, snacks, beverages and other products

loans.name: Eldard

texts.en:
N. Eldard is a 36-year-old married man with eight children. For the last four years, he has been selling coffee as a means of subsistence. He began the business in Rugaga trading center in Bushenyi district with only 100,000 Ugandan shillings. At length, banking on his hard work ethic, he was able to increase his capital in a short period of time to 2.5 million shillings.

Currently Eldard’s business generates him close to 150,000 shillings a month. This is little money by any Ugandan standards but it’s with this paltry monthly earnings that he has struggled to educate all his children.

Being a resolutely hardworking and experienced businessman Eldard remains upbeat that he is going to succeed. The one vital resource he has invariably relied on to keep his business afloat has been that friendly chord he has struck with his customers. The high quality coffee he sells is in high favor with many people and coffee outlets.

Eldard’s dream and future plan, as he makes steady progress in his business, is to have his own hybrid coffee plantations so that, from them, he can harvest coffee which he can competitively sell at a higher market price. It is for this reason that he requires a loan.

loans.use: To purchase high-quality parchment coffee to sell to his customers and coffee marketing unions

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose loves cooking and that is why she sells mouth watering cooked foods and drinks. She loves this business because of the one-on-one interaction that she has with her customers.  She hopes to own a world class restaurant in the future. She started this business eight years ago and she is making progress. 

As a hard working woman with the determination to excel, she sells for long hours to make her business more sustainable. She is 31 years old and married with four children. Rose hopes for a loan amount of 130,000 NGN to purchase more foodstuffs to cook and sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to cook and sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of motorbike taxi

loans.name: Salvador Sebastiao

texts.pt:
Salvador Sebastião M. nasceu no Distrito de Boane, Provincia de Maputo, sul de Moçambique tem 59 anos de idade casado e pai de 12 filhos os 9 já maiores de idade e 3 de 16, 14, 11 anos de idade, destes os 3 vão a escola. Fez somente 4ą classe não continuou porque na altura era a única classe que tinham acesso. Vive na casa propria com a sua família sustenta 2 familiares que vive com ele.
Nunca saiu de Boane, é motorista de profissão numa empresa privada, não possui nenhum empregado e o seu salário mensal é de 4.900.00mt por mês, que aplica nas despesas de casa e ainda poupa algum na sua conta bancária.
 Nunca teve empréstimo em outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku através de seu amigo que também é cliente desta instituição. Este é o seu 4º empréstimo no valor de 12.200.00mt, com o qual pretende comprar material de construção (cimento, pedra, pregos, areia e outros) para dar continuidade com a sua obra. Os empréstimos anteriores foram de 9.600.00mt, 11.000.00mt e 13.000.00mt todos para a mesma actividade. 
No futuro gostaria de solicitar mais empréstimos para aplicar na conclusão da sua casa, oferecendo melhores condições de habitabilidade a sua família.
texts.en:
Salvador Sebastião M. was born in the district of Boane, in the province of Maputo in the south of Mozambique. He is 59 years old, married, and has 12 children. Nine of them are already adults and the 3 younger children, who are 16, 14 and 11 years old, are in school. Salvador only finished 4th grade. He didn't continue because at the time he didn't have access to further schooling. He lives in his own house with his family, and also takes care of two relatives who live with him. Salvador never left Boane. He works as a driver for a private corporation. He doesn't have anyone working for him and brings home a monthly salary of 4900 Meticales, which he uses to cover household expenses. He also saves some money in his bank account. Salvador has never taken out a loan with another bank. He found out about Hluvuku [the Kiva Field Partner] through a friend who also works with the institution. This is his 4th loan, for the amount of 12,200 Meticales. He plans to use this money to buy construction materials (cement, stones, nails, sand and other items) in order to continue work on his construction project. His earlier loans were for 9600, 11,000 and 13,000 Meticales, and all were used for the same purpose. In the future he would like to get more loans in order to finish his house, to offer better living conditions for his family.

Translated from Portuguese by Catherine Fountain, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of construction materials (cement, sand, nails, stones and other items)

loans.name: Ibodullo

texts.ru: Мингпулатов Ибодулло проживает в районе Яван. Возраст, 51 год. Женат, имеет 5 детей. Образование среднее. Более 20 лет занимается растениеводством. При доме имеет земельный участок, где выращивает овощи. Всей семьей занимаются этой деятельностью. Кредит берет для закупа семян.
texts.en:
Ibodullo M. lives near Yvan. He is fifty-one years old, married with five children. He has a high school education. For over twenty years, he has been a farmer. Next to his home, he has a piece of land where he grows vegetables. His entire family helps with farming. He is asking for loan to purchase seeds.

Translated from Russian by Susan Savkov, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase seeds

loans.name: Bolormaa

texts.en: Bolormaa is 39 years old and lives with her son in the Baganuur district of Ulaanbaatar, the largest city and capital of Mongolia. She and her son live together in a small house that belongs to the one of her relatives. Bolormaa has been operating a fruit stall at a local market. She sells a variety of fruits and vegetables. Bolormaa has built her business to a consistent level and attributes its success to her strong communication skills. She is a very hardworking person and pays her loan on time.  Bolormaa is focused on the future and says, “I would like to purchase my own plot of land with a house and yard for my family.” She is requesting a 500,000-tugrug loan to purchase a variety of vegetables such as potatoes and carrots at wholesales price to resell for a profit.

loans.use: To purchase more fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Blessing

texts.en:
Blessing sells medicines at retail prices to make a living. She hopes to own a big pharmacy stall in the future. She is 34 years old and married with four children. Her husband also works to support their home. 

She is a LAPO client, (Lift Above Poverty Organization), which is committed to improving lives in Nigeria and else where in Africa.  Blessing is very determined and hopes to expand her business. She is asking for a loan amount of 80,000 NGN to purchase more medicines to sell. She says a very big thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more medicines to sell

loans.name: Albertino Zacarias

texts.pt:
Albertino Zacarias L. nasceu na Província de Zambézia, centro de Moçambique tem 41 anos de idade casado e pai de 2 filhos de 10 e 07 anos de idade, todos vão a escola. Fez 12ą classe parou porque na altura foi incorporado no serviço militar obrigatório. Vive na casa própria com a sua família e sustenta 2 sobrinhos que vivem com ele.
Saiu da província de Zambézia para Maputo com a sua família cumprindo o serviço militar em 1995, mais tarde fixou sua residência em Boane no bairro 2. Ė Militar e Quadro do Ministério da Defesa Nacional desde 1985, tem um salário mensal de 5.500.00mt por mês, que aplica nas despesas de casa e ainda consegue poupar algum na sua conta bancária.
Nunca teve empréstimos em outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku através de amigos que já são clientes desta instituição. Este é o seu 4º empréstimo no valor de 20.000.00mt, com o qual pretende comprar material de construção (cimento, pedalaria, chapas de zinco e outros) para continuar com construção da sua residência.
No futuro gostaria de solicitar mais emprestimos para concluir a sua residência e oferecer o melhor conforto a sua família.
texts.en:
Albertino Zacarias L. was born in the province of Zambezia in the central region of Mozambique. He is 41 years old, married, and has 2 children who are 10 and 7 years old. Both of them are in school. Albertino studied through 12th grade. He didn't continue with his studies because he had to fulfill the obligatory military service. He lives in his own house with his family, and also takes care of two nephews who live with him. Albertino left the province of Zambezia for Maputo with his family, completing his military service in 1995. Later he moved to Boane, to the neighborhood called "2". He has worked for the Ministry of National Defense since 1995 and has a monthly salary of 5500 Meticales, which he uses to cover household expenses. He also saves some money in his bank account. Albertino has never taken out a loan with another bank. He found out about Hluvuku [the Kiva Field Partner] through friends who also work with the institution. This is his 4th loan, for the amount of 20,000 Meticales. He plans to use this money to buy construction materials (cement, stones, zinc plates and other items) in order to continue with the construction of his home.. In the future he would like to apply for more loans to finish his house and offer his family better living conditions.

Translated from Portuguese by Catherine Fountain, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of construction materials (cement, stone, zinc plates and other items)

loans.name: Santa Librada Group

texts.es:
Para la formación el presente comité inicio la Señora Celina C.  ex integrante del comité San Ignacio   domiciliada en el km 9 Acaray de  Ciudad del Este. Ella contactó con sus vecinas y amigas para formar el comité en la Zona .

El comité se Denomina “Santa Lucia ”  están  en el Primer Ciclo   con 18  integrantes , es un grupo que se destaca  en el barrio por ser muy unidas, solidarias  y responsables,  ellas tienen actividades diferentes.

La Señora Celina C., teniendo en cuenta la creciente demanda de ropa, más bien uniformes para escuelas y colegios desidio invertir en la compra de materiales para la cofección de los mismos, ya que ella posee un taller donde tambien además de ella trabajan otras costureras y confeccionan prendas de vestir. Actuamente,  se ve con la necesidad de adquirir más máquinas para la costura y terminación de las prendas, así como materia prima como son las telas y accesorios para la confección de prendas de vestir de buena calidad, por ello la solicitud del prétamos.
texts.en:
Celina C., a former member of the San Ignacio committee, initiated the formation of the current committee. She lives at kilometer 9 in Acaray, Ciudad del Este. She met with her neighbors and friends to form a committee in her area. The committee is called “Santa Lucia, ” and they are in their first loan cycle, with 18 members. It is a group which stands out in the neighborhood for its unity, solidarity and responsibility. The members pursue diverse activities. Celina's work is making clothing. She has observed a growing demand for clothing, especially primary and secondary school uniforms, so she decided to invest her loan in materials for making uniforms. She finds that she also needs additional machines for creating and finishing clothing, as well as raw materials such as fabrics and accessories for the preparation of high-quality clothing. This is why she requested this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying sewing machines and materials

loans.name: Silviya

texts.en:
Silviya is married with a child. She is an entrepreneur from Beregovo. Silviya sells women’s clothing in the central marketplace. She has been working with this type of inventory for five years. Currently, Silviya has 12,000 Grivnyas in inventory. Her gross income amounts to 15,000 Grivnyas. Net profit is about 4,000 – 5,000 Grivnyas a month.  

Silviya is requesting a 5,000-Grivnya loan to increase her stock. She is hoping to broaden her seasonal merchandise and boost her spring sales as a result. Silviya has always had a serious and responsible business approach. It has helped her build a sustainable venture bringing her stable income. She is hoping to continue expanding her trade in the future.

loans.use: To increase her stock

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Sell pagnes

loans.name: Manar

texts.en: Manar is 46 years old and lives with her husband and six children in Bayan-Olgii province, Mongolia. She and her family live together in a traditional Mongolian nomadic housing tent called a ger. They have been living together in their current home for 10 years. Manar's husband has been operating a livestock trading business since 2005. Presently, Manar operates a bakery shop in her home province. She has been operating her business since 2009, when she received bakery equipment from a project of the World Vision International Organization. Manar's business has expanded and she has gained much experience as a businesswoman. She is focused on the future and says, “I would like to expand my business and to enlarge my bakery workshop in the future.” She is requesting a 1,500,000-tugrug loan to purchase materials such as flour for her bakery shop.

loans.use: To purchase flour and other ingredients

loans.name: Blessing

texts.en: Blessing has been selling drinks and sachet water at retail prices for the past four years to make a living, and she loves this business because of the opportunity to interact with customers. Blessing is a 30-year-old married mother of two children, the eldest four years old and attending school, which makes her happy. Hoping to grow her business, she is requesting a loan amount of N80,000 to purchase more drinks and sachet to sell. Blessing says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks and sachet water to sell

loans.name: Georgina

texts.en:
Georgina sells retail items such as pantyhose, stockings, and socks in one of the markets in her home town. She has been running this enterprise for 12 years. She has invested about 100,000 Grivnyas in this business.

Georgina is seeking a loan of 11,000 Grivnyas to offer a better selection of merchandise ranging from cheaper brands to more exclusive and quality ones. Georgina can be characterized as a stable and solvent borrower. She has repaid all her previous loans without any delinquencies. 

She is married with two children. Her family lives in Mukachevo in western Ukraine.

loans.use: To invest in offering a better selection of merchandise

loans.name: Esohe

texts.en:
Esohe is a hardworking hairdresser. She styles hair and also sells hair extensions at retail prices to her customers in Benin City. Esohe hopes to expand her business in the future. She is requesting a loan in the amount of N30,000 to purchase more hair extensions to sell. 

Esohe is 30 years old and is married with a child. Her child is 12 years old and attends school. 

Esohe sends her thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more hair extensions to sell

loans.name: San Juan Group

texts.es:
Este comite se inicio mediante la iniciativa de la Señora Teodosia V., quien desidio despues de conocer el programa de mujeres emprendedoras desidio invitar a sus amigas del Barrio, quienes desidieron agruparse y formar el comite.

El comité se Denomina “San Juan“ están en el Quinto Ciclo con 16  integrantes, es un grupo que se destaca  en el barrio por ser muy unidas solidarias  y responsable entre ellas. 

Una de ellas, es la Sra María Graciela I. quien se dedica a la reventa de ropas, para este trabajo ella desde muy tempranas horas se moviliza y recorre para contactar con grandes comerciantes, de modo a conseguir ventajas en los precios y así obtener mayor ganancia. Una vez que ella cuenta con la mercaderias necesarias recorre hasta los lugares donde estan sus clientes y de esa forma ofrece sus mercaderias. El crédito solicitado fue para la compra de prendas de vestir en general como camisa remeras, pantalones y otros.
texts.en:
This committee was formed by Teodosia V., who lives at kilometer 7 in the San Juan neighborhood of Ciudad del Este. She met with her neighbors and friends to form the committee in this area. The committee is called “San Juan,“ and they are in their fifth loan cycle with 16 members. It is a group that stands out in the neighborhood for its members' unity, solidarity and responsibility toward each other. One of them, María Graciela I., re-sells clothing. For this work, she goes out very early and meets with large-scale sellers, so that she can obtain price advantages and earn higher profits. Once she has the merchandise she needs, she goes to the places where the customers are and offers her products. The loan requested is to purchase various types of clothing, such as shirts, pants, and others.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying merchandise

loans.name: Josefina Aurora

texts.es:
La Sra. Josefina tiene 37 años, esta casada con el Sr. Diego Gil Quiroz desde hace 10 años, tienen 2 hijas las cuales acuden a la escuela.

Juntos elaboran edredones y sabanas para camas. se dedican a esta actividad manufacturera desde hace 8 años. 

Requieren del prestamo para comprar fibra termica para elaborar los edredones debido a que el invierno se avesina y necesitan almacenar produccion de edredones para que se comercialize a las otras ciudades del pais ya que las ventas de estos se incrementan mucho en epoca de invierno.
texts.en:
Josefina is 37 years old. She has been married to Mr. Diego Gil Quiroz for 10 years. They have two daughters who are in school. Together they make comforters and sheets for beds. They have been manufacturing these for 8 years. They require the loan to purchase thermal fiber to make the comforters. Winter is approaching and they need to build an inventory of comforters so they can be sold in other cities in the country. The sales increase a lot during winter.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase thermal fibers for comforters

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of fertilizer to cultivate corn

loans.name: Jayasekara Kankanam

texts.en:
Jayasekara is a 52-year-old married woman with four children who lives in Yakabadda, Sri Lanka.

Jayasekara has her own tailoring business that her husband helps her with. She started this business seven years ago, so she has lots of experience as a tailor. Additionally, she considers herself to be hard-working which has helped the business be successful.

Jayasekara is asking for a 40,000 LKR loan from BRAC to help expand her business. She hopes to continue growing the business and improving her family life with increased profits.

Thank you for considering supporting this loan!

loans.use: To purchase additional cloth for her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a head of dairy cattle

loans.name: Loveth

texts.en: Loveth, a businesswoman who cooks and sells fufu (cassava dough) at retail prices, loves this business because of the one-on-one interaction that she has with her customers. She is requesting a loan NGN 50,000 to purchase more cassava to cook more fufu to sell, hoping to expand her business. As a hard working woman with the determination to excel, Loveth aspires to lift her business and family above poverty. A 35-year-old married mother of seven children, she says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more cassava to cook more cassava dough (fufu) to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase and sale of "pagnes"

loans.name: Bernard

texts.en: Bernard A. N. is twenty nine years old and married with a five-year-old child. His business is located along the road at Mlolongo, a busy area in Nairobi. He provides installation services for DS (digital satellite) TV, aerials, and free chanels to the local people. He also serves customers who are referred to him from different parts of the town. He says that this business is profitable despite the high cost of maintenance and he works very hard to keep it solvent. He will use his loan of Kes 50,000 to buy cables, decorders, receivers and dishes to grow his business. One day, he hopes to have a DSTV dealership, own rental houses to boost his income, and even to educate his child to university level. He is focused, ambitious, and self-motivated.

loans.use: to buy receivers, decorders, dishes and cables for his TV installation service.

loans.name: Rose Mary

texts.en: Rose Mary is a married woman with seven children who attend school. She lives and works in Mulago.  She rents a retail shop near the market in Kalerwe where she sells various household items. With the Ush 600,000 loan, she wants to purchase more sugar, salt, soap, exercise books, pencils, Vaseline and cooking oil. Her other source of income is selling fruit. She is also a tailor. The greatest challenge for her business is that clients make purchases on credit but then don't pay. She joined MCDT because she liked their methodology. Currently, five people live in her two-room house, which has no piped water or electricity. Her greatest monthly expense is food. Rose Mary hopes to buy a plot and build a house someday.

loans.use: To purchase sugar, soap and other items for her retail shop.

loans.name: Chandra

texts.en:
Chandra is a 53-year-old married woman with four children who lives with her husband in the town of Kiyanduwa in southern Sri Lanka. Her husband works at various odd jobs for employment, and also helps Chandra to cultivate tea. Her children also provide help in the business.

Chandra started this tea cultivation business about two years ago and has lots of experience in this trade. She has a good location and owns a half-acre of land, which helps generate income for her monthly family expenses. She uses her earnings from the tea cultivation for daily expenses as well as for those agricultural expenses related to cultivation.

Chandra is asking for a 40,000 LKR loan from BRAC to help further expand her tea-cultivation business. She hopes to earn extra money to manage her family expenses and keep her house nice without running into financial strain.

Thank you for considering supporting Chandra!

loans.use: To help further expand her tea-cultivation business

loans.name: Felicia

texts.en: Felicia is a widow with a 22-year-old child. She owns a grocery store which she loves because of the one-on-one interaction she has with her customers. Felicia hopes for a loan amount of NGN 70,000 to purchase more groceries to sell and to expand her business. As a hard-working woman with the determination to excel, she hopes to lift her business and family out of poverty. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries to sell

loans.name: Mujeres Virtuosas Group

texts.es:
Para la formación el presente comité inicio la Señora Sebastiana L. del Barrio San Rafael D. Ciudad del Este. Ella Contacto con sus vecinas y amigas para formar el comité en la Zona.
Actualmente el comite se encuentra trabajando para salir adelante con mucho ezperanza en salir adelante todas juntas, ellas tienen mucha ayuda D. los asesores D. la Fundación Paraguaya, en cuanto a capacitaciones y sesoramiento sobre sus actividades. 
La Señora Señora Sebastiana se dedica a la venta D. hamburguesas y gaseosas, para lo cual desD. ya muy tempranas horas se moviliza; para la compra D. los ingredientes necesarios para la hamburguesa, panificados, huevos, verduras, etc., al mismo tiempo D. controlar y recibir las bebidas que revenderá.
texts.en:
Ms. Sebastiana Leguizamon from the San Rafael neighborhood of Ciudad del Este started this committee. She contacted her friends and neighbors to form this committee in the area. Currently, the committee is working together with a lot of hope for success. They have a lot of help from the Fundacion Praguaya's advisors in regards to training and advice about their activities. Ms. Sebastiana works selling hamurgers and soda. She is on the move very early buying the ingredients needed for the hamburguers: bread, eggs, veggies etc., while managing and receiving the beverages she'll resell.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Acquiring ingredients such as meat, bread, vegetables and pasta.

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en: Rehema is a married woman with six children, three of whom are still in school. She lives in Mulago and works in Kalerwe Market, where she sells matoke at wholesale from her stall. With the UGX 300,000 loan, she wants to purchase more matoke. She gets the produce from Fort Portal in Western Uganda and travels the six-hour distance twice a week. She has been in the business for 12 years. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and electricity. The most challenging part of running her business is transportation. She owns a four-room house that she shares with four people. They have electricity but no piped water. Rehema hopes to be ale to pay for her children's education.

loans.use: To purchase matoke to sell from her stall.

loans.name: Chathurika

texts.en:
Chathurika is a 28-year-old married woman living in the town of Yakabadda, Sri Lanka with her two children.

Chathurika helps her husband in managing a floral shop that he owns. She uses the income from the family business to help support daily living expenses.

They have managed this shop for eight years now, and provide employment for two men in the village. Chathurika is known as a very honest and hardworking woman who is willing to help others in her community when needed.

Chathurika is seeking a 50,000 LKR loan from BRAC to improve her husband's floral business.

Thank you very much for taking the time to consider supporting this loan!

loans.use: To purchase materials and supplies for her husband's floral business

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en: Lucy is 42 and married with five children. She sells diesel fuel — a job she loves because of the one-on-one interaction she has with her customers. She hopes for a loan amount of NGN 70,000 to purchase more diesel to sell and to expand her business. As a hard-working woman with the determination to excel, she hopes to lift her business and family out of poverty. She is married with 5 children. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more diesel to sell

loans.name: Buena Fe 1,2 Group

texts.en:
Yusleny is the coordinator of her group Buena Fe (Good Faith), and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti) in general. Her group is located in the rural areas surrounding L. Romana, an area where the the economy is dominated by sugarcane agriculture and where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home here in a simple structure with her longterm partner and their child.

Yusleny is excited to be taking out her fourth loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business by ordering a new line of Avon beauty products, which she will order by catalog. She will use the profits to invest in her family by covering her necessities as well as investing in her long-term dream of owning her own home. 

She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: To buy a new line of Avon beauty products

loans.name: Jane

texts.en: Jane N. N. is fifty eight and married with five children between thirty and eighteen. Her business is located at Ngong, a busy market in Nairobi known as Home Base. She has been selling animal feed to farmers for the last three years. She says that this business is profitable but the major challenge is lack of funds to expand. She works very hard to keep her business doing well and will use her loan of Kes 80,000 to buy more animal feed to sell. Jane hopes to buy her own machines to make the feed herself and wants to be a market leader in this business.

loans.use: animal feed

loans.name: Dionicio

texts.es: El Señor Dionicio Gonzales es cliente a varios años de la Fundación Paraguaya, está casado con la señora Mirna Gricelda Giménez Verón que es de profesión costurera, son padres de dos hijos, están domiciliados en el Kilómetro siete Ciudad Nueva de Ciudad del Este, poseen su casa propia, el Señor Dionicio se dedica a la venta de carbón en toda la zona, solicito este crédito para la compra de una carga de camión de carbón, lo cual el lo envasa para su posterior venta, actualmente ya consiguió un importante crecimiento ya que son personas muy trabajadoras y honestas.
texts.en:
Dionicio Gonzales has been a client of the Fundación Paraguaya for several years. He is married to Mirna Gricelda Giménez Verón, a seamstress. They have two children. They live at kilometer 7 in Ciudad Nueva in Ciudad del Este. They have their own house. Dionicio sells charcoal all over the region. He is requesting this loan to buy a truckload of charcoal. He will package it for later sale. He has now made important progress because they are very hard-working and honest people.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To get charcoal, bags for the charcoal, and wire

loans.name: Kasfa

texts.en: Kasfa is a divorced woman with three children who attend school. She lives in Mulago but works in the Owino market, where she sells second-hand clothes six days per week. She has been in this business for 20 years and has no other source of income. With the UGX 1,000,000 loan, she hopes to purchase more second-hand clothing for sale. She owns a four-room house, which she shares with four people. Her house does not have electricity or piped water. She does not care for additional family members. Her greatest expenses are food and medication. Kasfa hopes to build her own house someday.

loans.use: To purchase second-hand clothing.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en: Mercy is 49 and married with four children. She sells firewood a — business she loves because of the one-on-one interaction with her customers. She hopes for a loan amount of NGN 80,000 to purchase more firewood to sell and to expand her business. As a hard working woman with the determination to excel, she hopes to lift her business and family above poverty. Mercy says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more fire woods to sell

loans.name: Dinusha

texts.en:
Dinusha is a 22-year-old married woman with two children, aged 4 and one-and-a-half. She lives with her family in the town of Henegama in southern Sri Lanka.

Dinusha helps her husband with his tea cultivation business on a half-acre piece of land that they own. From the income of the tea-cultivating business, Dinusha can pay her family's expenses.

Dinusha and her husband have been running this business for one year and have gained valuable experience from it. They also help out the community by providing local women with employment in picking the tea leaves.

Dinusha is seeking a 30,000 LKR loan from BRAC to help continue growth of her husband’s tea-cultivating business.

Thank you for taking the time to consider supporting this Sri Lankan loan!

loans.use: To buy agricultural materials her husband's tea-cultivation business

loans.name: Walliwala Gamage

texts.en:
Walliwala is a 47-year-old married woman who lives with her husband and one child in southern Sri Lanka.

Walliwala and her husband work together in a clothing business that they operate. They started the business ten years ago, so naturally they have developed good experience and become knowledgeable about running their shop. They are located in a prime location as well, which has helped them to operate.

Walliwala is seeking a 40,000 LKR loan from BRAC. She and her husband have successfully managed the business through their hard work, and they hope to expand even further with the help of this loan.

Thank you for taking the time to consider supporting this Sri Lankan loan!

loans.use: To buy supplies for her clothing shop

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en: Margaret is a married woman with three children, two of whom attend school. She lives in Kanyanya and sells dried fish from a rented stall in Mulago Market. With the Ush 500,000 loan, she hopes to purchase more dried fish from Lake Victoria to sell. She also sells cold drinks as she has a fridge in the market. She has been in this business for 13 years. Her greatest challenge is that the police confiscate her fish if it is too small to prevent illegal fishing. She owns a house with two rooms, which she shares with three people. They have electricity but no piped water. She takes care of two of her sisters. Her greatest expenses are school fees and food. She works seven days per week. Margaret hopes to build her own house someday.

loans.use: To purchase dried fish

loans.name: Leonor

texts.es:
El  señor Leonor M.  es casado, tiene  4 hijos, todos menores, en edad escolar. El se dedica al trasporte alternativo  hace más de 3 años.
Tiene casa propia. El proyecto de inversión es el mantenimiento de su vehículo y la compra de cubiertas y herramientas que le ayuden a mejorar el servicio de sus usuarios.

El  señor Leonor  es una persona muy activa, cuenta con un carácter muy agradable. Manifiesta que quiere mejorar la calidad de  su negocio ya que es la fuente de su ingreso. 
 Es un señor muy trabajador y con ganas de superación.
texts.en:
Leonor M. is married and has four minor, school age children. He has been working in alternative transportation for over three years. He has his own house. His project is to invest in the maintenance of his vehicle. He will also buy covers and tools that will help him improve customer service. Leonor is a very active person with a very pleasant personality. He says that he wants to improve the quality of his business because it is his source of income. He is a very hard-working man with the desire to improve.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Vehicle maintenance and to buy covers

loans.name: Blessing

texts.en: Blessing is 35 years old and married to a farmer. They have four children. She is happy selling groceries, foodstuffs and drinks and has been in this business for a long time. With the proceeds, she supports her family. She is requesting for a loan of NGN 60,000 to purchase more groceries, foodstuffs, and drinks to sell. Blessing hopes to see her grocery store grow into a big supermarket in the future. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries, foodstuffs and drinks to sell

loans.name: Zainabu

texts.en: Zeinabu K. is thirty years old, widowed, and has three children whom she hopes to give a good education. Her business is located in Kakamega, in the western part of Kenya. She has been selling cereals such as groundnuts, beans and wheat for the last four years to the local people. She says that this business is profitable and the major challenge she has is competition from other businesses of the same type. However, she works very hard to keep her business doing well. She is using her loan of KES 20,000 to buy more cereals to expand her business. She hopes to supply in wholesale when her business grows. She is very hardworking and self-motivated.

loans.use: to purchase wheat, beans, and groundnuts

loans.name: Mario

texts.es:
El  señor Mario   es casado, tiene 66  años, con  2  hijas.
Su taller de costura hace más de 15 años  montó gracias a un pequeño capital que había  ahorrado durante varios años. Anteriormente se dedicaba a la fabricación de carteras de cuero.
Quiere comprar la tela al por mayor, pues, así consigue más barato  y tiene un margen importante de ganancia, ademas queire adquirir accesorios para las cofecciones para este fin fue solicitado el crédito.
El  señor Mario   es una persona muy activa tiene un espíritu jovial, y cuenta con un carácter muy agradable por lo que muchas personas siempre están a su alrededor. Manifiesta que quiere mejorar su negocio ya que es la fuente de su ingreso.
