Él se esfuerza a lo máximo para mejorar su hogar, pero sin descuidarse del capital de su negocio por lo que considero que es una persona quien necesita de apoyo, ya sea económica y moralmente.
texts.en:
Mario is 66, married, and has two daughters. Thanks to a small amount of money that he saved over several years, he has had a sewing shop for over 15 years. He previously made leather purses. He wants to buy the fabric wholesale. That way he gets it cheaper, and he has a good margin of earnings. Also, he wants to get sewing accessories. That is why he requested the loan. Mario is a very active person with a jovial spirit. He has a pleasant personality, and he is always surrounded by lots of people. He says that he wants to improve his business because it is his source of income. He puts forth maximum effort to improve his home without taking money out of the business. He is a person who needs economic and moral support.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fabric, thread, buttons, and zippers

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en: Victoria is 52 years old, married and has 6 children. She has a farm where she plants cassava, pineapples and plantains. She is a hard-working woman who loves her farming business and wants to excel at it. She has been in this business for a long time.  Her husband is also a farmer and he also supports their household. Victoria needs a loan of NGN 60,000 to hire laborers to clear her farm for the next planting season. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to hire laborers to clear her farm

loans.name: Tenneh

texts.en:
Tenneh K., age 36, has been a LAPO, SL client for two years. As a credit union member, she has been in business for four years and has taken out three previous loans: she used the profit from these loans to open another provision store. 

She is asking for a loan of 2,000,000 Leones to expand her inventory of provisions, top-up cards, and drinks.

Tenneh is married and has two sons and a daughter. They are all in secondary school. She lives with her family in Murray town, an area of Freetown in the capital city of Sierra Leone. She helps support her family with the profit from her business.

With the assistance of LAPO, SL and Kiva lenders, Tenneh plans to use her new loan to purchase more goods and thereafter use her profit to better her life and that of her family.

loans.use: To expand her inventory of provisions, top-up cards, and drinks

loans.name: Pedro

texts.es:
Pedro  vive en la zona Villa Copacabana, de la ciudad de La Paz
	
Vive junto a su esposa y sus hijos, puesto que sus hijos son mayores de edad y por lo tanto formaron sus propias familias y se fueron a vivir en otras zonas.

Es propietario de un bus y es miembro del sindicato Eduardo Avaroa linea 2.


El crédito lo destinará a la adquisición de llantas para su movilidad y para la venta de llantas a medio uso, que es su otra actividad.
 
 
Es el segundo crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada lo califica para otorgarle el crédito.
texts.en:
Pedro lives in the Villa Copacabana area of the city of La Paz. He lives with his wife; his children are grown, have formed their own families, and moved to other locations. He owns a bus and is a member of the Line 2 Eduardo Avaroa syndicate. The loan is to get tires for his vehicle and for his other activity, selling used tires. This is his second loan with Impro. The completed evaluation qualifies him for the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy tires for his bus and for his business of selling tires

loans.name: Mario

texts.es:
El señor Mario M. vive en casa propia, en la zona de LimaniPata, ubicado en las afueras de la ciudad de La Paz, con su esposa la señora Graciela Tincuta y sus cuatro hijos.
El señor Mario trabaja como chofer de transporte publico en la ciudad de La Paz y su esposa es empleada de una empresa de reciclaje en esta ciudad, ingresos con los que mantienen a su familia.
El crédito será para la conclusión de obra gruesa en planta alta, para ampliar su vivienda y brindarles mejores condiciones de vida a sus hijos.
Esta es la quinta vez que solicita préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado la califican favorablemente y puede acceder  a un  crédito.
texts.en:
Mario Madani lives in his own house in the Limanipata region, which is located on the outskirts of the city of La Paz. He lives with his wife, Graciela Tincuta, and their four children. Mario works as a public transportation driver in the city of La Paz. His wife works for a recycling company in this city. They use their earnings to support their family. The loan will be to finish the rough work on the second story. This will expand their house and give his children better living conditions. This is the fifth time he has requested a loan. The completed socioeconomic analysis qualifies him for the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy cement, sand, iron, and bricks to expand the second story of his house

loans.name: Patience

texts.en: Patience is 44 years old, married, and has 2 children.  She has a farm where she plants cassava and plantains. She is a hard-working woman who loves her farming business and wants to excel at it. She has been in this business for a long time.  Her husband is a printer and he also supports their household. Patience needs a loan of NGN 60,000 to hire laborers to clear her farm for the next planting season. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To hire laborers to clear her farm land

loans.name: La Esperanza 1,2,3 Group

texts.en:
Biola is the coordinator of her group La Esperanza (The Hope), and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti) clients generally. Her group is located in the rural areas surrounding La Romana where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home here in a simple structure with her long-term partner and their two children.

Biola is excited to be taking this loan with Esperanza and she is excited at the opportunity to grow her business and have access to low cost capital. She plans to use this loan to invest in her clothing business by traveling to Santo Domingo to purchase blouses, sweaters, skirts and pants in the main market to sell at a profit in her community. Biola will use the profits to invest in her business and save towards being able to take larger loans and further invest in her business. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: Blouses, sweater, skirts, pants

loans.name: Zulma

texts.es:
La   señora  Zulma  es casado, tiene 42 años, con 2 hijas,  menores de edad.
La   señora   y su esposo  se dedican a la venta  de Ropas Semi nuevas  hace más de 7 años.
El crédito solicitado es para aumentar stock de mercaderías(compra de fardos de ropas semi-nuevas para la temporada otoño-invierno). 
La señora  tiene suerte de contar con el apoyo de toda la familia, gracias a eso cuenta con casa propia  y van incrementando sus ingresos,  por lo que considero que es una persona a quien debemos apoyar constantemente, ya sea económica y moralmente.
texts.en:
Zulma is 42, married, and has two minor daughters. She and her husband have been selling used clothes for over seven years. The requested loan is to increase their stock of merchandise (buy bundles of used clothes for the fall-winter season). She is lucky to have the support of her entire family. Thanks to this, she has her own house, and they are increasing their earnings. Therefore, she is a person we should continue to lend moral and economic support.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy used clothes for the fall-winter season

loans.name: Walake

texts.en: Walake W. lives and works in the Hédzranawoé district of Lomé, Togo. He sells traditional herbs and pots used to make la pâte, a staple grain product eaten with the majority of Togolese meals. Mr. W. sells his products in the Grand Marché of Hédzranawoé and has been in this business since 2001. He is now asking for his first loan from WAGES to resupply his stock. This loan will help Mr. W. support his business and his three children.

loans.use: Purchase of traditional herbs and pots for making local dish

loans.name: Las Intelectuales Y Responsables Group

texts.en:
Rosa is the coordinator of her group Las Intelectuales y Responsables (The Intelligent and Responsible Ones), and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti) clients generally. Her group is located in the rural areas surrounding La Romana, an area where the economy focuses around sugarcane and where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home here in a simple structure with her long-term partner and their three children.

Rosa is excited to be taking her second loan with Esperanza, a Kiva partner, after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business selling underwear, sheets and clothing by traveling to the capital to purchase her goods and then returning to her community to sell them at a profit. She will use the profits to cover the day-to-day needs of her children. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: Underwear, sheets and clothing

loans.name: Stella

texts.en: Stella is 44 years old, married, and has 2 children.  She has a farm where she plants cassava, yams and plantains. She is a hard-working woman who loves her farming business and wants to excel at it. She has been in this business for a long time.  Her husband is a policeman and he also supports their household. Stella needs a loan of NGN 60,000 to purchase more bags of fertilizer. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more bags of fertilizer

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of grocery items

loans.name: Eduardo

texts.es:
El Sr. Eduardo M. es propietario del Centro de Estudios Tecnológicos Actualizados, el mismo cuenta con la resolución del Ministerio de Educación y Culto numero 273/07 la cual habilita el instituto de formación profesional, la misma viene operando en nuestra ciudad y cuenta con todas las comodidades, aulas climatizadas, soporte técnico e informático.

    El mismo dirige el centro con su señora esposa la Profesora Maria Gloria Medina y el crédito solicitado a nuestra institución será invertido para compra de sofwart para el instituto. 
Solicitó el crédito para invertir en mejoras para el centro de estudios, en la compra de equipos de trabajo.
texts.en:
Sr. Eduardo M. is the proprietor of the Centro de Estudios Tecnológicos Actualizados (Center for Modern Technological Studies). The Center is authorized by the Ministry of Education and Culture’s resolution number 273/07, which enables the formation of professional institutes. It is operating in our city and has all necessary facilities, air-conditioned classrooms and technical and information-technology support.

Sr. M. directs the Center with his wife, Professor Maria Gloria Medina. The loan applied for from our institution will be invested in the purchase of software. He is also applying for the loan in order to invest in improving the Center through the purchase of equipment.

Translated from Spanish by Richard Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of software and equipment such as computers.

loans.name: Eufemia Teresa

texts.es:
Teresa tiene 49 años D. edad, es divorciada y vive con tres D. sus seis hijos en el sector Licapa del distrito D. Paiján, ubicado en la provincia D. Ascope, en la región La Libertad, a dos horas y media D. la ciudad D. Chiclayo, capital D. la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica a la ganadería desD. hace mas D. quince años. Ella empezó en esta actividad comprando ganado a una comerciante D. la sierra norte del país, terminó D. criar las vacas y empezó a comercializar la leche que estos producían, con mucho esfuerzo pudo adquirir mas animales y luego su ganado empezó a aumentar por si solo.

Actualmente la leche que obtenienen la comercializan con un acopiador D. la zona. Adicionalmente también venD. leche a sus vecinos. Esta actividad le provee los recursos económicos que necesita para sacar a su familia adelante.

Las clases escolares ya empezaron en todo el país y los padres D. los estudiantes ya se encuentran adquiriendo todos los útiles que sus menores hijos necesitan para llevar un buen año escolar, Teresa se encuentra solicitando a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito D. 700 nuevos soles que piensa invertir en la compra D. útiles escolares para sus hijos.

Teresa es una mujer bastante trabajadora y que lucha diariamente para hacer progresar a su familia. Su mayor anhelo es brindarle a sus hijos la oportunidad D. seguir estudiar. Ella ya ha trabajado anteriormente con Nuestra Institución y ha demostrado responsabilidad y puntualidad al momento D. asumir sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Teresa is 49 years old, divorced, and lives with three of her six children in the Licapa section, Paijan district. The district is located in the Ascope province, La Libertad region, two and a half hours from Chiclayo, which is the capital of the Lambayeque region. She has been in the cattle-raising business for more than fifteen years. She started by buying cattle from a business in Peru’s northern mountain range. She raised the cows and began to sell their milk. Working hard, she was able to buy more animals, and then her stock began to increase on its own. They sell the milk from these cows through a middleman in the area, and she also sells milk to her neighbors. This business gives her the financial resources to support her family. The school year has begun in Peru, and parents are now buying the supplies needed for their children to have a good year. Teresa is requesting a loan from Edpyme Alternativa, 700 new soles, with which she plans to buy school supplies for her children. Teresa is a hard-working woman who struggles every day to raise her family well. Her greatest dream is to offer her children the chance to continue studying. She has worked with our institution in the past, and has shown herself to be reliable and punctual when making her payments.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Jane Wilkie, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy school supplies for her children's education

loans.name: Edobor

texts.en: Edobor is 49 years old, married, and has 7 children.  He has a farm where he plants cassava, yams and plantains. He is a hard-working man who loves his farming business and wants to excel at it. He has been in this business for a long time.  Edobor needs a loan of NGN 70,000 to hire laborers to clear his farm. He says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To hire laborers to clear his farm

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of cloth for sewing

loans.name: Sabali Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe Sabali sont essentiellement des femmes mariées    qui ont en moyenne 40 ans,  3 enfants et  vivent la plupart dans des familles polygames à Hamdallaye  un des quartiers de la ville de Sikasso, 3ème région administrative du Mali.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle et sont à leur premier  prêt. 
Elles font la vente de wax, de poissons, de savons,  de chaussures et de pomme de terre.
Avec leur prêt, elles comptent acheter,  5 pièces de pagnes wax real, 2 paniers de poissons fumés, 5 cartons de savons (gros morceaux), 4 douzaines de paire de chaussures  en plastique et  3 sacs de 100kg de pomme de terre. 
Elles s’approvisionnent au grand marché de Sikasso ville et dans les villages avoisinants. Elles vendent  à domicile, dans les marchés et dans les quartiers de façon ambulante. Elles vendent au comptant souvent à crédit à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.
 Elles envisagent réaliser chacune un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 22.500 FCFA dont une partie sera utilisée pour l’épargne et les besoins de la famille, l’autre partie sera investie dans les activités.
texts.en:
The members of the group Sabali are essentially married women who average 40 years of age and three children living for the most part in polygamous families in Hamdallaye, a district in Sikasso City (3rd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). The women are collaborating with the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to satisfy the needs of their customers and are now on their first loan.  The group members sell wax pagnes (colorful West African cloth), fish, soaps, shoes, and potatoes.  With their loan, they intend to buy:  five bolts of Real wax pagnes, two baskets of smoked fish, five boxes of soap (large bars), four dozen pairs of plastic footwear, and three 100-kg sacks of potatoes.  Supplies are gotten at the big market of Sikasso City and in neighboring villages.  Sales are made out of the house, in the markets, and door-to-door in the districts.  Cash and sometimes credit are accepted from a customer base composed of men and women.  The group members each envision making an average monthly profit of 22,500 francs CFA.  Part of the profits will be put into savings and used for family needs.  The other portion will be invested into the businesses.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying a variety of goods

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Las Lucecitas (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El Banco comunal Las Lucecitas lo encontramos en la ciudad de Cuenca, siendo esta urbe la tercera en importancia en el Ecuador y declarada como Patrimonio Cultural de la Humanidad por su belleza arquitectónica, cautivando al turista nacional y extranjero.

 Maria Guadalupe tiene 54 años de edad, se divorció hace 22 años porque su esposo bebía mucho y la maltrataba a ella y a sus hijos, concibió cuatro  hijos que hoy se encuentran de 31, 29, 27, 22 años de edad, todos sus hijos son casados viven independientes excepto su tercera hija que tiene un niño  y con ella comparte la casa y también todos los gastos, se siente muy contenta porque cuenta con su casa propia aunque un poco pequeña que la construyó solo con su trabajo y esfuerzo.
 
María vende  frutas en un puesto en la feria libre de Cuenca,  esta actividad la realiza desde que tenía 11 años y solo hace 18 años cuenta con un puesto propio en el mercado y nos cometa que para obtener los puestos tuvieron que pelear mucho ya que no les querían entregar dichos puestos para que trabajen sin tener que recorrer todo el mercado.

Se encuentra en su tercer ciclo y fue invitada a formar parte de este grupo de mujeres que visionarias y trabajadoras  por su hermana, con el dinero de los créditos anteriores ha ido incrementando productos para su negocio y con este nuevo préstamo va a invertir en la compra de legumbres y frutas  como tomates, cebollas, brócoli, coliflor,  guineos, duraznos, naranja, naranjilla, entre otros para abastecer su negocio.

La meta de María Guadalupe  es hacer algunas  mejoras a su casa.

Karina T. es también socia del banco comunal Las Lucecitas, tiene 19 años y  vive en el  hermoso sector de Totoracocha junto a su esposo que por ahora están esperando un bebé,  está en el sexto mes de gestación. Aún no tienen casa propia y viven en casa de su suegra.

Su esposo trabaja en una empresa productora de yogurt mientras que ella se dedica a la venta de comida a las afueras de su casa labor que realiza hace un año gracias a su madre que le enseñó los secretos de la cocina y ya que cuenta con clientela fija, sus labores empiezan a partir de  las 3 p.m. hasta las 11 p.m. hora que se va a descansar para levantarse con nuevas energías para un día mas de labores.

Karina formó parte del banco comunal gracias a una amiga que la invitó a ser parte de éste selecto grupo de mujeres capaces de salir adelante con su familia. Con el credito solicitado va a comprar arroz, carnes, palillos, aliños  para preparar sus pinchos y menestras para ofrecer a su exigente clientela. Tiene como sueño principal  llegar a tener su casa propia que espera hacerlo realidad muy pronto.
texts.en:
The Las Lucecitas Communal Bank is in Cuenca, the third-largest city in Ecuador, set apart under the national trust because of its architectural beauty, which attracts domestic and foreign tourists. Maria Guadalupe is 54 years old. She got her divorce 22 years ago because her husband was a drinker and mistreated her and her children. She has four children, now 31, 29, 27, and 22 years of age. All of her children are married and living on their own, except for her third, a daughter who has a child. Maria shares her house and expenses with the daughter. She is very happy to have her own home, even if it is a little small, because she built it herself. Maria sells fruit in a stall in the Cuenca open market. She has been doing this since she was 11 years old. She has had her own stand only for the last 18 years. She tells us that they had to put up a fight to get a stand, since they didn’t want to turn over these stands to allow her to work without having to run around the entire market. She is now in her third cycle, having been invited by her sister to join this group of visionary, hard-working women. With previous loans she has increased stock for her business. She plans to use this new loan to buy produce, such as tomatoes, onions, broccoli, cauliflower, bananas, peaches, oranges, etc., to supply her business. Maria Guadalupe’s goal is to make improvements to her house. Karina T. is also a member of the Las Lucecitas communal bank. She is 19 years old and lives in the beautiful Totoracocha section with her husband. They are currently expecting a child, and she is in her sixth month. They do not yet have their own home, so live with her mother-in-law. Her husband works for a yogurt producer, and she sells food outside her home. She has been engaged in this business for a year now, thanks to her mother, who taught her the secrets of cooking. She now has regular customers, and begins work at 3 p.m., working until 11 p.m., at which time she stops to rest, so as to start the next day with renewed energy. Karina belongs to the communal bank thanks to a friend who invited her to join this select group of women who are successfully raising their families. With the loan requested she will buy rice, meat, sticks, and seasoning to prepare her skewers and stews for her demanding customers. Her greatest dream is to have her own home, which she hopes to make a reality very soon.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Jane Wilkie, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy tomatoes, onion, broccoli, cauliflower, bananas, peaches, oranges, and other fruits and vegetables to stock her business.  Also to buy meat, spices, sticks, to prepare her meals.

loans.name: Igbinosun

texts.en: Igbinosun has a farm where he plants cassava, yams and plantains. He is a hard-working man. He loves his farming business and he hopes to excel in his business. He has been in this farming business for a long time. He needs the loan amount of NGN 60,000 to hire laborers to clear his farm. He is 42 years old, married with 4 children. He says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to hire laborers to clear his farm

loans.name: San Nicolas Group

texts.es: El banco comunal denominado “San Nicolás” esta representado por la señora Carmen del Rosario y conformado D. 11 socias  D. las cuales todas son mujeres trabajadoras como lo demuestra la señora Carmen del Rosarios que se dedica a realizar sorteos en diferentes ferias D. la ciudad D. El Alto y a la venta D. cosmético por catálogos, ella es casada y tiene dos pequeños que no van a la escuela todavía, ella  vive en alquiler pero su mayor sueño es poder comprarse su casa para darles a sus hijos mayor comodidad, el destino del crédito es la compra D. materiales para su puesto D. rifas y para la compra D. un terrenito. El resto del grupo tienen diferentes actividades como la venta D. ropa, comida, pollos, venta D. cosméticos, venta D. artefactos  electrónicos, abarrotes y artesanías. En su mayoría radican en la misma zona san Nicolás D. ahí el nombre del grupo, en general las socias tienen mucha competencia con sus negocios, pero saben como salir adelante ofreciendo productos D. calidad y a bajo precio. El crédito será utilizado para el incremento D. su capital D. trabajo con la compra D. mercadería, materiales e insumos que permita incrementar sus ingresos para poder darles a sus familias una mejor calidad D. vida. El grupo esta emprendiendo su tercer ciclo con la institución demostrando responsabilidad y ganas D. salir adelante y crecer para el bienestar D. sus familias.
texts.en:
The San Nicolás Communal Bank is represented by Señora Carmen del Rosario. It consists of 11 members, all of whom are hardworking women like Carmen del Rosario, who sells lottery tickets in different markets in El Alto and cosmetics through catalogues (the cosmetics are in a catalogue which she shows to her customers). She is married and has two small children who don’t yet go to school. She rents her home, but her greatest dream is to be able to buy a house so that she can give her children a more comfortable place to live. Her loan will be used for the purchase of materials for a stall for selling lottery tickets and a small plot of land.

The rest of the group has different businesses such as the sale of clothing, food, chickens, cosmetics, electronic equipment, groceries, and crafts. Most of them are established in the San Nicolás area, hence the name of the group.

In general, the members bring a lot of competence to their businesses. They know how to get ahead offering quality products at low prices.

The loan will be used for increasing working capital through the purchase of inventory and raw materials that allow increases in their income which enable them to give their families a better quality of life. The group is embarking on its third loan cycle with this institution and has demonstrated responsibility and the desire to progress and increase the wellbeing of their families.

Translated from Spanish by Richard Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchasing food products (for resale)

loans.name: Sabougnouma Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe Sabougnouma (4 femmes mariées et 1 veuve) ont en moyenne 44 ans,  3 enfants et  vivent la plupart dans des familles polygames à Hamdallaye  un des quartiers de la ville de Sikasso, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle et sont à leur premier  prêt. 
Elles font la vente de condiments alimentaires, de tissus, de pagnes wax real,  des céréales et des tubercules. 
Avec leur prêt, elles comptent acheter, 3 paquets de condiments, 5 rouleaux de tissus, 5 pièces  de pagnes wax  real, 200kg de riz et 7 sacs de 100kg d’ ignames. 
Elles s’approvisionnent au grand marché de Sikasso ville et dans les villages avoisinants. Elles vendent à domicile, dans les marchés et dans les quartiers de façon ambulante. Elles vendent au comptant souvent à crédit à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.
 Elles envisagent réaliser chacune un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 20.000FCFA dont une partie sera utilisée pour l’épargne et les besoins de la famille, l’autre partie sera investie dans les activités.
texts.en:
The members of the Sabougnouma group (four married women and a window) average 44 years of age and three children and are living for the most part in polygamous families in Hamdallaye, a district of Sikasso City (3rd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They collaborate with the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to satisfy the needs of their customers, and this is their first loan. They sell condiments, fabrics, “pagnes” [traditional fabrics for wrap clothing], cereals and tubers. With the loan they plan to purchase 3 packs of condiments, five bolts of fabric, 5 pieces of Real wax “pagnes,” 200 kg (440 lbs) of rice and seven 100-kg (220 lbs) bags of yams. They purchase their stock at the big market of the town of Sikasso and in the nearby villages. They sell out of the house, at the market and door-to-door in town. They sell for cash, and often on credit, to a customer base composed of both women and men The group members each envision making an average monthly profit of 20,000 Central African Francs. Part of the profits will be put into savings and used for family needs. The other part will be invested into the business.

Translated from French by Ekaterina Sukhanova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing various articles (for resale)

loans.name: Cesar

texts.es: César, a sus 41 años, se dedica a la agricultura, y junto a él comparte su vida, su esposa, Maritza de 41 años y sus 3 hijos, en el que viven en su casa propia, ubicado en una zona turística de la selva central del Perú. Orgulloso del trabajo que realiza,porque le gusta los retos y vencer las adversidades que se le presentan en el camino, es por eso que lleva 5 años dedicado a cultivar frutas cítricas, palta, plátanos, carambola y cacao en sus propias tierras y  junto a su esposa que la ayuda en esta labor, al igual que sus hijos, que eventualmente lo apoyan en el trabajo. Su actividad le es rentable,  porque gracias a las ganancias que obtiene, puede cubrir la educación de sus hijos, que es lo más importante para César, siendo la mejor herencia que le puede dejar. Es así que ha logrado comprar dos hectáreas de terreno, en donde piensa plantar café y bananas, para que así pueda tener una mayor producción de éstos frutos más adelante. Este es su quinto crédito con MFP, y del que espera concretar sus proyectos, además conoce bien la metodología de trabajo que realiza su grupo comunal y por ello se ha comprometido en ser el encargado del buen desarrollo de este grupo. Entretanto solicita, mil quinientos soles para invertirlo en la compra de varios sacos de abono, y contratar los servicios de tres operarios, para el mantenimiento y limpieza de sus tierras a cultivar.
texts.en:
César, age 41, is a farmer. He shares his life with his wife, 41 year old Maritza, and their three children. They live in their own house, which is located in a tourist area in the central jungle of Perú. He is proud of the work he does because he likes challenges and overcoming the adversities he finds along the way. That is why he has been growing citrus fruit, avocados, star fruit, and cocoa beans on his land for five years. His wife helps him, and his children sometimes help with the work. This activity is profitable for him. Thanks to the earnings he gets, he is able to cover his children’s educational expenses. This is the most important thing to César because it is the best inheritance that he can leave them. He has been able to buy two hectares of land, where he plans to plant coffee and bananas. That way he will be able to have better fruit production later on. This is his fifth loan with MFP. He will use the loan to firm up his projects. He knows very well how his communal bank works. Therefore, he has promised to be in charge of the good development of this group. Meanwhile, he is requesting 1,500 PEN to buy several sacks of fertilizer. He will also contract the services of three workers to maintain and clean the land where he grows his crops.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fertilizer and hire three workers to clean and cultivate his banana and coffee fields

loans.name: Alicia

texts.es:
La Sra. Alicia es comerciante tiene 44 años de edad, esta juntado con el Sr. Raul Cristaldo más de 10 años quien es constructor,  tienen dos hijos: Jhonatan de 6 años y Ester de 5 años,  viven en Zarocaro a 10km. de la ciudad de Coronel Oviedo.
 La Sra. Alicia tiene una Despensa-Carnicería en su casa hace 5 años, es el único negocio a un km. a la redonda, tiene una clientela formada de gente humilde y trabajadora.
Ella administra su negocio  y la educación de sus hijos con mucho sacrificio ya que su marido trabaja fuera de la ciudad y las visita una ves al mes. 
Comenta la satisfacción de obtener apoyo crediticio y la confianza de la Fundación Paraguaya, que con dicho crédito realizo compras de carne vacuno y pollo ya que estos productos consigue sólo al contado y con mejores precios en cantidad.
texts.en:
Mrs. Alicia is a 44 year-old merchant. She and her partner, Mr. Raul Cristaldo, have been together for over 10 years and have two children; 6 year-old Jhonatan and 5 year-old Ester. He is a construction worker, and they live in Zorocaro, located 10 km from the city of Coronel Oviedo. For the past 5 years, Mrs. Alicia has operated a grocery/meat shop out of her home. It is the only business within a square kilometer, and her clientele is made up of humble, hardworking people. She tends to her business and her children’s education solely, since her husband works out of the city and only gets to visit them once a month. She feels great satisfaction at obtaining support via the loan and the trust of the Fundación Paraguaya, since this loan has allowed her to purchase beef and poultry. These products are only available for with cash, and she gets better pricing when purchasing in larger quantities.

Translated from Spanish by Maya Wisnievitz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of beef and poultry

loans.name: Keneya Kadi Group

texts.fr:
Les six membres du groupe Keneya Kadi sont essentiellement des femmes mariées  ayant  une moyenne d’âge de 31ans,  3 enfants et vivant la plupart dans des familles monogames à Sanoubougou  II un des quartiers de la ville de Sikasso, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle et sont à leur  deuxième prêt solidaire après avoir correctement remboursé le premier. 
Elles font la vente de tissus,  de chaussures,  de la restauration et de la viande. 
 Avec leur nouveau prêt, elles comptent acheter, 5 rouleaux de tissus, 4 douzaines de paires de chaussures, 1 sac de 100kg de riz, 3 paquets de condiments pour la restauration et 3 petits ruminants (pour les abattre et vendre leur viande). 
Elles s’approvisionnent au marché de Sikasso ville et les villages avoisinants.  Elles vendent dans les différents marchés de Sikasso, dans les quartiers de la ville et à domicile. Elles vendent au comptant, souvent à crédit à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.
 Elles envisagent réaliser chacune un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 22.500 FCFA dont une partie sera utilisée pour l’épargne et les besoins de la famille, l’autre partie sera investie dans les activités.
texts.en:
The six members of the Keneya Kadi group are for the most part married, and on average are 31 years old with three children. Most live in monogamous families in the Sanoubougou II neighborhood of Sikasso, in the third administrative region of the Republic of Mali. They collaborate with the Soro Yiriwaso MFI to satisfy their customers’ needs and are requesting a second group loan, having correctly reimbursed the first. They retail pieces of cloth, shoes, food preparations and meat. With their new loan they will buy: 5 bolts of cloth, 4 dozen pairs of shoes, one 100-kilo bag of rice, 3 packages of condiments for food preparations and 3 small ruminants (to butcher and sell the meat). They get their supplies from the Sikasso market and in neighboring villages. They sell their products in the different markets in Sikasso, in the town neighborhoods, and they also do home delivery. They sell for cash but often on credit to a customer base of both men and women. They hope to reach average monthly earnings of 22,500 FCFA each, of which part will be devoted to savings and family needs, and the remainder reinvested in the business activities.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy various products

loans.name: Sariyamou Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe Sariyamou sont essentiellement des femmes mariées  ayant en moyenne  38 ans, 5 enfants et vivant la plupart dans des familles monogames à Sanoubougou II un des quartiers de la ville de Sikasso, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle et sont à leur  premier prêt.
Elles font la vente de  bois de chauffe, de l’encens, des tubercules, de la restauration et  des articles  divers de boutique.
Avec leur nouveau prêt, elles comptent acheter, 1chargement de camionnette en bois de chauffe,  10kg de guénni, 3 types de parfums, 20 bouteilles  vides pour l’encens, 8 sacs de 100kg de tubercules, 1sac de 100kg de riz, 5 paquets de condiments pour la restauration et 5 colis de divers articles d’étalage. 
Elles s’approvisionnent au marché de Sikasso ville et les villages avoisinants.
Elles vendent au marché de Sanoubougou, dans les autres quartiers de la ville de Sikasso et à domicile. Elles vendent au comptant à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.
Elles envisagent réaliser chacune un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 25.250 FCFA dont une partie sera utilisée pour l’épargne et les besoins de la famille, l’autre partie sera investie dans les activités.
texts.en:
The members of the Sariyamou group are for the most part married, and on average are 38 years old with five children, living in monogamous families in the Sanoubougou II neighborhood of Sikasso, in the third administrative region of the Republic of Mali. They collaborate with the Soro Yiriwaso MFI to satisfy their customers’ needs and are requesting a first group loan. They retail firewood, incense, root tubers, food preparations and various store items. With their new loan they will buy: one pickup load of firewood, 10 kilos of guéni (root used to make incense), 3 different types of perfume, 20 empty incense containers, eight 100-kilo bags of root tubers, five packages of condiments for food preparations, and five packages of various store display items. They get their supplies from the Sikasso market and in neighboring villages. They sell their products in the Sanoubougou market, in the other neighborhoods of Sikasso, and they also do home delivery. They sell for cash to a customer base of both men and women. They hope to reach average monthly earnings of 25,250 FCFA each, of which part will be devoted to savings and family needs, and the remainder reinvested in the business activities.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy various products

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of peanuts and other products

loans.name: Evarista Del Carmen

texts.es:
La señora Evarista del Carmen R. V., tiene la edad de 62 años vive en el Barrio Pilas Orientales es casada y su esposo es comerciante, ellos tiene un hijo mayor de edad, ellos son agricultores desde hace 13 años.

Iniciaron sus plantaciones de frutos,  gracias al esfuerzo de su esposo e hijo, Evarista solicita de un préstamo para la compra de materiales vegetativos, insumos y fertilizantes, uno de los principales problemas a los que se ha enfrentado, ha sido la falta de agua potable que no abastece a la zona, esta inversión les traería el capital necesario, para la compra de un tanque de almacenamiento y/o la instalación de un sistema de riego en el terreno, mejorándole día a día el desarrollo de su producción.
texts.en:
Mrs. Evarista del Carmen R. is 62 years old, lives in the neighborhood of Barrio Pilas Orientales, and is married to a merchant. They have an adult son and they have been farmers for 13 years. They started their fruit orchard thanks to the efforts of her husband and their son. They are asking for a loan to help them purchase vegetative materials, consumables and fertilizers. One of the main challenges they’ve encountered is the lack of potable water where they live. This investment could provide them with the necessary capital to purchase a water tank and/or the installation of an irrigation system in their field, improving day to day the development of their products.

Translated from Spanish by Maya Wisnievitz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of vegative materials and fungicide

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es:
Elizabeth tiene 55 años, es separada y tiene dos hijos ya independizados, vive junto a su padre en el sector Manco Capac del distrito de Paiján, ubicado en la provincia de Ascope de la región la Libertad, a dos horas y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Desde hace más de dos años tiene instalada en su vivienda una bodega en donde ofrece a sus clientes, golosinas, abarrotes y bebidas. Ella empezó el negocio vendiendo golosinas y poco a poco fue ampliandolo con otros productos. Actualmente se vale de el para agenciarse de ingresos económicos que le permitan solventar sus gastos personales y velar por su padre que ya es una persona mayor.

Este negocio tiene mucha acogida en la zona ya que se encuentra alejada del centro de la ciudad y su negocio le provee a sus vecinos de productos de uso diario. Elizabeth desea ampliar su establecimiento con la compra de un andamio y con la adquisición de bebidas. Por este motivo ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 700 nuevos soles que le permitan lograr su objetivo.

Elizabeth es una mujer alegre y bastante trabajadora. Su mayor anhelo es progresar como empresaria para darle a su padre una mejor calidad de vida. Ella ya ha trabajado anteriormente con Nuestra Institución y ha demostrado ser una cliente puntual y responsable con sus pagos.
texts.en:
Elizabeth is 55 years old, is separated and has two children who are adults. She lives with her father in the Manco Capac sector in the Paiján district located in the Ascope province in the Libertad region, two and a half hours from the city of Chiclayo, the capital of the Lambayeque region. For more than two years, she has had a shop in her house where she offers her customers candy, groceries and drinks. She began the business selling candy and gradually expanded it with other products. Currently, she uses the income from agencies to pay her personal expenses and take care of her father who is elderly. This business is very welcome in the area since it can be found far from the center of the city and her business provides her neighbors with products for daily use. Elizabeth wishes to expand her establishment with the purchase of a scaffold and with the acquisition of drinks. For this reason, she has seen fit to request a loan of 700 soles from Edpyme Alternativa which will allow her to achieve her goal. Elizabeth is a happy and hard-working woman. Her greatest desire is to progress as an entrepreneur so she can give her father a better quality of life. She has already worked previously with our Institution and has proved to be a client who is punctual and responsible with her payments.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase drinks and a scaffold to expand her business.

loans.name: Bakary

texts.fr:
Monsieur Bakary Traoré  est marié à deux femmes, père de 6 enfants ,il est né vers 1977 à Tiébiziédougou un des villages de la préfecture de Kadiolo, 3eme région administrative du Mali. Il vit dans une famille polygame avec ses épouses et leurs enfants à Kadiolo /Tiébiziédougou.
Il est commerçant  depuis 7 ans en ayant comme créneau la vente de céréales et  des  articles divers  de boutique. Expérimenté en raison des années d’activité, il le fait avec beaucoup de réussite. 
Il est à sa première collaboration avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso.  
Il compte acheter avec son prêt, deux tonnes de maïs sur place à Tiébiziédougou et dans les villages avoisinants Kadiolo. Il vend au comptant, souvent à crédit (en gros et en détail) à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes. 
Il envisage de réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 50.000 FCFA dont une partie sera utilisée pour augmenter le fonds de commerce et l’autre partie sera mise en épargne car il  ambitionne construire une maison à usage d’habitation à Kadiolo ville.
texts.en:
Mr. Bakary Traoré has two wives and is the father of six children. He was born around 1977 in Tiébiziédougou, one of the villages in the Kadiolo Prefecture, in the 3rd administrative region of Mali. He lives in a polygamous family with his wives and children in Kadiolo/Tiébiziédougou. He has been a merchant for the past seven years, specialising in the sale of grain cereals and various shop items. After years of acquiring experience, he enjoys much success in what he does. This is his first collaboration with the Soro Yiriwaso MFI. With the loan he wants to buy two tons of corn, locally in Tiébiziédougou and in neighboring Kadiolo villages. He sells for cash and often for credit (both wholesale and retail) to a customer base of men and women. He hopes to reach average monthly earnings of 50,000 FCFA, of which part will be used to increase his working capital and the rest put into savings. His ambition is to build a dwelling in the town of Kadiolo.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy grain cereals

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Supply her store with merchandise

loans.name: Neyva

texts.es:
Neyva es socia del Banco Comunal Las Margaritas.
Neyva es soltera, tiene 27 años y tiene un hijo, Neyva viaja a las diferentes ferias en donde vende pollos para recria y de las ferias compra quesos que vende en la ciudad de Lima.
Necesita un préstamo de 900 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de pollos.
Los sueños de Neyva es salir adelante, ser profesional y tener un minimarket.
texts.en:
Neyva is a member of "Las Margaritas" communal bank. Neyva is 27 years old and single, and she has one child. Neyva travels to various markets where she sells young chickens to be raised, and she also buys cheeses which she sells in the city of Lima. She needs a loan of 900 Peruvian soles, which she will invest in purchasing chickens. Neyva's dreams are to get ahead, be a professional and have a mini-market.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying chickens

loans.name: Wilber

texts.es:
Wilber es socio del Banco Comunal Las Margaritas.
Wilber es soltero y tiene 23 años, Wilber hace bellos tejidos en telar como tapices, además realiza bordados, sus productos los envía a la ciudad de Lima.
Wilber necesita un préstamo de 900 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de hilos, lanas.
Los sueños de Wilber son salir adelante y exportar sus productos directamente.
texts.en:
Wilber is a member of "Las Margaritas" communal bank. Wilber is 23 years old and single. He creates beautiful textiles such as wall hangings, and he also does embroidery. Wilber sends his products to the city of Lima. Wilber needs a loan of 900 Peruvian soles, which will be invested in buying various kinds of wool and thread. Wilber's dreams are to get ahead and to export his products directly.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing wool and thread

loans.name: Dramane

texts.fr:
Monsieur Dramane Koné est marié à deux femmes et père de 5 enfants (tous des garçons). Il est âgé de 33 ans et vit dans une famille polygame à Tiébiziédougou, un des villages de la préfecture de Kadiolo, 3eme région administrative du Mali.  
Dramane fait le commerce depuis maintenant  8 ans avec la  vente de céréales. Expérimenté en raison des années d’activité, il le fait avec beaucoup de réussite.
Il est à sa première collaboration avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso.  
Il compte acheter avec son prêt, 2 tonnes et demi maïs à Tiébiziédougou et dans les villages avoisinants  Kadiolo.  Il vend au comptant souvent à crédit (en gros et en détail) à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes. 
Il envisage de réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 50.000FCFA dont une partie sera utilisée pour augmenter le fonds de commerce et l’autre partie sera mise en épargne dans le souci d’aménager un magasin.
texts.en:
Mr. Dramane Koné has two wives and is the father of five children (all boys). He is 33 years old and lives in a polygamous family in Tiébiziédougou, one of the villages in the Kadiolo Prefecture, in the 3rd administrative region of Mali. He has been in the retail business for the past eight years, selling grain cereals. He meets with great success in his activity due to the years of accumulated experience. This is his first collaboration with the Soro Yiriwaso MFI. With the loan he wants to buy 2 ½ tons of corn, locally in Tiébiziédougou, and in neighboring Kadiolo villages. He sells for cash and often for credit (both wholesale and retail) to a customer base of men and women. He hopes to reach average monthly earnings of 50,000 FCFA, of which part will be used to increase his working capital and the rest put into savings, with the desire to open a store.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy grain cereals

loans.name: Ulpiano

texts.es:
Ulpiano es socio del Banco Comunal Las Margaritas.
Ulpiano es soltero y tiene 43 años, Ulpiano tiene una mototaxi con el cual realiza transporte de pasajeros.
Ulpiano necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en el mantenimiento del carro.
Los sueños de Ulpiano son tener mas ahorros y comprar mas carros.
texts.en:
Ulpiano is a member of the Las Margaritas Communal Bank. Ulpiano is 43 and single. Ulpiano has a “mototaxi” (three wheeled motorized vehicle) that he uses to transport passengers. Ulpiano needs a loan for 1,000 PEN, which he will use for maintenance on his car. Ulpiano’s dreams are to have more savings and to buy more cars.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For maintenance on his car

loans.name: Vilma

texts.es:
Vilma es socia del Banco Comunal Las Margaritas.
Vilma es soltera, tiene 45 años y 4 hijos, Vilma tiene un puesto en el mercado Magdalena en donde vende comida, actividad que realiza todos los días.
Vilma necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de arroz, azúcar.
Los sueños de Vilma son tener ahorros y tener una tienda en su casa.
texts.en:
Vilma is a member of the communal bank "Las Margaritas." Vilma is 45 years old and single, with 4 children. She has a stand in the Magdalena market where she works every day selling food. Vilma needs a loan of 1000 Peruvian soles, which she will invest in buying rice and sugar. Vilma's dreams are to accumulate some savings and to have a shop in her home.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying rice and sugar

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of charcoal

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es:
La Señora Francisca tiene 48 años D. edad ella vive con su esposo y sus 5 hijos los cuales son todos pequeños con edades D. 15, 10, 8, 5, y 2 años. Ellos viven en inmediaciones D. Viloma GranD. en una zona agrícola D. la Zona D. Sipe-Sipe D. la provincia D. Quillacollo.

La Señora Francisca es una señora que con su familia que se dedica a la agricultura,  y a la producción D. leche cruda, la señora y su familia recién pudieron adquirir su pequeña propiedad  con mucho esfuerzo, su esposo no pueD. conseguir un trabajo que le genera más ingreso pues sufrió un accidente y tiene problemas en las articulaciones y no pueD. realizar muchas actividades, razón por la cual solo se dedica a cultivar en su terreno, ahí mismo es donD. tienen dos ambientes  pequeños, en este ambiente tienen sus dormitorios, la familia cocina en fogón usando leña, y ollas D. barro. La señora Francisca es una señora que busca dar siempre una mejor vida a sus hijos, una mejor educación, salud y alimentación, pues nunca recibió ella nada, pues sus padres la abandonaron desD. los 12 años y empezó trabajando en el barrio ayudado a las vecinas en la limpieza y actividades agrícolas, D. ese modo aprendió del oficio y ahora, pueD. ganar su propio dinero.
  
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra D. una cabeza D. ganado lechero y así poder aumentar la producción D. leche, y un poco D. semilla D. ese modo incrementar más sus ingresos y poder ofrecer a su familia un mejor nivel D. vida.
texts.en:
Francisca is 48 years old and lives with her husband and her 5 children, who are all still young, aged 15, 10, 8, 5 and 2. They live near Viloma GranD., in an agricultural area of Sipe-Sipe, in Quillacollo province. Francisca works in agriculture together with her family, and they also produce raw milk. With great effort, she and her family were recently able to acquire a small property. Her husband has been unable to obtain work that would generate more income, because he has suffered an accident and has problems with his joints, so he is limited in his activities. For this reason, he only works cultivating his land. The family has two small buildings on the land, which incluD. their bedrooms. They cook on an open fire using wood and clay pots. Francisca is a woman who is always seeking to proviD. a better life for her children, including better food, health and education. However, she herself has never received anything, since her parents abandoned her when she was 12, and she began working in the neighborhood, helping her neighbors with the cleaning and farm work. Through this she learned the traD. of farming, and now she can earn her own money. She is requesting this loan to buy a milk cow to increase her milk production, as well as some seeds, so that she can increase her income and proviD. her family with a better standard of living.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying a milk cow

loans.name: Rosa Cristina

texts.es:
La señora Rosa es comerciante, su negocio básicamente es sobre la compra y venta de pescado, distribuye en ciudades importantes del país como Manta y Guayaquil , se podría decir que el negocio es netamente familiar ya que día a día  laboran y sacan adelante esta interesante  microempresa ella y su hermana

En el negocio llevan 15 años, doña Rosa  aprendió con su papa ya que él también se dedica a este negocio desde hace muchos años,  para sacar adelante el negocio realizan varias compras sistemáticamente , en  cada compra que realizan invierten entre 400 y 500 dólares, se abastecen del producto  directamente en el puerto de Manta, las venta en Quito las hace su  hermana quien viaja a vender cada cierto tiempo dependiendo de la oferta y demanda que se exige en esta gran ciudad,  en cada venta que realizan las ganancias son aproximadamente del 100% de la inversión hecha.

El sueño más grande de Rosa  es poder seguir en su negocio,  el dinero que está solicitando es para poder seguir incrementando  su negocio y brindar a los consumidores y expendedores del producto lo mejor.
texts.en:
Rosa is a merchant. Her business is basically about buying and selling fish. She distributes it to important cities in the country like Manta and Guyayaquil. You could say that the business is strictly a family business. This interesting small businesswoman and her sister work day to day to get ahead. She has been in the business for 15 years. Rosa learned from her father because he has also been in this business for many years. To get the business ahead, they make several systematic purchases. They invest between 400 and 500 dollars in each purchase. They stock up on the product directly in the port of Manta. Her sister sells in Quito. Her sister travels there to sell every so often depending on the sales and the demand in this great city. In each sale they earn approximately 100% of what they invested. Rosa’s biggest dream is to be able to continue in her business. The money she is requesting is to be able to continue increasing her business. It is to offer the best to the consumers and vendors of the product.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fish

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of motor oil

loans.name: Luz Isabel

texts.es:
Isabel es socia del Banco Comunal Las Margaritas.
Isabel tiene 19 años y es soltera, Isabel vende cosméticos por catálogos que ofrece a amigos y familiares, además Isabel estudia Gastronomía.
Isabel necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de cosméticos.
Los sueños de Isabel es tener un restaurante y hotel.
texts.en:
Isabel is a member of the communal bank "Las Margaritas." She is 19 years old and single. Isabel sells cosmetics from a catalog, which she offers to friends and family members. She is also a student in the field of gastronomy. Isabel needs a loan of 1000 Peruvian soles, which she will invest in buying cosmetics. Isabel's dreams are to have a restaurant and hotel.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying cosmetics

loans.name: Alina

texts.es:
La señora Alina tiene 42 años está casada con el señor Silverio y tienen 4 hijos D. (12, 9,4 y 3) años, son una familia D. escasos recursos económicos ya que actualmente no tienen casa. Viven en la casa D. sus padres donD. solo tienen 2 habitaciones para toda la familia.

Su principal actividad es la producción D. la leche cruda actualmente solamente cuenta con 4 cabezas D. ganado lechero debido a que está empezando con dicha actividad. El esposo trabaja en el servicio D. la construcción, son muy responsables y dedicados a su trabajo ya que ambos trabajan duro con la meta D. tener una casa propia.

El préstamo será destinado para la compra D. una cabeza D. ganado lechero, y D. esta manera incrementara la cantidad producida e incrementara el nivel D. ingresos.

Entre sus sueños y metas esta tener una casa propia con habitaciones para cada uno D. sus hijos y D. esta manera poder estar mas cómodas toda la familia, también su meta es crecer en cuanto a la producción D. leche y que 4 hijos puedan tener una carrera profesional.
texts.en:
Alina is 42 years old and has 4 children, aged 12, 9, 4 and 3 with her husband Silverio. They are a family with few economic resources, and they currently do not have a home of their own. They live in her parents' house, which only has 2 bedrooms for the entire family. Alina's main work is producing raw milk. She currently has only 4 milk cows, since she is just starting out with this activity. Her husband works in construction. They are very responsible and dedicated to their work; both are working hard with the goal of obtaining a house of their own. The loan will be used to buy another milk cow, thus increasing the amount of milk produced and raising their income level. Among their goals and dreams are having a house of the their own with rooms for each of their children, thus allowing the family to be more comfortable. Other goals are expanding their milk production and seeing their 4 children pursue professional careers.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying a dairy cow

loans.name: Josefa Del Carmen

texts.es: Josefa Del Carmen tiene 42 años de edad. Doña Josefa tiene 4 hijos. La actividad económica de Doña Josefa es una pulpería además posee otro negocio como la elaboración y venta de tortillas ella es muy responsable con su cuotas de pago por lo que siempre esta activa con ambos negocios, aunque es muy difícil ya que el cansancio de todo el día al realizar estas tareas le perjudica mucho en su salud, pero no se rinde pues ambos negocios le proporcionan el alimento diario. El financiamiento es para capital de trabajo ya que con esto pude comprar productos como frutas, golosinas, y productos de consumo diario. Su deseo es ampliar su negocio con mayor mercadería.
texts.en:
Josefa Del Carmen is 42 years of age. Doña Josefa has 4 children. Her business is a small convenience store. In addition she has another business making and selling tortillas.

She is very responsible about making her payments. This is why she is always busy with both businesses. It is very tiring to carry out all her tasks every day, and this has harmed her health a lot. She doesn’t give up, however, since both businesses provide her with her daily bread.

The loan is for working capital. With it she will be able to purchase products such as fruits, sweets, and other products that are consumed daily. Her wish is to enlarge her business with a bigger inventory.

Translated from Spanish by Richard Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Idalina

texts.es:
La Sra. Idalina T. Cáceres , ella tiene 35 años de edad, esta juntada con el Sr. Osvaldo Apodaca hace ya 5 años, tienen 1(una) hija de dos años juntos.
La Sra. Idalina es comerciante hace 10 años, comenzó con una pequeña mercería en su casa y a la ves salía a vender en moto entre sus amigas y conocidas, luego se armó de valor para montar su negocio en el Mercado Municipal de Coronel Oviedo así pudo abrir su propio negoco donde vende varios tipos de artículos como de librería, ropas, mercería en general.
 La misma consiguió alquilar un local dentro del mercado y formar allí su clientela.
 Comenta que le va muy bien ya que consiguió apoyo Crediticio en la Fundación Paraguaya y así pudo  surtir mejor su negocio.
El crédito solicitado en esta ocasión fue para la compra de varios artículos para su negocio como uniformes escolares, mochilas o bolsas escolares, varios tipos de papeles y ademas útiles escolares
texts.en:
Sra. Idalina T. Cáceres is 35 years old and has been married to Sr. Osvaldo Apodaca for five years. They have a daughter who is two years old.

Sra. Idalina has been a merchant for ten years. She started with a small sewing supply shop in her house and later traveled on her motorcycle to sell to friends and acquaintances. Idalina later had the courage to move her business to the Coronel Oviedo Municipal Market, where she sells several types of items such as books, clothing, and sewing supplies. She continues to rent her location at the market where she establishes her clientele. Idalina says she is doing very well. After receiving financial support from Fundación Paraguaya, she was able improve her business inventory.

The loan she is requesting on this occasion will be used to buy various items for her business such as school uniforms, backpacks, school bags, various types of paper, and school supplies.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase school uniforms, backpacks, school bags, various types of paper, and school supplies

loans.name: Sebastiana Narcisa

texts.es:
La señora Sebastiana M. es casada,  tiene 5 hijos ella se dedica a vender artesanía como aretes anillos en acero, las ventas mas prosperas la hace en temporada de fiestas, Sebastiana sale a vender  junto a su esposo, en feriados su punto clave de ventas es  en  Salinas (Playa en la provincia de Guayas- Ecuador) se abastece de productos en la ciudad de Guayaquil, lleva 5 años en este trabajo, que ha ayudado a la familia a subsistir.

 Ella antes se dedicaba a trabajar en casa, quien le ayudó y motivó a ingresar a la Fundación Espoir fue su suegra ya que ella lleva años en el mismo trabajo, cuando no hay  trabajo por falta de fiestas, feriados también tiene su trabajo en casa, el  mayor sueño de Sebastiana  es seguir con su negocio, incrementarlo y mejorarlo, la ayuda de la Fundación Espoir, su familia, esposo e hijos le dan la fortaleza para seguir creyendo en que lo hará.
texts.en:
Sra. Sebastiana M. is married and has five children. She sells handicrafts such as earrings and steel rings. Her most prosperous sales are made during the holiday season. Sebastiana and her husband leave on their holidays to the main trading point in Salinas (a beach in the Province of Guayas in Ecuador) where they stock up on products from the city of Guayaquil. For five years she has been in this business, which has helped to support her family.

Sebastiana previously worked at home. Her mother-in-law, who worked several years in the same business, helped her and convinced to join Fundación ESPOIR when there was no work available outside of the holiday season. When the holidays came around, Sebastiana still had to work from home. Her greatest dreams are to continue with her business, expand it, and improve it with the help of Fundación ESPOIR and her family. Her husband and children give her the strength to continue believing in what she does.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase earrings, rings, and other items

loans.name: Maria Domitila

texts.es:
Maria es socia del Banco Comunal San Benito.
Maria es casada, tiene 59 años y 7 hijos, Maria tiene un cafetín dentro D. las instalaciones D. una institución estatal, en donD. venD. comida, bebidas, golosinas, actividad que realiza con la ayuda D. su hija.
Maria necesita un préstamo D. 1200 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. arroz, azúcar.
Los sueños D. Maria son que sus hijos sean profesionales y mejorar su negocio.
texts.en:
Maria is a member of the San Benito Communal Bank. She is 59 years old, married, and has seven children. Maria has a small café located on the premises of a state institution where she sells food, beverages, and candy. She manages this business with the help of her daughter.

Maria needs a loan of 1200 PEN to invest in the purchase of rice and sugar. She dreams of improving her business and for her children to become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase rice & sugar

loans.name: Nely

texts.es:
Nely es socia del Banco Comunal San Benito.
Nely es conviviente, tiene 23 años y 2 hijos, Nely tiene una tienda en un local alquilado en donde vende abarrotes en general, actividad que realiza todos los días.
Nely necesita un préstamo de 900 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de leche, azúcar y papel.
Nely sueña con que sus hijos sean profesionales y tener una tienda surtida.
texts.en:
Nely is a member of the San Benito Communal Bank. She is 23 years old, in a common law marriage, and has two children. Nely has a store in a rented location where she sells groceries. She manages her store every day.

Nely needs a loan of 900 PEN to invest in the purchase of milk, sugar, and paper. She dreams of having a well-stocked store and for her children to become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase milk, sugar, and paper

loans.name: Felicia

texts.es:
Felicia es socia del Banco Comunal San Benito.
Felicia es conviviente, tiene 35 años y 3 hijos, Felicia tiene una tienda en su casa en donde vende abarrotes en general, carne, verduras, actividad que realiza todos los días.
Felicia necesita un préstamo de 1500 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de leche, azucar y arroz.
Los sueños de Felicia son que sus hijos sean profesionales, mejorar su negocio y terminar sus estudios de contabilidad.
texts.en:
Felicia is a member of the San Benito Communal Bank. She is 35 years old, in a common law marriage, and has three children. Felicia has a store in her home where she sells groceries, meat, and vegetables. She manages her store every day.

Felicia needs a loan of 1500 PEN to invest in the purchase of milk, sugar, and rice. She dreams of improving her business, finishing her studies in accounting, and for her children to become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase milk, sugar, and rice

loans.name: Luzmila Violeta

texts.es:
Luzmila tiene 40 años de edad, es divorciada y tiene dos hijos menores de edad que aun estudian. Viven en el sector Macabi Alto del distrito de Paiján, ubicado en la provincia de Ascope de la región La Libertad, a dos horas y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

La separación de su esposo la llevó a buscar la manera de generarse ingresos económicos para seguir adelante. Tuvo la oportunidad de agenciarse de un pequeño capital que utilizó en la compra de verduras que empezó a ofrecer en venta a sus vecinos. Eso paso hace cuatro años y desde entonces su negocio ha ido creciendo gracias a su esfuerzo, ahora ya tiene una bodega en la que ofrece todo tipo de productos de primera necesidad, abarrotes, verduras y carne fresca.

Adicionalmente también tiene algunas vacas que le proveen de leche la cual también comercializa, estos negocios le proveen de ingresos para solventar la economía familiar, por lo que ella se esfuerza a diario ofreciendo a sus clientes un trato amable y productos de primera necesidad. Ella desea reubicar su negocio en un nuevo ambiente de su vivienda, por ello se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.

Luzmila es una mujer luchadora, ha sabido salir adelante a pesar de las dificultades que conlleva sacar adelante a sus hijos sola. Ella ya ha trabajado anteriormente con Nuestra Institución y ha demostrado ser una cliente puntual y responsable al momento de asumir sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Luzmila is 40 years old, divorced, and has two children who are still in school. She lives in the Macabi Alto sector of the district of Paiján, located in the province of Ascope in the La Libertad region and two and a half hours from the city of Chiclayo, capital of the Lambayeque region.

Her separation from her husband caused her to look for a means of generating income in order to get by. She had the opportunity to pull together a little capital that she used to buy vegetables which she then offered for sale to her neighbors. This happened 4 years ago, and since then her business has been growing thanks to her efforts. Today, she has a store in which she stocks all types of basic supplies, groceries, vegetables, and fresh meat.

In addition to this, she also has some cows which provide milk that she also sells. These businesses provide her with income to keep her family solvent, and for this reason she works hard every day, offering her customers friendly service and the products that they need. She wishes to move her business to a new part of her home, and for this sees the necessity of requesting a loan from Edpyme Alternativa which will help her to achieve her objective.

Luzmila is a hardworking woman who has succeeded despite the difficulties of bringing up her children alone. She has already worked with our institution in the past and has shown her self to be punctual and responsible in paying back her loans.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Hynd, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Cost of relocating her business to a new location

loans.name: Armando

texts.es:
Don Armando, tiene 48 años, se caracteriza por ser un hombre emprendedor y justo. Junto a él esta su esposa Esperanza de 47 años, con quien tiene 4 hijos y solo dos ellos, lo menores, viven en su domicilio propio. Dedicado a la agricultura desde hace 30 años y gracias al esfuerzo y dedicación de esta actividad es que ha logrado que sus hijos mayores sean ahora unos profesionales. Paralelamente a este trabajo, se dedica al transporte interprovincial, debido a que cuenta con dos vehículos, por el que  lleva 15 años en esta actividad, siendo la administradora, su hija mayor. 
En tanto, lo trabajos agrícolas, tiene el apoyo de operarios, que vigilan y cuidan el desarrollo y producción de sus cultivos. Mientras que su esposa de dedica al preparado diario de la comida, llevando luego el almuerzo a las chacras. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo, es sembrar maíz y alfalfa por los verdes que se mantienen hasta el momento de su cosecha, además que le es rentable, por lo que pudo comprar sus vehículos, generándole  buenas utilidades adicionales, a la venta de producción de maíz y verduras, en el mercado central de su ciudad. En el futuro desea emprender una pequeña empresa de transporte interprovincial, ya que sabe que mas adelante no podrá continuar en la agricultura. Este es su décimo crédito con MFP, además se siente orgulloso de continuar trabajando con los integrantes de su grupo comunal, que son personas muy solidarias, unidos y sobretodo responsables. En tanto solicita, mil quinientos nuevos soles para comprar una lata de semilla de alfalfa, además pagar a un operario más, que le ayude a preparar el terreno y comprar también sacos de abono.
texts.en:
Armando is 48 years old. He is known for being an entrepreneurial and fair man. Alongside him is his wife Esperanza who is 47 and with whom he has four children. Only two of them, the youngest ones, live in his home. He has been dedicated to farming for thirty years and thanks to effort and dedication to this activity he has achieved that his older children are now professionals. Parallel to this work, he is dedicated to interprovincial transportation since he has two vehicles. He has 15 years experience with this activity. The manager is his eldest daughter. Meanwhile, the farming work is performed by operators who watch over and take care of the development and production of their crops. His wife is dedicated to the daily preparation of food then she brings lunch to the farms. What he likes most about his work is to sow maize and alfalfa greens which he takes care of until harvest time. It is also profitable so he could buy their vehicles, generating good additional income from the sale of maize and produce in the central market of their city. In the future, he wishes to start a small interprovincial transportation company since he knows that, in the future, he won't be able to continue farming. This is his tenth loan with MFP. Additionally, he feels proud to continue working with the members of his community group who are very cooperative people, united and above all responsible. In all, he has requested 1,500 soles to buy a can of alfalfa seeds and pay for one more operator who can help prepare the earth and buy bags of fertilizer.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy alfalfa seeds, fertilizer and hire more farm hands to help with sowing.

loans.name: Olga Beatriz

texts.es:
La  señora Olga, es propietaria de una despensa,  con 7 años de funcionamiento, con clientela formada , ya que tiene buenos precios y buena calidad en sus mercaderías, también el trato con los clientes.
Su proyecto es ampliar su local comercial con un salón en frente de su casa con espacio suficiente para cargar muchas mercaderías de primera necesidad, al por mayor y menudeo.
Los clientes vienen de distintas zonas para abastecerse de las mercaderías y por ello solicita el crédito para la compra de panificados, lácteos, pastas, enlatados, embutidos .
texts.en:
Olga is the owner of a dispensary that has been in business for seven years, with an established customer base since it has good prices and good quality merchandise and treatment of its customers. Her project is to expand her commercial shop with a lounge at the front of her house that has enough space to store a lot of basic merchandise, wholesale and retail. Customers come from different areas to procure goods and for this she is requesting a loan to buy baked goods, dairy, pasta, canned goods and sausages.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase baked goods, dairy, pasta, canned goods and sausages.

loans.name: Angela Maria

texts.es: La señora Ángela Maria tiene 40 años de edad, es casada y tiene un hijo de 16 años de edad, que aun vive con ella y está estudiando en secundaria. La señora tiene un negocio de venta de ropa usada, que es de primera calidad. Cabe señalarse, la señora también labora como enfermera profesional en el Hospital desde hace 19 años. Es importante mencionar que ella empezó con este negocio desde hace once años, inicio con media paca, ella inicio vendiéndole a sus compañeros de trabajo, poco a poco fue creciendo y ahora tiene el  negocio en su casa, por lo que también distribuye de forma ambulante cuando no está de turno en el hospital. Ella actualmente está solicitando este crédito para ser invertido en la compra de una paca de ropa seleccionada, ya que desea diversificar su negocio, ella vende pantalones y camisas y desea comprar una paca de ropa interior y ropa de baño para las playas, con el objetivo de aprovechar el verano. Sueña con mejorar su condición de vida.
texts.en:
Ángela Maria is 40 years old, is married and she has one child who is 16 and who still lives with her and is a high school student. She has a business selling used clothing that is of first-rate quality. It should be noted that Ángela Maria has also worked as a professional nurse in the hospital for 19 years. It is important to mention that she began this business eleven years ago. She began with half a pack (of clothing). She began selling to her colleagues from work. Gradually, it grew and now she has a business in her house. She also distributes on foot when she doesn't have a shift at the hospital. She is now requesting a loan that will be invested in the purchase of a pack of underwear and swimwear for the beach with the objective of taking advantage of summer. She dreams of improving her quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Lidia

texts.es:
La Sra. Lidia Es una cliente nueva ha trabajado antes en el banco de emprendimiento, Primavera de Mercurio, ha mostrando responsabilidad, ella tiene la determinación de llegar a constituir un taller mas grande, es emprendedora, su taller y domicilio es de carácter familiar. Junto a su pareja Osvaldo quien es chofer asalariado interprovincial,  la Sra. Realiza sus ventas en el barrio minero. La venta de sus mantas la realiza a vendedores en las ferias de la ciudad de el alto,  quedándose hasta parte de la mañana para poder distribuir sus mantas y por la tarde se dedica a la producción de sus mantas. La Sra. Produce las mantas a crochet mantas tejidas a mano con lana de alpaca ( La alpaca es un animal de fina estampa, armoniosa en su caminar, de cuerpo esbelto cubierto de fibra que en su conjunto se denomina vellón. Presenta almohadillas plantares, característica que le otorga la condición de animal ecológico al no dañar el pasto, ni provocar erosión.  La lana de alpaca es una fibra tan cálida y única que por cientos de años muchos países han tratado de conseguirla. Sin embargo, ellos no podrían tener rebaños de alpacas en el extranjero. Las alpacas nunca se reproducen a menos que vivan en tierras vírgenes. Perú y Bolivia han firmado tratados internacionales para asegurar su monopolio sobre la alpaca ya que es nuestro legado nacional), realiza sus productos por mayor o menor según los pedidos que tenga, con el dinero del credito comprara lana de alpaca al por mayor y asi poder realizar sus mantas, su mayor anhelo de lidia es ampliar su negocio y tener sus propia casa.
Esta muy agradecida con Emprender y Kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgación del crédito.
texts.en:
Mrs. Lidia is a new customer who previously worked with “Primavera de Mercurio” (Spring of Mercury) Community Bank. She has shown herself to be very responsible. She is determined to build a larger workshop. She is very enterprising. Her workshop and home have a familiar character. Along with her husband Osvaldo, who is an interprovincial salaried driver, she sells her product in the mining areas. She sells her blankets to salespeople at the markets in the highlands. She sells her blankets in the morning and constructs them in the afternoon. She makes handmade, crochet blankets out of alpaca wool. (The alpaca is delicate footed herd animal with a slim body covered with fiber that she gathers for fleece. They have padded feet that allow them to tread lightly on the grass.
