The animals don’t damage the ecology of the region or cause erosion. Alpaca wool is high quality. For many hundreds of years other countries have tried to acquire alpacas. Foreign countries have not been able to maintain alpaca herds. Alpacas don’t reproduce unless they live on open land. Perú and Bolivia have signed international treaties in order to assure their monopoly over the alpaca, as they are their national legacy.) She sells her blankets to the wholesale and retail markets, depending on the requests that she has. With this loan she will buy wholesale alpaca wool and use it to make her blankets. Her major goal is to grow her business and have her own house. She is very thankful to Emprender and Kiva for the confidence they have given her by granting her this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Esther Levandoski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will buy alpaca wool to use for crocheting her blankets.

loans.name: Inocenta

texts.es:
Inocenta es socia del Banco Comunal San Benito.
Inocenta es viuda, tiene 46 años y 2 hijos, Inocenta tiene un puesto en el mercado 12 de abril en donde vende pollos para recria, además Inocenta tiene una tienda de abarrotes en su casa.
Inocenta necesita un préstamo de 1200 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de arroz y azúcar.
Inocenta sueña con tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Inocenta is a member of the community bank San Benito.

Inocenta is a widow, 46 years old, and has two children. Inocenta has a stall in the market called "Twelfth of April" where she sells chickens for breeding and she also has a grocery store in her home.

Inocenta needs a loan of $425 which she will use to buy rice and sugar.

Inocenta dreams of having her own home.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Hynd, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy rice and sugar

loans.name: Nancy

texts.es:
Nancy es socia del Banco Comunal San Benito.
Nancy es casada, tiene 29 años y 2 hijos, Nancy tiene una tienda en la casa de sus padres en donde vende abarrotes en general, actividad que realiza todos los días.
Nancy necesita un préstamo de 900 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de arroz, gaseosa, azúcar.
Los sueños de Nancy es tener casa propia y su negocio en su casa.
texts.en:
Nancy is a member of the community bank San Benito.

Nancy is married, is 29 years old, and has two children. Nancy has a store in her parent's house where she sells general groceries. She does this every day.

Nancy needs a loan of $325 which she will use to buy rice, sodas, and sugar. Nancy's dreams are to have her own house and to run her business from there.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Hynd, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy rice, sodas, and sugar

loans.name: Silvia Mercedes

texts.es:
Silvia es socia del Banco Comunal San Benito.
Silvia es casada, tiene 41 años y 4 hijos, Silvia tiene un restaurante llamado Don Lucho en un local alquilado, actividad que realiza todos los días con la ayuda D. 1 personal, además Silvia venD. bebidas al por mayor.
Silvia necesita un préstamo D. 1200 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. azúcar, arroz.
Los sueños D. Silvia son mejorar su casa para alquilar e implementar una polleria.
texts.en:
Silvia is a member of the community bank San Benito.

Silvia is married, 41 years old, and has 4 children. Silvia has a restaurant called Don Lucho in a rented location. She works there everyday with the help of one employee. She also sells drinks wholesale.

Silvia needs a loan of $425 that she will use to buy sugar and rice.

Silvia's dreams are to improve her house in order to rent and to start a poultry shop.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Hynd, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sugar and rice.

loans.name: Karina Veronica

texts.es:
Karina tiene 22 años de edad, es soltera y vive junto a sus padres y dos hermanos en el distrito de Paiján, ubicado en la provincia de Ascope de la región La Libertad, situada a dos horas y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Karina es una joven que se ha propuesto salir adelante para ayudar a progresar a su familia. Cuando egresó de secudaria empezó a estudiar secretariado en un instituto de la ciudad de Trujillo (capital de la región La Libertad) y también estudió cosmetología. Tuvo la oportunidad de empezar a realizar prácticas como secretaria en la municipalidad de su localidad y aprovechó la oportunidad de relacionarse con diversas personas para empezar a ejercer su segunda profesión.

Actualmente la municipalidad en donde realizó sus prácticas ya la contrató y dedica su tiempo a trabajar en esta institución y también a ofrecer el servicio de manicurista a domicilio. Ella nos comenta que aunque ser secretaria le ha abierto muchas puertas su mayor anhelo es tener un salon de belleza donde puede atender a los clientes que actualmente visita a domicilio paa ofrecer sus servicios.

Karina desea trabajar arduamente para lograr su objetivo, la calidad con la que realiza su trabajo ha hecho que se vuelva conocida y cada vez son mas los clientes que solicitan su servicio de manicurista. Ella desea adquirir algunos materiales que le permitan desarrollar facilmente la profesión que mas le gusta, por ello se encuentra solictando por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 500 nuevos soles.

Los ingresos que ella percibe los utiliza para ayudar a su familia y para solventar sus gastos personales. Sus conocidos y amigos la consideran una muchacha alegre, responsable y emprenderora.
texts.en:
Karina is 22 years old, single, and lives with her parents and two brothers in the district of Paiján, located in the province of Ascope in the La Libertad region. They are located two and a half hours from the city of Chiclayo, capital of the Lambayeque region.

Karina is a young woman who has set herself the task of helping her family to progress in life. When she left secondary school, she began to study secretarial skills at an institute in the city of Trujillo (capital of the La Libertad region) and she also studied cosmetics. She had the opportunity to begin work as a secretary for the town government of her home town and took advantage of the opportunity to make connections with various people with an eye to starting work in her second profession - cosmetics.

Currently, the town government has contracted her to work for them and she spends her time working in this institution and also offers a manicure service from her home. She tells us that even being a secretary has opened many doors for her and her greatest desire is to have a beauty salon where she can attend to the customers who currently come to her home.

Karina wants to work hard and with passion to achieve her objective. The quality of her work has made her well known and the number of customers who want her manicure service keeps increasing. She want to add some materials that will enable her to easily develop the profession that she most enjoys, and for this reason she is requesting her first loan of $175 from Edpyme Alternativa.

The income that she hopes to earn will be used to help her family and to cover her personal expenses. Her acquaintances and friends consider her to be a happy, responsible, and enterprising young woman.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Hynd, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy materials needed for her manicure service.

loans.name: Ama

texts.en: Ama B., who received junior high education, sells secondhand clothes in Elmina.  A married mother of  four children, Ama helps her husband, a trader, by paying school fees and other expenses that may arise. Her loan will be used to buy bales of secondhand clothes for sale, and she hopes to use the new profits from her business to save to build a house.

loans.use: To buy bales of secondhand clothes for sale.

loans.name: Yanet

texts.es:
Yanet es socia del Banco Comunal Manantial.
Yanet es conviviente, tiene 27 años y 2 hijos, Yanet vende fruta variada de manera ambulatoria en el mercado, además los días domingos viaja a las ferias en donde vende sus frutas.
Yanet necesita un préstamo de 2100 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de una mototaxi para que trabaje su esposo.
Los sueños de Yanet es mejorar su negocio y brindar una buena educación.
texts.en:
Yanet is a member of the Manantial Community Bank. She lives with her partner and is 27 years old with two children. Yanet sells a variety of fruit on foot in the market. Additionally, on Sundays, she travels to fairs where she sells her fruit. Yanet needs a loan of 2,100 soles which will be invested in the purchase of a mototaxi so that her husband can work. Yanet's dream is to improve her business and provide a good education.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For the purchase of a mototaxi so that her husband can work.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es: Margarita 79 años. Por lo que el tiempo con este negocio, ha sido por mucho tiempo pues con la ayuda de los financiamientos de Fundación ha mejorado notablemente. Ella se ha dedicado durante mucho tiempo al destace de cerdo,  por medio de su familia que siempre se han dedicado a esta actividad fue que ella decide por cuenta propia establecer su propio negocio, en su humilde vivienda. Siempre sueña con mantener su negocio activo, pues la mayoría de sus clientes siempre recurren en busca de sus deliciosos productos. El financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo que será invertido en materia prima.
texts.en:
Margarita is 79 years old.The time with this business has been long and with the help of the loans from Fundación it has improved notably. She has been dedicated for a long time to butchering pigs. It was through her family, who always has been dedicated to this activity, that she decided to establish her own business in her humble home. She has always dreamed of maintaining an active business since the majority of her customers always come back in search of her delicious products. The loan that she is requesting is for working capital that will be invested in raw materials.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.es:
Gladys es socia del Banco Comunal Manantial.

Gladys es casada, tiene 37 años y 4 hijos, Gladys tiene una bodega en su casa en donde vende abarrotes en general, verduras, carnes, actividad que realiza todos los días. Gladys necesita un préstamo de 1200 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de arroz, azúcar.

Los sueños de Gladys son ampliar su negocio y ayudar a la educación de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Gladys is a member of the Manantial communal bank. Gladys is married, 37 years old and has 4 children. Gladys has a grocery store in her home where she sells general groceries, vegetables and meat. She works there every day. Gladys needs a loan of 1200 PEN which will be used to buy rice and sugar. Gladys dreams of expanding her business and helping with her children's education.

Translated from Spanish by Catherine Dent, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase rice and sugar

loans.name: Janet Ekua

texts.en: Janet Ekua A.,  a high school graduate who is married and blessed with two wonderful children, sells secondhand female skirts and tops in Elmina.   Her husband is a trader. In her business for some time now, Janet uses her profits to support her husband in the general upkeep of the home. Her loan will be used to buy fabric materials and ladies' bags as an additional product for sale. She hopes to save the new profits from her business and eventually  buy land.

loans.use: To buy fabric materials and ladies' bags

loans.name: Emilia

texts.es:
Emilia es socia del Banco Comunal Manantial.
Emilia es casada, tiene 47 años y 4 hijos, Emilia tiene un restaurante en su casa, actividad que realiza todos los días con la ayuda de 3 empleados.
Emilia necesita un préstamo de 900 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de arroz, azúcar.
Los sueños de Emilia son mejorar su negocio, tener una sucursal, y brindar una buena educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Emilia is a member of the Manantial communal bank. Emilia is married, 47 years old and has 4 children. Emilia has a restaurant in her home. She works there every day with the help of 3 employees. Emilia needs a loan of 900 PEN that will be used to purchase rice and sugar. Emilia dreams of improving her business, to have another restaurant, and to provide her children with a good education.

Translated from Spanish by Catherine Dent, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase rice and sugar

loans.name: Nelly

texts.es:
Nelly tiene 37 años, vive en su casa propia en compañía de su esposo Juan Carlos (38) y sus dos menores hijos que estudian en el colegio.

Cuando quiso emprender un negocio propio no dudó en poner en práctica sus habilidades culinarias. Desde hace un año se dedica a la venta de salchipapas (papas y salchichas fritas), para esto instaló afuera de su casa un carrito salchipapero (móvil para comida rápida). Normalmente trabaja sola, desde las 6 de la tarde hasta la medianoche, aunque a veces cuando no hay mucha demanda su estadía se prolonga hasta la una de la mañana para lograr vender todas sus porciones. Nelly está muy satisfecha con su negocio, pues le genera buenas ganancias, no tiene competencia cerca y sus habituales comensales la prefieren, pues es una buena opción cuando llegan cansados de trabajar y buscan su deliciosa comida para saciar su apetito. Siendo ella una mujer emprendedora ha notado que su negocio ha crecido bastante, por lo que tiene planeado, en los próximos meses, instalar un pequeño kiosco de madera afuera de su casa donde colocaría el carrito salchipapero con sillas y mesitas para sus clientes.

Este es el primer préstamo que Nelly con MFP y está muy agradecida con todas aquellas personas que hacen posible el crédito que le permitirá continuar trabajando. Tiene pensado invertir el dinero solicitado en la compra de una pieza de madera para adaptar su kiosko.
texts.en:
Nelly is 37 years old, she lives in her own house with her husband Juan Carlos (38) and their two young children who are at school. When she wanted to start her own business she did not hesitate to put her culinary abilities into practice. For a year she has been selling salchipapas (hot chips and fried sausages). To do this she set up a salchipapa cart (mobile for fast food) outside her home. Usually she works alone, from 6pm until midnight, although sometimes when it is not busy she stays open until one in the morning so that she can sell all her servings. Nelly is very satisfied with her business as it generates a good income, she does not have competition nearby and her regular customers prefer her, as it is a good option when they arrive tired from work and are looking for her delicious food to satisfy their appetites. Being an enterprising woman she has noted that her business has grown quite a lot, therefore she has planned, in the following months, to install a small wooden kiosk outside her home where she will put the salchipapa cart with seats and tables for her customers. This is Nelly's first loan with MFP and she is very grateful to all the people that make the loan possible thus allowing her to continue working. She is intending to use the loan to buy a piece of wood to set up her kiosk.

Translated from Spanish by Catherine Dent, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Development of her kiosk

loans.name: Clotilde

texts.es:
Clotilde tiene 65 años, es casada y tiene un hijo mayor. Ella vive en la comunidad de “Balsamayocc” (ceja de selva), donde tienen su casa propia.

Desde muy pequeña jugaba en la chacra de sus padres y les ayudaba a poner las semillas en la tierra. Dejó esa inquietud por la agricultura incubada durante su adolescencia y cuando fue adulta decidió emprender el cultivo de cacao y la hoja de coca en su tierra de natal. Con lo aprendido de sus padres sigue adelante a pesar de su edad, en ocasiones recibe la ayuda de su familia y generalmente contrata peones para la cosecha. Sus productos los vende en las ferias dominicales y en los centros de acopio de su localidad. Para el futuro quiere seguir apostando en el sector agrícola, mejorando la calidad y cantidad de su producto.

Este es su sexto préstamo con MFP, donde ratifica la puntualidad de sus pagos, ya que este crédito le otorga la oportunidad de ampliar su producción. Con el dinero solicitado comprará más insumos (abono, fertilizantes) para mejorar en su producción agrícola.
texts.en:
Clotilde is 65 years old, married, and has an adult son. She lives in the jungle community of Balsamayocc, where she has her own home.

At a young age, she played on her parents’ farm and helped them with planting seeds. She was not involved in farming as a teenager, but when she became an adult, she decided to start growing cacao and coca leaves on the land where she was raised. Using the knowledge she learned from her parents, she is able to get ahead despite her age. On occasion, she receives help from her family and generally hires laborers for the harvest. Her products are sold at the Sunday fairs and at collection centers in her area. In the future, she wants to continue in the agricultural sector and improve the quality and quantity of her product.

This is her sixth loan with MFP, which confirms the timeliness of her payments. The loan provides her with the opportunity to increase her production, Clotilde will use the money she requested to buy more supplies (compost and fertilizers) to improve her agricultural output.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase compost & fertilizers

loans.name: Leonarda

texts.es:
Leonarda tiene 45 años, vive con su pareja y padre de sus 4 hijos. Vive en una localidad en la ceja de selva ayacuchana denominada “Palmapampa”, en una casa alquilada.

Ella nunca olvidará aquellas tardes de su juventud cuando observaba a sus abuelos a remover la tierra y colocar las semillas de cacao. Es por ello de que ahí en adelante apostó por la actividad agrícola, específicamente al cultivo de cacao, para así honrar el legado de sus abuelos.
Ahora desarrolla nuevas técnicas de cultivo con el apoyo ocasional de sus familiares, pero también contrata peones en tiempo de cosecha. Este producto tiene mucha demanda a nivel nacional e internacional, es por ello que se siente satisfecha por las ganancias que recibe al vender su producto en los centros de acopio de su localidad. En adelante, piensa comprar más terrenos, para así competir de manera equitativa con sus vecinos.

Este es su décimo tercer préstamo con MFP, por lo que se compromete a cumplir con sus respectivos pagos, además está conforme con la metodología de trabajo de su banco comunal. Con el dinero que solicita invertirá en insumos y abono para su chacras, con la finalidad de mejorar la calidad de su producto para que su próxima cosecha la venda a mejor precio.
texts.en:
Leonarda is 45 years old and lives with her partner, who is the father of her four children. She lives in a rented house in a town located in the Ayacuchan jungle called Palmapampa.

Leonarda never forgot those afternoons in her youth when she watched her grandparents clear the land and plant cacao seeds. This is the reason why she chose to pursue farming, specifically growing cacao, in order to honor her grandparents’ legacy. She now develops new farming techniques with the occasional help of her relatives, but she also hires workers for the harvest season. Cacao has high demand on a national and international level. Leonarda feels satisfied with the revenue she generates from selling her product to the collection centers in her area. Later on she wants to buy more land so that she can complete on the same level as her neighbors.

This is her thirteenth loan with MFP. Leonarda commits to making her payments and conforming to the work methodology of her Communal Bank. The money she requested will be invested in supplies and organic fertilizers for her fields so that she can improve the quality of her product for the next harvest and sell it at a better price.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase organic fertilizers & farming supplies

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en: Joseph A. sells second hand clothes at Elmina. He is married and has three children. Joseph has a senior high education. His wife is a trader. He is responsible for paying school fees and utility bills. His loan will be used to buy more second hand clothing for sale. He hopes to use the new profits received as a result of the loan to save to buy land.

loans.use: To buy more second hand clothing to sell

loans.name: Marcelino

texts.es:
Marcelino tiene 32 años, está casado y tiene 2 hijos en edad escolar. Actualmente vive en un pueblo denominado “Palmapampa” en la selva de Ayacucho, donde reside en una casa arrendada.

Desde muy joven empezó ayudando a sus padres a cosechar cacao, café y la hoja de coca, notó que este negocio daba muy buenos resultados y es por ello que en el presente se dedica de lleno a la actividad agrícola, sobre todo a cultivar cacao y café. Ahora él está pensando en grande, ya que no quiere cultivar en pequeñas parcelas como lo hacían sus padres, sino en grandes hectáreas, para producir en gran escala. Normalmente vende sus productos en su misma localidad al por mayor y menor a un precio acorde a las exigencias del mercado. Para el futuro anhela comprar una casa propia para su familia, para más no gastar más alquileres.

Este es su décimo tercer préstamo con MFP, por lo que se compromete a cumplir con sus pagos, además se siente agradecido con su banco comunal, ya que se solidarizan entre todos ante cualquier percance.

Con el dinero solicitado comprará algunos animales para captar otros clientes y nuevos ingresos además de la agricultura.
texts.en:
Marcelino is 32 years old, married, and has two school-age children. He currently resides in the town called Palmapampa in the Ayacuchan jungle where he lives in a rented house.

At young age, Marcelino learned from his parents how to grow cacao, coffee, and coca leaves. He noticed that their business was very successful, which is why at the moment he fully dedicates himself to his farming activities, especially growing cacao and coffee. Marcelino now has big plans. He does not want to cultivate in small plots like his parents, but in large hectares to produce on a grander scale. Marcelino usually sells his products from the same location at either wholesale or retail prices according to what the market requires. In the future, he wants to buy his own house for his family so that he doesn’t have to pay any more rent.

This is his thirteenth loan with MFP. Marcelino commits to making his payments and also feels grateful to his Communal Bank because the members all support one another if anyone experiences any mishaps. With the money he requested, he will buy a few animals to attract additional customers and generate new income apart from farming.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Start a new venture selling animals

loans.name: Rosa Ticona

texts.es:
La Sra.  Rosa Es una cliente antigua ha trabajado antes en grupo solidario, es muy cumplida ha mostrando su responsabilidad,  ella esta casada con el Sr.  clemente, su esposo es contratista para una fabrica en Cochabamba, ellos tienen tres hijos, su puesto D. la Sra. Se encuentra en la calle René Vargas en la populosa zona D. la 16 D. julio, la venta D. sus enaguas la realiza los días jueves y domingo, días D. la gran feria 16 D. julio (La feria 16 D. Julio es mucho más que comercio. Asomarse a ella es adentrarse en la cosmovisión andina, donD. se vive la ritualidad D. las actividades comerciales del mundo Aymara. Por las calles, es común escuchar el “rebájame, auméntame”, formas centenarias D. entrar en este espacio particular y que D. ninguna manera se manejan en un supermercado u otros espacios. La feria 16 D. Julio es una recreación D. los “Colqa” o tambos D. la época colonial, que eran una especie D. almacenes D. alimentos por donD. circulaban gran cantidad D. productos. ), la Sra. Rosa se queda hasta largar horas D. la noche  para poder vender sus productos. La Sra. Rosa  Produce las enaguas por menor, junto a sus hijas, su mayor anhelo D. la Sra.  Rosa junto a sus hijas  es ampliar su negocio mejorando así su  calidad D. vida.
Esta muy agradecida con Emprender y Kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgación del crédito.
texts.en:
Rosa is a long-term client who has worked with a group in the past. She is very polite and has demonstrated great responsibility. She is married to Clemente, who is a contractor at a factory in Cochabamba; they have three children. Her booth is located on Calle René Vargas in the populous 16 D. Julio zone. She sells enaguas (traditional underskirts) on Thursdays and Sundays, which are the days of the great 16 D. Julio street market. The 16 D. Julio street market is much more than just a market. To enter the market is to go deep into the Andean worldview, where one can witness the ritual of the Aymará world’s commercial activities. On the streets it is common to hear “lower me, increase me,” centuries-old forms of bargaining that are used in this particular space but which are never used in supermarkets or other places. The 16 D. Julio market is a recreation of the “Colqa” or tambos of the colonial period, which were a kind of grocery store where a large amount of products were in circulation. Rosa works until late at night so that she can sell her products. She and her daughters produce the enaguas and sell them at retail prices. Her biggest wish is that she and her daughters can expand her business and thus improve their quality of life. Rosa is very grateful to Emprender and Kiva for the confidence they have given her by granting the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Christopher Knutson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing fabric for making traditional underskirts

loans.name: Florencia

texts.es: Florencia, es una mujer alegre y trabajadora de 53 años, quien comparte su vida a lado de su esposo Hilario de 52 años en su casa propia, ambos tienen 5 hijos, siendo todos mayores de edad e independientes con sus propias familias. Desde hace 45 años se dedica a la agricultura y del que tiene mayor influencia para la toma de decisiones, y por el que tiene gran apoyo de su esposo. Es así que controla el trabajo que desempañan los operarios, que se encargan del cuidado de sus siembras de maíz, papa y todo tipo de verduras que cultiva en sus terrenos propios. Pese a una enfermedad que le impide realizar trabajos forzosos, pero ello no impide que deje de trabajar en la producción de sus siembras. Mientras que su esposo tiene un taller de cerrajería en un local alquilado, en donde fabrica además puertas y ventanas, pero en sus momentos libres trabaja junto a Florencia en las chacras. Lo que más le gusta es regar sus cultivos, según refiere, se distrae mucho el ver correr el agua por los surcos, sin embargo la parte más difícil de su trabajo, es lavar betarraga y coliflor para luego ser trasladados al mercado de su ciudad. De las ganancias que obtuvo en estos tiempos, ayudó a instalar el taller a su esposo, es por eso que ambos desean mas adelante ampliar este taller y contar con más equipos que faciliten el trabajo de cerrajero, siendo su mayor anhelo instalar una ferretería o distribuidora de fierros. Este es décimo crédito con MFP, por lo que espera concretar su objetivo, además se muestra muy orgullosa de continuar trabajando con su grupo comunal, ya que le ha permitido progresar junto a su familia, aprendiendo a invertir bien el crédito que obtiene. Entretanto solicita tres mil nuevos soles para comprar 12 sacos de fertilizantes, a la vez que terminará de techar su casa, por lo que comprará 120 planchas de calamina y clavos.
texts.en:
Florencia is 53 years old and a cheerful hardworking woman who shares her life with her husband Hilario, age 52. They live in their own home. She has five grown children who are all independent and have their own families.

For 45 years Florencia has been farming and holding a major influence on the decision making, since she has great support from her husband. She supervises the work of her laborers who are charged with looking after the crops of corn, potatoes, and other vegetables that are grown on her land. Even though an illness prevents her from performing strenuous activity, this does not keep her away from the production of her crops. Her husband operates a locksmith shop in a rented location, where he also manufactures door and windows. In his spare time, he helps Florencia with the work in the fields.

What she enjoys most is irrigating her crops because, according to her, the sight of running water flowing through the furrows helps to distract her. However, the most difficult part of her job is washing the beets and cauliflower before they are taken to the city market. From the profits she has earned, Florencia was able to establish her husband’s shop. They both want to expand this business so that he will have more equipment to facilitate his work as a locksmith. Their greatest wish is to open a hardware store or an iron distribution center.

Florencia is taking her tenth loan with MFP and hopes to achieve her goal. She is also very proud to be continuing her work with her Communal Bank, which led to making progress alongside her family and learning how to invest her loan proceeds. With this loan of 3000 PEN, she will purchase twelve sacks of fertilizer. In order to finish the roof of her house, she will also buy nails and 120 sheets of corrugated metal.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fertilizers for her fields & corrugated metal and nails to finish the roof of her house

loans.name: Maura

texts.es:
Maura tiene 44 años, está casada y tiene tres hijos. Vive en una localidad llamada “Palmapampa” (ceja de selva), donde tiene su casa propia.

Desde hace 30 años viene trabajando en la actividad agrícola, específicamente en el cultivo de café y cacao. Si bien al comienza ella solo contaba con una pequeña chacra, decidió ampliar sus terrenos para producir en grandes volúmenes. Maura recibe ayuda de sus hijos, pero a la vez tiene a su cargo peones que lo puedan facilitar en el cultivo de café y cacao. Usualmente vende sus productos a los comerciantes mayoristas o en los centros de acopio de su comunidad. Para el futuro piensa expandirse adquiriendo nuevos terrenos para cultivar nuevos productos que tengan mayor demanda.

Este es su décimo quinto préstamo con MFP y es consciente que si es responsable, seguirá contando con posteriores créditos. Con el dinero solicitado comprará insumos para el mejoramiento de sus productos en cuanto a calidad y cantidad.
texts.en:
Maura is 44 years old, married, and has three children. She lives in the jungle town called Palmapampa, where she has her own home.

Maura has been farming for 30 years, specifically growing coffee and cacao. At the beginning, she only had a small farm, so she decided to acquire more land so that she could produce in greater volumes. Maura receives assistance from her children, but she also has hired workers who are able to facilitate the cultivation of coffee and cacao. She usually sells her products to the wholesale merchants or at the collection centers in her community. In the future, she plans to expand by acquiring more land for growing new products that are in greater demand.

This is her fifteenth loan with MFP. Maura is aware that if she is responsible, she will continue to be eligible for future loans. The money she requested will be used to buy supplies for improving the quality and quantity of her products.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase farming supplies

loans.name: Efua

texts.en: Efua S. sells locally produced cooking utensils, coal pots and other items at Elmina.  Efua has a senior high education.  She is married and has two children. Her husband is a painter. Efua has been locally manufacturing utensils for quite some time now. She helps her husband take care of the home. Her loan will be used to buy other locally made cooking utensils to meet the increasing demand and satisfaction of her customers. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save to build a house.

loans.use: To buy locally made cooking utensils.

loans.name: Sergio

texts.es:
Sergio tiene 38 años, es casado y tiene tres hijos. Actualmente reside en la comunidad de “Chontabamba” (ceja de selva de Ayacucho), donde tienen su casa propia.

Durante sus años de adolescencia se dedicó a la actividad agrícola ayudando a sus padres en tiempos de cosecha, pero no tenía la certeza de que lo impulsado por sus padres iba tener continuidad en el futuro. Ahora no se arrepiente de nada, es más, se siente muy feliz con el trabajo que realiza, ya que le va muy bien. En tiempos de cultivo necesita de trabajadores para que agilicen las labores, los cuales contrata según la temporada. Su producto lo vende en los centros de acopio a un buen precio, es por ello que su plan a futuro es comprar terrenos donde pueda cultivar en mayor cantidad.

Este es su segundo préstamo con MFP y se compromete a pagar puntualmente sus cuotas, además afirma que está conforme con el respaldo y trabajo de su banco comunal. Con el dinero que solicita realizará el mantenimiento de sus terrenos de cultivos, para que pueda producir en menor tiempo posible.
texts.en:
Sergio is 38 years old, married, and has three children. He currently resides in the community of Chontabamba in the Ayacuchan jungle, where he has his own home.

During his years as a teenager, Sergio spent his time helping his parents during the harvest season. Farming would become his destiny since his parents drove him in that direction so that he would continue to have a future. Now he has no regrets because he is happy with the work he has accomplished and everything is going very well. When it is time to plant the crops, Sergio needs laborers to expedite the work, so he hires according to the season. He sells his product to the collection centers at a good price, so he has plans for the future to buy more land and produce in larger quantities.

This is his second loan with MFP. Sergio commits to making his payments on time. He is also consistent in supporting the work of his Communal Bank. The money he requested will be used to perform maintenance on his farmland so that he can produce in the shortest amount of time possible.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Pay for maintenance of his farmland

loans.name: Eramudugoda Gamage

texts.en:
Eramudugoda is a 28-year-old single woman living in Yakabadda in southern Sri Lanka. She has never been married, and has a small general store business that she manages. Her brother also helps her run the store, and she uses her earnings to help manage daily expenses.

Eramudugoda started her shop about four years ago, and has developed a lot of experience running her general store. She considers herself a very honest business woman to which she attributes her success.

Eramudugoda is asking for a loan of 40,000 LKR from BRAC Sri Lanka to help expand her general store.

Thank you for taking the time to consider supporting this Sri Lankan loan!

loans.use: To buy goods for her general store

loans.name: Silbera

texts.es:
Silbera tiene 42 años, vive con su esposo y sus 4 hijos. Actualmente tiene su casa propia en la comunidad llamada “San José” en un zona de ceja de selva.

Desde hace 20 años se dedica se dedica a su tienda de abarrotes, negocio al que le tiene mucho cariño, ya que le dio la oportunidad de hacerse reconocida en su comunidad, es por ello que cuenta con muchos clientes fieles. Ella labora desde las 5 de la mañana hasta las 8 de la noche, siendo una actividad cómoda y a la vez le brinda las ganancias económicas necesarias para su hogar. Aun así para el futuro piensa ampliar su negocio y convertirlo en un tipo de minimarket con una ambientación atractiva para los clientes.

Este es su decimo sexto préstamo con MFP, asegura que estos créditos le han traído muchas satisfacciones, por consiguiente se compromete a cumplir puntualmente con sus respectivos pagos, además se siente fortalecida y contenta con su banco comunal. 

Con el dinero que solicita adquirirá más mercadería acorde a la demandada, ya que con ello tendrá bien surtida su tienda de abarrotes.
texts.en:
Silbera is 42 years old and lives with her husband and their four children. She currently has her own home in the community of San José, which is in a jungle area.

For twenty years Silbera has been managing a grocery store, a business for which she has a great attachment. It gave her the opportunity to become recognized in her community, since she has many loyal customers. Silbera works from 5am until 8pm in what she feels is a comfortable activity that provides financially for her household necessities. In the future, she plans to expand her business and convert it into a mini-market with an attractive environment for her customers.

This is her sixteenth loan with MFP. Silbera assures us that these loans have brought her tremendous satisfaction. Therefore, she promises to continue making her payments on time. She also feels stronger and happier with her Communal Bank. The money she is requesting will be used to acquire more merchandise so that she will have a well-stocked grocery store.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Acquire more merchandise

loans.name: Nirosha

texts.en:
Nirosha is a 40-year-old married woman living with her husband in the town of Yakabadda, Sri Lanka. They have five children, aged from 15 to 27.

Nirosha's husband manages an electrical goods shop which she used to help with, and recently she has started a rental store providing equipment to rent to local customers. They both have gained a lot of experience in running these businesses and consider themselves very hard workers. Nirosha uses the earnings from her business to help manage daily family expenses.

Nirosha is asking for a 50,000 LKR loan from BRAC to help increase the goods in her rental shop.

Thank you for taking the time to consider supporting this Sri Lankan loan!

loans.use: to purchase equipment for her rental store

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es:
Victoria tiene 51 años, es soltera y tienes 3 hijos. Vive en comunidad de “Chontabamba”, ceja de selva, donde tienen su casa propia.

Aunque la tecnología haya ingresado en el campo textil no ha significado la desaparición de los artesanos textiles, pues es a lo que se dedica Victoria, ella elabora mantas a mano. Todo comenzó cuando era joven y observaba detenidamente a sus familiares, de quienes aprendió las técnicas de tejido a mano, entonces decidió incursionar en ese negocio. Generalmente vende sus mantas en el mercado de una localidad aledaña, donde tiene muy buena acogida.
Sus planes a futuro son de tener una tienda exclusiva de mantas de todos los estilos, formas, tamaños y colores, las cuales satisfagan la preferencia de sus clientes.

Este es su cuarto préstamo con MFP y es consciente de que tiene la responsabilidad de cumplir con sus respectivos pagos. Con el crédito que solicita invertirá en la compra de materiales como lanas y agujas, para facilitar y agilizar su producción de mantas.
texts.en:
Victoria is 51 years old, single, and has three children. She lives in the jungle community of Chontabamba where she has her own home.

Even though technology has entered the textile field, this has not resulted in the disappearance of textile artisans such as Victoria, who produces handmade blankets. It all started when she was a young girl observing her relatives at work. She learned from them the techniques of knitting and then decided to enter into the same business. Victoria usually sells her blankets at the market in a nearby town where she is well-received. Her plans for the future include having a store that exclusively sells blankets of all styles, textures, sizes, and colors in order to satisfy the preferences of her customers.

This is her fourth loan with MFP. Victoria is aware that she has the responsibility of completing her payments. She will use the loan to buy materials, such as wool and knitting needles, to facilitate and accelerate her production of blankets.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase wool & knitting needles

loans.name: Pemawathi

texts.en:
Pemawathi is a 42-year-old woman living with her husband and two children in southern Sri Lanka.

Pemawathi and her husband manage and run a toy shop in their village. The income they receive from the business helps to pay the family's day-to-day expenses. They started this toy shop two years ago, and the income it has provided has helped to educate their children, on top of paying daily expenses.

Pemawathi is a very hard worker and helps out other members in the village whenever the opportunity arises.

Pemawathi is asking for a 30,000 LKR loan from BRAC to help expand the business. Her business has a good location within the village and her shop has lots of goods, which she hopes to expand with the help of this loan. Her clientele seems to be growing so she hopes this loan will help her expand.

Thank you for taking the time to consider supporting this Sri Lankan loan!

loans.use: To buy supplies for her toy shop

loans.name: María Esperanza

texts.es:
La Sra. María Esperanza G. R. trabaja como conserje en una fabrica de tabaco en el casco urbano del Municipio de Condega.

Ella solicita un crédito en Ceprodel para costear los gastos medico de una operación que se realizara ella en la vista la cual es muy costosa y el seguro de donde ella trabaja no le cubre para este tipo de gastos médicos.

Ella empezó a trabaja en esta fabrica hace ocho años con la necesidad de tener un ingreso fijo mensualmente y así cubrir con sus gastos familiares, ella trabaja de lunes a viernes desde las 7 de la mañana hasta las 5 de la tarde, antes de dedicarse a este trabajo ella se dedicaba  a las labores domestica de su casa.

Ella espera que con esta operación que se realice en su vista mejorar su condición de salud la que no es adecuada y de esta  manera rendir más eficientemente en su trabajo y tener más tranquilidad personal así como su familia también.

María G. es una Sra. Soltera con 4 hijos los que ya son totalmente independientes y solo uno de ellos vive con ella.

Este es el crédito numero 14 que ella tiene en Ceprodel en un periodo de 7 años, mostrándose agradecida por el impacto positivos que dichos financiamientos han tenido en su vida personal ya que le han ayudado a mejorar las condiciones de su hogar así como su salud.
texts.en:
María Esperanza G. R. works as a receptionist in a tobacco factory in the urban area of the Condega municipality. She is seeking a loan from Ceprodel to cover the costs of a medical operation that she needs to have. The operation is very costly and the insurance policy where she works doesn't cover her for these types of medical costs. María began working in this factory 8 years ago because of the need to have a fixed monthly income and cover her household costs. She works from Monday to Friday from 7 am until 5 pm. Before working there María worked around her house doing the domestic chores. María hopes that this operation will improve her health, namely her sight, and in this way make her more efficient at her work and give her and her family more peace. María G. is a single lady with 4 children who are all totally independent, and only one of whom lives with her. This is the 14th loan that María has had with Ceprodel during a 7 year period. She has demonstrated her thankfulness for the positive impact that these loans have had in her personal life, as they have helped her to improve her home's living conditions as well as her health.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Medical costs (vision operation)

loans.name: Marina

texts.es:
Marina García C.  es un señora de 69 años de edad el cual vive con su esposa y sus dos hijos en una comunidad llamada Caño Negro localizada en Los Chiles, provincia de Alajuela; está comunidad se destaca por ser una zona montañosa y por estar muy cerca de la frontera norte de nuestro país. Sus principales actividades económicas son la ganadería y la agricultura específicamente se da la siembra de granos básicos, caña de azúcar, naranja.


Durante toda su vida Doña Marina  y su familia  se han dedicado  a la ganadería de doble propósito. Logra vender sus  productos a los vecinos de su comunidad quienes se muestran muy satisfechos con la calidad de los productos que ofrece. En su caso en particular, la demanda es mayor de lo que puede ofrecer actualmente. 

Asegura que gracias a este proyecto su vida y la de su familia han mejorado de gran manera  por lo tanto, lo que en estos momentos solicita doña Carmen  es un micro crédito de ¢657,000 (seiscientos cincuenta y siete mil colones), para comprar 4 vacas mas que son de muy buena calidad  que ella ya conoce  y de esta manera  poder incrementar la producción. Ella es consciente de que contar con mayor número de vacas implica una mayor atención y cuidado. Sin embargo, el deseo de ser una microempresaria exitosa y mejorar las condiciones de vida propias y las de su familia la motivan a esforzarse con gran esmero.

Doña Marina forma parte de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal Emcrecoba, una de las 100 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Este será su tercer préstamo pero doña Marina destaca que gracias a este tipo de organizaciones y medios facilitadores de crédito se puede dedicar más tiempo a las actividades productivas.
texts.en:
Marina García C. is a 69 year old woman who lives with her husband and two children in the community of Caño Negro, located in Los Chiles, Alajuela Province. This community lies in a mountainous area near the northern border of the country. The main economic activities are ranching and farming, with a specific emphasis on the cultivation of basic grains, sugar cane, and oranges.

Throughout her life, Doña Marina and her family have been dedicated to raising cattle. She sells to her neighbors in her community, who are very satisfied with the quality of the products she offers. In her particular case, demand is greater than what she can currently offer.

Thanks to her life’s work, she says her family has improved greatly. At the moment, Doña Marina is requesting a loan of 657,000 CRC to buy four cows that are of good quality so that she can increase her production. She is aware that having more cows means providing more attention and care. Nonetheless, her desire to be a successful micro-entrepreneur and improve her family’s living conditions encourages her to strive with caution.

Doña Marina is part of the Emcrecoba Communal Credit Enterprise, one of 100 member organizations of EDESA in Costa Rica. This will be her third loan. Doña Marina expresses her thanks for these types of organizations and credit facilitators who are able to spend more time on productive activities.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase four cows

loans.name: Betty Graciela

texts.es: La Sra. Betty tiene 49 años de edad, es separada tiene 3 hijos 2 mayores de edad y la ultima tiene 12 años  de edad, ella se dedica como empleada del  hogar  trabaja en el Distrito de Parcona prestando servcios domesticos,  ella  esta trabajando hace 1 año, anteriormente se dedicaba como obrera de campo, ella cuenta con casa propia  una parte de material noble semi construido con techo te torta ,  con el dinero que solicita invertira en la construccion de su baño, ella tiene sueños y metas el cual es poder tener su casa construida.
texts.en:
Sra. Betty is 49 years old, separated from her spouse, and has three children, two of whom are adults while the youngest is 12 years old. She is employed as a household worker in the District of Parcona providing domestic services and has been working for one year. Previously she worked as a farm laborer. Betty has her own home, which is partially constructed of solid material and has a flat roof. With the loan she requested, Betty will invest in the construction of a bathroom. She has dreams and goals of having her house completely built.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: construir su baño

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en: Samuel C. is a responsible married man living with his wife and two children. He has a junior high education.  Samuel sells soft drinks and bread at Elmina. He has been in this business for some time now. His wife is a trader.  Samuel uses the money he gets from his sales to take care of the family.  Samuel will add the loan to his original capital to purchase more soft drinks to resell. With the new profits from his extended business, Samuel plans to save to build a house on inherited family land.

loans.use: To purchase more soft drinks to resell.

loans.name: Manel

texts.en:
Manel is a 48-year-old married woman with two children, aged 12 and 14. She has a piece of land on which she grows tea, but she also works as a nurse. She uses the income from the tea cultivation and working in the hospital to help support her family.

Manel has gained valuable experience in the tea cultivation business because she has been doing it for eight years now. She is a hard worker as she manages two sources of income and is known to always be willing to help others in her community.

Manel is seeking a 50,000 LKR loan from BRAC to help develop her tea-cultivating business. She hopes to increase her cash flow and provide additional support for her family.

Thank you for taking the time to consider supporting this Sri Lankan loan!

loans.use: To buy agricultural materials to develop her tea-cultivation business

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en: Beatrice E. sells Fan milk products, yoghurt and other sweet flavored ice creams at Elmina.  Beatrice has commercial educational training, where she was taught how to make local and foreign dishes.  She is married and has four children. Her husband is a contractor.  She helps her husband provide clothing, shelter and food for her family. Her loan will be used to buy extra ice cream to sell. She hopes to use the new earnings from her business to save to reinvest into her business.

loans.use: To buy extra ice cream to sell.

loans.name: Clarisa

texts.es: Clarisa, tiene 56 años y junto a ella vive su esposo Gerardo de  45 años en su casa propia, ambos tiene dos hijos, adultos, siendo el mayor casado y la segunda viajó a la capital y actualmente trabaja y estudia, con el fin de tener un futuro mejor. El poseer tierras de cultivo, le ayudó para sacar a su familia adelante, es por ello que se dedica a la siembra de maíz, alverja, habas y verduras en general, pese a que su esposo cayo en el alcoholismo, tuvo que trabajar sola, pero ahora con la ayuda incondicional de su hermano mayor y sobrinos, quienes valoran su esfuerzo, se ocupan de cuidar la siembras, además pudo contratar operarios para apoyarla en la producción y cosecha. Es así que termina siendo negociante de su propia producción, llevándolos todos los miércoles de cada semana a la capital. Vendiendo diversidad de hortalizas frescas. Además de tener la responsabilidad total de su hogar, emprendió el negocio de venta de productos comestibles en una pequeña tienda que instaló en su casa. Por tal motivo espera ampliar su siembra y con ello cubrir la educación superior de su hija,  ya que su mayor anhelo es que sea una profesional. Este es su noveno crédito con MFP, por lo que espera cumplir su propósito, además le gusta trabajar con su grupo comunal, puesto que todos son personas responsables y con deseos de progresar. Con los dos mil quinientos nuevos soles que solicita, comprará una bolsa de semilla de alverja, dos sacos de abono y contratará más operarios para que le ayuden en la cosecha de papa, asimismo comprar productos para abastecer su pequeña tienda.
texts.en:
Clarisa, 56, lives with her husband, Gerardo, 45, in her own home. They have two adult children. Their oldest is married and their daughter moved to the capital to work and study in order to have a better future. Owning farm lands helped her support her family through by growingf corn, peas, broad beans and vegetables in general. Her husband fell into alcoholism and she had to work alone, although now she can count on unconditional help from her older brother and nephews, who value her work and help her out with caring for the crops. She has also been able to hire field workers to help with production and harvesting. Thus, she has become a merchant of her own production; she takes her products to the capital every Wednesday to sell a variety of fresh vegetables. Besides responsibility for her home, she started a small grocery selling business in a small store she set up in her home. She hopes to increase her crop production so that she can afford to pay for her daughter’s college education because her greatest wish is that her daughter becomes a professional. This is her 9th loan with MFP and she expects to meet her goal. Besides, she enjoys working in a communal group because all the members are responsible persons who wish to progress. She will use the 2500 new soles requested to buy a sack of pea seed, two sacks of manure and will hire more field hands to help with the potato harvest; she will also buy stock inventory items for her little store.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy pea seed and hire field workers.

loans.name: Carlos Edgard

texts.es:
Carlos es un padre de familia de 32 años de edad que vive junto a sus esposa y a una hija de siete años de edad en el sector Mancabi Bajo del distrito de Paiján, ubicado en la provincia de Ascope de la región La Libertad, situado a dos horas y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica a brindar servicio de transporte de carga y pasajeros en una mototaxi desde hace 18 meses. El vehículo que maneja es de su propiedad y logró comprarlo gracias a las ganancias que obtuvo hace algun tiempo luego de sembrar espárragos en un campo de cultivo que alquiló. Actualmente el se vale de esta unidad movil para trabajar de 6:00 am a 6:00 pm y ganar el sustento para su familia; su esposa trabaja como recolectora de espárragos en los campos de cultivo de la zona y con lo que ambos ganan sacan adelante a la familia.

Otra de las cosas que logró realizar luego de su cosecha de espárragos fue el empezar a construir su vivienda en un terreno cedido por su padre. Actualmente esta ya esta avanzada y ello lo llena de orgullo. Carlos desea legalizar su posesión y sacar adelante todos los trámites para que su vivenda le pertenezca ante la ley, por ello se encuentra solicitando a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 700 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.

Carlos es un padre de familia responsable y trabajador, el tiene la responsabilidad de movilizar a estudiantes a sus centros de estudios y trata de poner el mayor cuidado al momento de realizar su labor. El ya ha trabajado anteriormente con nuestra Institución y ha demostrado responsabilidad y puntualidad al momento de asumir sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Carlos, 32, lives with his wife and 7-year-old daughter in the Mancabi Bajo neighborhood of Paiján district, Ascope province, La Libertad region, which is two-and-a-half hours from the city of Chiclayo, Lambayeque region’s capital. For the last 18 months he has been a mototaxi (three-wheel vehicle used to transport passengers and cargo) driver. The vehicle is his and he was able to buy it thanks to some profits he made from an asparagus crop he planted some time ago on rented fields. Currently, he drives the vehicle from 6am to 6pm to earn income with which to support his family. His wife works picking asparagus in the area’s fields; what they both earn allows them to support the family. Another of his achievements after the asparagus crop was to begin building his house on a lot his father gave him. Construction has moved forward and he is very proud about this. Carlos would like to legalize his title and negotiate all the paperwork required for the house to legally be his. For this reason, he is asking Edpyme Alternativa for a 700 new sol loan to reach this objective. Carlos is a responsible and hard-working father. It is his responsibility to transport students to their schools and he does his best to do his work with the utmost care. He has collaborated with our institution in the past and has demonstrated responsibility and punctuality with his repayments.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To pay for legalization of his house title.

loans.name: Unidos Para Triunfar Group

texts.es:
Alicia G. es una socia activa D. L. alcancía comunal “UNIDOS PARA TRIUNFAR”, elL. tiene 25 años y vive en L. zona D. Huaycán distrito D. Ate, el grupo lo conforman 9 socios puntuales y responsables ya que su único objetivo es el bienestar D. su familia.

Hace varios años Alicia trabajo en una empresa D. costura  pero deseaba realizar otros trabajos, asi que empezó el negocio D. venta D. productos D. belleza por catalogo. Esto le beneficio mucho ya que pudo apoyar con los gastos en casa y L. mantención D. su hijo. Su mayor sueño es ejercer su profesión ya que elL. estudio Enfermería. El crédito será empleado para L. compra D. suministros textiles.

Con el préstamo otorgado los demas socios invertirán en productos e insumos que les permitan obtener  mayores ganancias y atender a exigentes clientes.
texts.en:
Alicia is one of the active members of the community bank called “United We Triumph”. She is 25 years old and lives in the Huaycán Zone, in the district of Ate. The group is maD. up of nine members who are punctual and responsible. Their only objective is the well being of their families. For many years Alicia has been working as a seamstress. She would like to start another line of work. She just began to sell beauty products by catalogue. This helps her a lot as she can now assist with the household expenses and help pay for the care of her child. Her biggest dream is to work in her profession. She studied nursing. She will use her loan to buy fabric. With the requested loan, the other group members will invest in products and supplies, which will allow them to optimize earnings and attend to the demands of their customers.

Translated from Spanish by Esther Levandoski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy products and supplies

loans.name: John

texts.en: John is a 27-year-old married man. He has been running a cafeteria for seven years.   Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has acquired management and customer care skills from the training they offered him and his business has grown tremendously.  He had previously taken out a loan of Kes 50,000 from Faulu Kenya, which he used to expand his business and successfully repaid. His dream is to own a restaurant and improve his living standards in the future.  He has requested a loan of Kes 60,000 to renovate his premises and buy ingredients such as maize flour and cooking fat and energy saving cookers for cooking.

loans.use: To renovate his business premise and buy maize flour, cooking fat and energy saving cookers

loans.name: Nadeepika

texts.en:
Nadeepika has started a new business selling firewood just in the last two months. Her brother and husband help her in the business of selling firewood in her local village area.

Nadeepika plans to buy more wood with this loan and develop the business further. Her business is located in an advantageous and central location, which she believes will help her expansion. She is recognized in her community as very honest and hard-working.

Nadeepika is seeking a 15,000 LKR loan from BRAC Sri Lanka. Thank you for taking the time to consider supporting this Sri Lankan loan!

loans.use: To buy more firewood to sell

loans.name: Freol

texts.es: Freol tiene 32 años, es un joven entusiasta que desea sacar adelante a su familia, soltero y vive en la casa de su tío Félix, quien tiene una hija. Como ejemplo de sacrificio y entrega a las tierras donde creció, tiene  a su tío, quien le enseñó todas las técnicas agrícolas desde pequeño, es por eso le gusta sembrar y cultivar todos los productos que crecen en sus chacras. Es así que hace 20 años se dedica a la agricultura, y con la ayuda de sus hermanos menores y de algunos operarios que contrató, cuidan de los cultivos de maíz, alverja y papa,  resultándole muy rentable la venta de esta producción, cubriendo de esa manera los gastos y ofreciendo beneficio a su familia, para que no pasen necesidades. En el futuro espera sembrar en mayor cantidad, pues desea convertirse en un negociante mayorista de todos los productos que siembra y existe en la sierra peruana, por lo que está tratando de contar con negociante mayorista en el mercado de la capital. Este es su noveno préstamo con MFP, además le gusta trabajar con su grupo comunal, ya que le  agrada compartir nuevas experiencias con sus compañeros, por lo que desea continuar progresando junto a ellos. Con los dos mil ochocientos nuevos soles que solicita, comprará dos bolsas de semilla de alverja y cinco sacos de fertilizantes.
texts.en:
Freol, 32, is an enthusiastic young man who wants to get his family ahead in life. He is single and lives in his uncle Felix’s house; his uncle has a daughter. His uncle is a living example of someone who sacrifices himself for, and is dedicated to, his native soil. He learned all he knows about farming from him from a very early age. This is why he so enjoys farming his lands. It is thus that he has farmed for the last 20 years and, with help from his younger siblings and some hired help, he cares for corn, pea and potato crops. The sale of these products is quite profitable and provides enough income to cover family expenses so that they can meet all their basic needs. He would like to plant more in the future because he’d like to become a wholesaler of all the products he grows as well as of all products typical of the Peruvian mountains; he is trying to become associated with a wholesaler in the capital’s market. This is his 9th loan with MFP; he enjoys working in a communal group because he likes to share new experiences with his fellow members. He wants to continue to progress together with them. He will use the 2800 new soles requested to buy two sacks of pea seed and five sacks of fertilizer.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy pea seed and fertilizers.

loans.name: Joel Victor Alejandro

texts.es:
Joel es un padre de familia de 27 años de edad que vive junto a su esposa y a su hijo de cuatro años en casa de sus abuelos ubicada en el distrito de Paiján, en la provincia de Ascope de la región La Libertad, ubicada a dos horas y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica a brindar servicio de transporte de carga y pasajeros en una mototaxi desde hace dos años y medio. El primer medio año trabajaba en vehículos alquilados y luego su abuelo le regaló la que actualmente tiene. Desde entonces se ha valido de este vehículo para ganar ingresos adicionales desde las 2:00 pm hasta las 6:30 pm. Por las mañanas trabaja con sus abuelos en el cuidado de su ganado vacuno, el es responsable de la alimentación y cuidado de los animales.

Joel se encuentra solicitando por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que piensa invertir en gastos de escolaridad de su menor hijo y en el mantenimiento y reparación de su vehículo ya que el contínuo uso de este ha hecho que empiece a sufrir algunas fallas.

Joel es un padre de familia que trata siempre de velar por el bienestar de los suyos y también por el de sus abuelos. Sus familiares y amigos le consideran una persona de confianza y responsable.
texts.en:
Joel is a 27-year-old father. He lives with his wife and four year old child in his grandparent’s house located in the Paiján District, in the Ascope Province, in the region of La Libertad. This is located two and a half hours from the city of Chiclayo, capital of the Lambayeque region. For two and a half years Joel has worked transporting cargo and passengers in a taxi. For the first half a year that he did this work, he used a rented vehicle. After this his grandfather gifted him the taxi he now uses. Since then he has used the taxi to earn additional income from 2pm until 6:30pm. In the morning he works with his grandparents caring for their herd of vicuña. He is responsible for the care and feeding of the animals. This is the first time that Joel has asked for a loan from Edpyme Alternativa. He is asking for a loan of 1000 new soles which he thinks he will use to pay for the school expenses of his young son and for the maintenance and repair of his vehicle. His vehicle is beginning to have problems from being used constantly. Joel is a father that is always watching out for the welfare of others and also of his grandparents. His relatives and friends consider him to be a person that is trustworthy and responsible.

Translated from Spanish by Esther Levandoski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For the repair and maintenance of his vehicle and school expenses.

loans.name: Telesia

texts.en: Telesia is 31 years old and married with two children who attend school.  She has been running a green grocery for nine years.  She has one employee who assists her in the business.  She has always distinguished herself as being a very hardworking person and devoted to her family. She was previously selling charcoal before her capital increased and she opened this business. She hopes to open many outlets and improve her living standards in the future. She has requested a loan of Kes 30,000 from Faulu Kenya to expand her business and open a kiosk.

loans.use: To open a kiosk

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en: Daniel is a 25-year-old married man who is blessed with one child.  He offers transport services using a motorbike in Kayole, a few kilometers from the city center.  His business has really grown since he joined Faulu Kenya after he took out a loan of Kes 40,000.  He wants to buy another motorbike to improve his services and earn more income.  Therefore, he has requested a loan of Kes 85,000 from Faulu Kenya.  He dreams of investing in the taxi business in the future.  He describes himself as a hardworking and determined man.

loans.use: To buy a new motorbike

loans.name: Moses

texts.en: Moses is a 31-year-old hardworking man who offers motorbike transport to his area residents.  He previously acquired a motorbike using the loan he took out from Faulu Kenya.  He is the breadwinner in his family and he has three children in school.  He uses his income to support his family.  He plans to buy a new motorbike to make his services efficient. Therefore, he has requested a loan of Kes 85,000 from Faulu Kenya.  He dreams of investing in the taxi business in the future.

loans.use: To buy a new motorbike

loans.name: Flor  De Azucena Group

texts.es:
El centro focal de Panamericana se caracteriza por acoger a socias que se encuentran en Zonas nuevas de la ciudad de El Alto, generalmente migrantes de primera generación.
Es el caso de la asociación “ Flor de Azucena”, cuenta con 12 integrantes y están ingresando al ciclo 16, esto significa pronto cumpliran 8 años trabajando con la familia de Pro Mujer.
Los negocios de las socias son:  venta de ropa, aceite, pelotas, confección de chompas, venta de plástico, elaboración de aguayos (tejido especial  para llevar a los bebes) , venta de condimentos,  tejido de mantas, venta de alimento seco y venta de comida.
 
La señora Casilda M. de 28 años de edad, casada y madre de 5 niños, tiene el negocio de venta de ropa hace un año atrás, ella compra su mercadería de Desaguadero porque es más económico y vende sus productos en la Ceja de la ciudad de El Alto, tambien realiza viajes a diferentes pueblos como Caranavi y espera estar mucho tiempo con la familia de Pro Mujer. En esta oportunidad el préstamo obtenido lo invertirá en la compra de mercadería, es decir, ropa.
texts.en:
The Panamericana focal center is characterized by gathering in members who live in the city of El Alto’s newest areas; usually first-generation immigrants. Such is the case of the “Flor de Azucena “ (Easter Lilly) association. It is composed of 12 members who are starting their 16th loan cycle, which means that they are about to complete their 8th year collaborating with the Pro Mujer family. The members are involved in a variety of commercial activities; such as: sales of clothing, cooking oil, balls. Some make sweaters, others sell plastic items. Some manufacture aguayos (a special woven item used by women to carry their babies on their backs) while others sell condiments. There are blanket weavers, food sellers and grocers. Casilda M., 28, is married and has 5 children. She has sold clothing for a year now. She buys merchandise in Desaguadero, because it’s less expensive there, and sells her products in El Alto’s La Ceja market. She also travels to other towns, like Caranavi. She hopes to be associated with the Pro Mujer family for a long time. She will use this loan to buy clothing.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy clothing.

loans.name: Alcides

texts.es:
Es propietario de una despensa y carniceria bien surtida, y con una clientela bien formada, que le produce buenos ingresos mensuales, ella atiende su negocio con la ayuda de su marido.
El señor tambien tiene una camioneta con la cual reparte mercaderías en las zonas aledañas, es muy trabajador, honesto y responsable. 
    El cliente solicita el préstamo para compra de mercaderías(carne, pastas, panificados, queso, leche, harina, granos) ya que se aproxima la época de la cosecha  y  en esos tiempos hay mucha venta.
texts.en:
He owns a well-stocked grocery and butcher shop. He has a well-established customer base that produces good monthly income. She and her husband tend to their business together. He also has a delivery truck with which he delivers merchandise to outlying neighboring areas. He is hard-working, honest and responsible. He is requesting funds to buy merchandise (meats, pasta, baked goods, cheese, milk, flour, grains) since harvest time in approaching and this means increased sales.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy meat, baked goods, milk, cheese and other products.

loans.name: Vida

texts.en: Vida E. is a happily married woman with three children. She has been educated to the senior high level.  Vida operates a provisions shop and sells things such as spaghetti, canned tomatoes, cooking oil, soaps and other items at Elmina. Her husband is a plumber.  Vida uses the income she generates to help her husband with the upkeep of the home. Vida will use the loan to purchase more provisions for resale and start buying fabric for sale. Trading in fabric will serve as an additional business venture to enter into to generate additional income. With the new profits from her expanded business, Vida plans to save to buy land.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions for resale and start buying fabric for sale

loans.name: Estrellas Group

texts.es:
La  Asociación Comunal “Estrellas” que trabaja en el centro focal de Panamericana cuenta con diez integrantes. Los negocios que las señoras declaran son: venta de buzos, papa, chuño (papa deshidratada) verduras, útiles escolares, ropa y también algunas se dedican al transporte público.
Una de las socias es Ana María V., indica que se encuentra en la Asociación desde hace 1 año, ingresó al grupo por invitación de una amiga.  A sus 48 años, tiene el negocio de venta de útiles escolares y tiene épocas de venta  alta a principios  y mediados de cada año, después la venta es regular, vende su mercadería en la Feria 16 de Julio, ofreciendo a diferentes personas. Ana María invertirá el préstamo  en la compra de material escolar como cuadernos, hojas y demás.
texts.en:
The "Estrellas" (Stars) communal association, that is part of the Panamericana focal center, has 10 members. The woman are involved in the following businesses: sweatshirt sales, potato and dehidrated potato sales, sale of vegetables, school supplies and clothing; some provide public transportation services. One of the members, Ana María V., 48, has been a member for a year; she was invited to join by a girl friend. She sells school supplies and her highest sales occur at the beginning and half way through each year. During the rest of the year, sales are regular. She has her business in the 16 de Julio market and she has various customers. Ana María will use the funds to buy school supplies, such as: notebooks, paper, etc.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy school supplies.

loans.name: Celestino Ramón

texts.es:
El  Sr. Celestino Ramon O.  es de la ciudad de Santaní, del Barrio 1,000 Bertoni, tiene 53 años de edad, esta casado con la Sra. Porfiria Mendez con 48 años de edad. Actualmente tienen 4 hijos todos mayores de edad.
 
Posee una despensa en su domicilio particular, con clientela formada, tiene buen ingreso, buenas referencias comerciales y personales.
 Es un señor muy trabajador y responsable con el pago de sus créditos, ha trabajado en varias ocasiones con la Fundación, mediante su esfuerzo ha logrado conseguir que el negocio que el maneja cresca enormemente.
El cliente esta  proyectando construir un salón comercial mas amplio en su casa para su local comercial. En esta oportunidad solicita el préstamo para la compra de las mercaderías que actualmente falta en su Despensa.
texts.en:
Mr. Celestino Ramon O. is from Santaní City, and lives in the neighborhood 1,000 Bertoni. He is 53 years of age and is married to Mrs. Porfiria Mendez who is 48 years of age. They have 4 children, all adults. Celestino runs a grocery store in his home. He enjoys a steady clientele, good income and has a good business with good commercial and personal references. He is a gentleman who is very hardworking and responsible and always pays his debts. He has worked with the Foundation on previous occasions and through their efforts has succeeded in growing his business enormously. Now, Celestino is hoping to build a larger space for his commercial business. And, because of this opportunity he is soliciting a loan to purchase the products which are currently missing from his store.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Gould, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Compra de panificados, lácteos, embutidos, gaseosas, dulces, golosina. (for the purchase of bakery and dairy products, meats, drinks, sweets and candy)

loans.name: Antonia

texts.es:
La  señora Antonia Zárate de Quintana, es de la ciudad de San Estanislao, es casada, y tiene 4 hijos.
     Se dedica a la venta de ropas, calzados deportibos, y artículos de mercerías en general, desde hace varios años, ya cuenta con clientela formada, viaja en forma semanal a Foz de Iguazu para traer las mercaderías. Las mercaderías que ella trae lo vende en forma ambulante recorriendo los negocios. 
      Su marido trabaja como empleado publico, que también tiene un ingreso fijo mensual, y con los ingresos de la señora Antonia la familia puede salir adelnate con una calidad de vida.
      Con la ayuda crediticia  que recibe de la Fundación cada vez esta creciendo mas su negocio, su sueño es tener un local hacia el centro de la ciudad.
texts.en:
Mrs. Antonia Z. de Quintana lives in the city of San Estanislao. She is married and has 4 children. She has been selling clothing, sports footwear and other general clothing articles for several years now. She depends on her established clientele and travels on a weekly basis to Foz de Iguazu in order to sell and distribute her goods. Her husband works as a public employee and he has a fixed monthly income. Mrs. Z. de Quintana's income has helped them enjoy a better quality of life. With the loan she is receiving from the Foundation, her business is growing and she is moving towards realizing her dream of having a shop in the center of town.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Gould, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Compra de calzados deportivos, ropas, articulos de merceria. (to purchase sports shoes, clothing and miscellaneous clothing accessories)

loans.name: Mirian

texts.es:
La solicitante es de la ciudad de Yrybucua Quinta Linea Cerro Verde es soltera vive con sus padres, es propietaria de una despensa muy surtida con clientela bien formada.
Tiene buenos ingresos en su negocio, también tiene actividad agrícola con su padre, tiene plantación de mandioca, sésamo y maíz. 
     Solicita el préstamo para compra de mercaderías (fideos, harina, panificados, enlatados, embutidos, golosinas, azúcar) ya que se aproxima la época de la cosecha para poder aumentar sus ventas mensuales y para satisfacer las necesidades de cada uno de sus clientes.
texts.en:
The applicant lives in the city of Yrybucua Quinta Linea Cerro Verde, is single and lives with her parents. She owns a grocery store which is well-stocked and has a steady clientele. The business brings in good income, but she also works at farming with her father, where they plant cassava, sesame and maize. Now the applicant is requesting this loan to purchase goods for the grocery store (noodles, flour, bakery products, canned food, sausages, candy, sugar) as it nears harvest time in order to increase her monthly sales and to meet the needs of each customer.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Gould, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Compra de fideos, harina, panificados, enlatados, embutidos, golosinas, azúcar (to purchase noodles, flour, bakery goods, canned goods, beverages, candy and sugar)

loans.name: Perlas Blancas Group

texts.es:
El centro focal de Collpani es relativamente pequeño y se encuentra en una zona alejada del centro de la ciudad de El Alto. En centro focal se encuentra la asociación Perlas Blancas, la misma que está conformada por 14 mujeres y 1 varón.  Este grupo es nuevo,  los negocios que tienen son: venta de juguetes, artículos de limpieza,  costura de buzos,  confección de ropa, costura de mandiles, taller de llantería, venta de masitas y venta de frutas.
 La señora  Nicolaza M., con 47 años indica que antes ya pertenecía a una Asociación y que ahora a decidido integrar un nuevo con amigas y vecinas de su zona, ella tiene el negocio de costura de delantales, aprendió esta actividad de su hermana, el monto que está solicitando es Bs.- 1000 con el que piensa comprar exclusivamente tela y seguir operando en su negocio.
texts.en:
The market center of Collpani is relatively small and is a distance from the center of the city of El Alto. In the market center, you will find the Perlas Blancas (White Pearls) Association, and its members are comprised of 14 women and 1 man. This group is made up of new businesses which include: the sale of toys, cleaning, seamstresses, making and designing clothes, sewing aprons, "Llantería" shop, and the sale pastries and fruits. Mrs. Nicolaz M., who is 47 years of age, indicates that she had belonged to a different Association and has now decided to integrate within this group, who are friends and neighbors in her area. Her business is designing and sewing aprons. She learned this business from her sister. The loan she is requesting will be used to purchase fabric which will be used exclusively for the continued operation of her business.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Gould, Kiva Volunteer
