loans.use: Compra de materia prima (tela) - to purchase materials and products for their businesses

loans.name: José

texts.es:
José es casado, de 54 años, tienen 6 hijos, tres de sus hijas se encuentran estudiando carreras universitarias y el único hijo varón le ayuda con los que trabajos de la zapatería y los  otros dos se encuentran cursando sus estudios secundarios. 
Su esposa trabaja bendiendo chipa hace más de 25 años para así ayudarle a tener más ingresos con el objetivo de que sus hijos puedan terminar sus estudios. 
José hace más de 35 años se dedica a la confección y compostura de zapatos, es uno de los zapateros mas renombrado de la zona, cuenta con clientela formada, también trabaja al por mayor entregando más de 250 pares de calzado terminado para su posterior venta en la ciudad de Asunción. 
Gracias a su dedicación  y perseverancia en su profesión está saliendo adelante, brindarle una mejor calidad de vida y educación a sus hijos.
Precisa del préstamo para la compra de materia prima (cueros) para satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes.
texts.en:
José is married, he is 54 years of age and has 6 children. Three of his daughters are studying in the university, one of his sons helps him work in the shoe shop and the other two children are enrolled in high school. His wife has worked bending "chipa" for over 25 years now in order to help bring in more income so their children can finish their education. For 35 years now, Jose has worked designing and making shoes; and is one of the most renowned shoemakers in the area. He has a steady clientele, and also sells some of his shoes wholesale (over 250 pairs of shoes so far) in the city of Asunción. Thanks to the dedication and perseverance in his profession, his business is moving forward and it has provided a better quality of life and education for their children. This loan will be used to purchase raw materials (hides) to meet customer demand.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Gould, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Compra de cuero (to purchase raw materials - hides- to be used in his business)

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Nelson

texts.en: Nelson is 26 years old and married with two children who go to school. He runs a retail shop where he sells general merchandise such as rice, sugar, cooking fat and soaps.  He has been in this business for ten years.  He also rents out residential houses to earn a living.  He was previously employed in the transport industry as a driver before he went into business.   Previously, he had taken a loan of Kes 30,000, which he used to expand his business and successfully paid. He has requested a loan of Kes 60,000 to buy sugar, rice, baking powder and maize flour to sell.

loans.use: To buy more sugar, rice, baking powder and maize flour

loans.name: Fraciah

texts.en:
Fraciah is a widow who lives with her four children. She supports her family by selling construction materials and has been in this business for nine years now. She also practices farming for commercial purposes to stabilize her income. 

She has previously taken out a loan from Faulu Kenya, a loan she used to expand her business and which she successfully repaid. She hopes to achieve a stable income and improve her living standards in the future. 

She is requesting a loan of kes 40,000 from Faulu Kenya to add to her stock of construction materials, particularly cement, ballast, and sand.

loans.use: To buy cement, ballast, and sand

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Erik

texts.es: Erick tiene 26 años, es un joven emprendedor con muchos proyectos futuros, está casado con Zaida de 24 años, con quien tiene una hija, y juntos viven en la casa de sus padres. El motor de su vida es su pequeña hija, su mayor motivación, que desde las 5 de la mañana trabaja en sus cultivos de papa, maíz y hortalizas, por lo que también es apoyado por su esposa y algunos operarios, que trabajan removiendo y cuidando dichos cultivos. Parte de esta labor que realiza, lo más dificultoso es tener que regar por las noches, sin tener ningún tiempo de descanso, sin embargo es compensado, con las ganancias que obtiene de la venta de verduras que cosecha, gracias a ello, pudo comprar los muebles para su vivienda y la obtención de otro terreno, para asegurar más ingresos económicos. Es así que Erik y su esposa, planean comprar una casa que tenga un terreno amplio para cultivo e incluso una camioneta para trasladar su producción hacia los mercados de su ciudad. Este es su tercer crédito con MFP, por lo que espera mejorar su actividad agrícola y su economía. Por otro lado desea continuar trabajando con su grupo comunal, por ser personas muy puntuales en sus pagos. Con los mil nuevos soles que solicita, piensa comprar varios sacos de abono y una lata de semilla de col.
texts.en:
Erik is 26 years old and is an enterprising young man with many plans for the future. He is married to Zaida, who is 24, and together they have a child. The family lives with Erik's parents in their house. Erik's little daughter is the one who keeps him going, she is his greatest motivation. Beginning at 5 in the morning, Erik works raising potatoes, corn and other vegetables. He is helped by his wife and some other workers who help till the soil and care for the plants. The most difficult part of Erik's work is having to water the fields at night, and having no time to rest. He is compensated, however, by the income that he brings in from the sale of the vegetables he harvests. Thanks to this income he was able to buy furniture for his house and was able to buy another plot of land, in order to gain yet more income. Erik and his wife plan to buy a house with a large amount of land for growing food, and also a truck to take their products to the markets in their city. This is Erik's third loan with MFP [the Kiva field partner], and he hopes to use it to improve his ventures in agriculture and his finances. He also wants to keep working with his communal bank, because the other group members are on time in their payments. With the 1000 Peruvian Soles he is asking for, he will buy many bags of fertilizer and a container of cabbage seeds.

Translated from Spanish by Catherine Fountain, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cabbage seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Clemente Eugenio

texts.es:
Clemente Jiménez de 49 años, vive en una zona periurbana en la Perimetral de Guayaquil, su casa es de cemento y cuenta con todos los servicios básicos, su esposa lo ayuda en la imprenta ellos tienen 5 hijos. 

Clemente inicio con la imprenta cuando lo despidieron de la planta en que el trabajaba. Debido a la falta de oportunidades tuvo que invertir todos sus ahorros en una maquina de imprenta, poco a poco con la ayuda de su familia creció en su negocio.

La imprenta que ahora tiene es un negocio familiar sus hijos y esposa le ayudan desde las 07: am hasta las 19:00 pm todos los días. Ellos hacen fundas, postre, pastitos y otras cosas. La delincuencia es una de las mayores dificultades que tiene.

Con el préstamo quiere comprar tinta, papel, cartones para su imprenta. En el futuro tiene como proyecto la serigrafía con nuevos diseños y más novedades.
texts.en:
Clemente Jiménez, 49, lives in a periurban area along Guayaquil's beltway in a cement house that has all basic utilities; his wife helps him in his print shop and they have 5 children. Clemente had to open his print shop after he was let go from the factory he was employed at. Due to lack of employment opportunities, he was forced to invest all his savings in a printing press. Gradually, with help from his family, his business grew. The printshop he now has is a family busines that he runs with his wife and children, who help him from 7am until 7pm every day. One of his major challenges is the crime in the area. He will use the funds to buy ink, carboard and paper for his printshop. For the future, he has a silkscreening project with new designs and more novelties.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Ink, cardboard, paper.

loans.name: Lukas

texts.en:
Lukas is a 29-year-old married man with one son. His wife is a businesswoman, while he sells construction materials such as cement, ballast, and sand. He explains that he has been in this business for the past seven years.

Since he became a member of Faulu Kenya, he has been able to expand his business by using the loan he received from the organization. He wants to improve on his sales, so he is requesting a loan in the amount of 44,000 KES ($575). With the loan proceeds, he plans to add to his inventory by purchasing an additional stock of sand, ballast, and cement. In ten years time, he sees himself becoming the main supplier of construction materials in his area.

loans.use: To generate additional sales by purchasing cement, ballast, and sand

loans.name: Fredrick

texts.en:
Fredrick is a 21-year-old single man who supplies timber and firewood to earn a living. He explains that he has been in this business for three years, and that he is a hardworking man who is determined to succeed in his business.

He appreciates Faulu Kenya for helping him to expand his business. He is now requesting a loan in the amount of 40,000 KES ($525) to buy more timber for resale purposes. He hopes to expand his business and to eventually become the main supplier of timber in his area.

loans.use: To expand his business by purchasing additional timber

loans.name: Bessie

texts.en:
Bessie is a 47-year-old married woman with two children, both of whom are in college. To earn a living, she operates a car wash in Rongai, which is in the outskirts of the city of Nairobi. She has two employees to assist her with the business. She also offers catering services for events, including weddings and parties. She explains that she is determined, hardworking, and diligent.

She hopes that the loan she is requesting will have a positive effect on both her business and her life in general. Bessie hopes to expand her business in order to general more income. Therefore, she is requesting a loan in the amount of 20,000 KES ($275) to buy a car wash pressure pump.

loans.use: To expand her business by purchasing a car wash pressure pump

loans.name: Mujeres De Chilcato Tora Group

texts.es:
Las integrantes del  banco comunal Mujeres de Chilcato Tora son damas emprendedoras, trabajadoras que a pesar de los inconvenientes encontrados en el día a día buscan la manera de surfear estos inconvenientes  y salir adelante junto a sus familias, este banco se localiza en la ciudad de Cuenca en la comunidad Chilcato Tora de ahí el nombre de su banco comunal, este sector se caracteriza por tener unos hermosos paisajes andinos llenos de vegetación propia de la zona,  su gente se dedica a la agricultura y ganadería. 

Gloria se casó muy joven a sus 20 años ya tiene un niño de tres años, su esposo trabaja como empastador de paredes, no tiene casa propia por lo que vive en casa de su mamá de manera independiente.

Nuestra socia se dedica a criar animales como  chanchos, gallinas, vacas,  tanto para la venta como para el consumo en  su casa, la leche que producen sus vacas si es exclusivo para el consumo de su familia y los animales los vende  a sus vecinos de la comunidad para solventar algún apuro económico. 

Gloria es una joven muy alegre y tiene una muy buena amistad con todas sus compañeras  de su banco comunal del que forma parte desde hace dos ciclos, con el crédito solicitado va a  comprar   pollos, vitaminas y alimento para criarlos y venderlos. Tiene como máximo  sueño construir su casa propia.

Carmen C. tiene 60 años enviudó  hace 29 años porque un auto atropello a su esposo, además perdió un hijo de los siete que concibió, sus tres hijos mayores son casados  y sólo vive en su casa propia  con sus otros tres hijos  que aun son solteros y le ayudan económicamente con los gastos del hogar.

Carmen se dedica a la cría de pollos, chanchos, vacas, la  leche de sus vacas a veces entrega al carro lechero o  lo deja para el consumo de su hogar, sus animales son vendidos en la comunidad, nos comenta que lleva once años en esta difícil labor que aprendió de sus padres y gracias a ello ha logrado sacar adelante a sus hijos.

Nuestra socia  se encuentra en su segundo ciclo y con el préstamo que realiza va a comprar pollos y alimento para seguir con su negocio. Su meta es llegar  a construir un galpón para incrementar su criadero de pollos.
texts.en:
The members of the Communal Bank "Mujeres de Chilcato Tora" [Women of Chilcato Tora] are enterprising and hard-working despite the daily inconveniences they face. They are always looking for a way to work through these issues and get ahead along with their families. This bank is located in the city of Cuenca, in a community called Chilcato Tora, hence the bank's name. This area is characterized by beautiful Andean landscapes with native vegetation. The people who live there work in agriculture and cattle raising. Gloria got married young, and now at age 20 she has a three-year-old son. Her husband works patching walls. They don't have their own house and so they live with her husband's mother although they are financially independent. Gloria works raising animals such as pigs, chickens, and cows, both for sale and for her own family's use. The milk produced by her cows is only for the family's use, and she sells her animals to the people in her community in order to be able to cover any unexpected expenses. Gloria is a happy young woman and she enjoys a friendly relationship with all of the other members of her communal bank. She has been working with the bank for two loan cycles. With this loan she wants to buy chickens, and vitamins and feed to raise and sell them. Her greatest dream is to be able to build her own house. Carmen C. is 60 years old and was widowed 29 years ago when her husband was hit by a car. She also lost one child of the seven that she carried. Her three oldest children are married and the other three, who are single, live with her in the house she owns. They help her out in paying the household expenses. Carmen also works raising chickens, pigs and cows. She either sells the milk she gets from her cows to a delivery truck or uses it at home. She sells her animals in the neighboring community. She has told us that she's been doing this hard work for eleven years and that she learned it from her parents. Her work has helped to allow her children to get ahead in life. Carmen is in her second loan cycle and with this loan she will buy chickens and feed in order to continue with her work. Her goal is to build a warehouse in order to expand her chicken raising operation.

Translated from Spanish by Catherine Fountain, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy chickens, vitamins and feed.

loans.name: Isaac

texts.es:
Isaac H. T. es un joven  de 18 años de edad el cual vive con Familia en una comunidad llamada Coquital  localizada en Los Chiles, provincia de Alajuela; está comunidad se destaca por ser una zona montañosa y por estar muy cerca de la frontera norte de nuestro país. Sus principales actividades económicas son la ganadería y la agricultura específicamente se da la siembra de granos básicos y  naranja.

Actualmente Isaac trabaja con su  padre como empleado en una Finca, pero ha decidido que quiere tener su propio negocio. El  quiere comprar repuestos de bicicletas  para así  levantar su propia venta de repuestos que le genere ingresos necesarios para ayudar a su familia.

Agrega que le llena de motivación y orgullo el hecho de tener su propio negocio y ofrecer a su comunidad un servicio  tan necesario, ya que mucha gente utiliza este medio para transportarse y no hay ninguna venta de repuestos en la comunidad.  Isaac Asegura que es un joven muy responsable y que su deseo de superación le ayudara a tener éxito con su nuevo negocio.
 
Isaac requiere un préstamo de ¢657000.00 (seiscientos cincuenta y siete mil colones) para comprar los repuestos y mejorar las condiciones del local. 

El forma parte de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal Rapicrédito Progreso Futuro Coquital, una de las 100 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Este es el primer crédito de Isaac  y con el espera  mejora su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Isaac Hernández T., 18, lives with his family in a community called Coquital, located in Los Chiles, Alajuela province. This community stands out for being a very mountainous area and for being very close to the country’s northern border. Its main commercial activities are cattle raising and farming, especially of basic grains and oranges. Isaac and his father are currently employed on a large farm but he has decided that he’d like to have his own business. He wants to buy bicycle replacement parts and set up his own bicycle spare part sales to generate income to help meet family expenses. He adds that having his own business fills him with motivation and pride because he will provide a service that is very needed in his community since many residents use this particular means of transportation and there is no spare parts business in the community. Isaac assures us that he is a very responsible young man and that his desire to excel will help him be successful in his new business. Isaac needs a 657,000 colones loan to buy the spare parts and improve the conditions of his locale. He is a member of Empresa de Crédito Comunal Rapicrédito Progreso Futuro Coquital, one of EDESA’s 100 member organizations in Costa Rica. This is Isaac’s first loan which he expects will improve his and his family’s quality of life

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Bicycle Replacement Parts

loans.name: Petrona Isabel

texts.es: Petrona Isabel de 36 años de edad es casada con el el Sr. Melvin Lazo, con quien procreo 2 niños, Melvin Antonio de 6 años estudiando 1er grado de primaria y el menor Isaac de añitos de edad.  Petrona es vendedora de productos cosmeticos Vogue desde hace varios años, cuenta con el apoyo de su marido quien asume los gastos del hogar. Esta solicitando su 1er credito para poder comenzar la construccion de su casa, pues su mamá le cedio un terreno para que tuviera su propio techo, ya cuenta con una parte de los materiales, pero le hace falta comprar cemento, hierro y pagar la mano de obra de los albañiles.  El mayor sueño de Petrona es poder ver construida su casa, ya que es el patrimonio que sus padres le estan dando y en el futuro piensa mejorarla para que sus hijos tengan mayor comodidad.
texts.en:
Petrona Isabel, 36, is married to Melvin Lazo, with whom she has two children: Melvin Antonio, 6, who is in first grade and Isaac, who is still an infant. Petrona has sold Vogue brand cosmetics for several years; her husband supports her efforts and pays household expenses. She is asking for her first loan to start building her house because her mother ceded a lot to her so that she could have her own home. She already has some of the materials but still needs to buy cement and iron and must pay the bricklayer labor costs. Petrona's greatest dream is to see her house completed because this is her parents' legacy to her and she plans to improve it in the future so that her children can have more comfort.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy building materials and supplies and to pay labor costs.

loans.name: Maria Dolores

texts.es: Maria Dolores tiene 42 años, por lo que su actividad económica es una pulpería además de tener este negocio también vender ciertos productos de mercadería en general. Hace más de 27 años que se dedica a este negocio, ella ofrece todo tipo de productos de consumo diarios, Maria tiene 2 hijos de 9 7 años ella se hace cargo de ellos, por lo que se preocupa por brindarles la oportunidad de estudiar. El financiamiento que solicitan es para capital de trabajo que será destinado para la compra de granos básicos, detergentes, golosinas, juegos, pan y sopas. Sueña con incrementar su inventario para su negocio.
texts.en:
Maria Dolores, 42, has a small grocery store; she also sells general merchandise. She has been in this line of work for over 27 years and offers all sorts of daily use items. Maria has two children, who are 9 and 7 years of age, and who are under her care; she strives to provide them with the opportunity to go to school. She will use the funds to buy stock inventory items, like: basic grains, detergents, sweets, juices, bread and soups. She dreams with increasing her store's inventory.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy stock inventory merchandise.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is 25 years old and married with one child. She has been running a tailoring shop for 11 years to earn a living.  Her business is located in Kiambu on the outskirts of Nairobi city. She really works hard to be able to provide her family with their basic needs. She hopes to expand her business and improve her living standards in the future.  Due to her limited capital, she is unable to meet all her customers’ needs. She has therefore requested a loan of Kes 20,000 from Faulu Kenya to buy fabric.

loans.use: To buy fabric

loans.name: Philip

texts.en: Philip is a 41-year-old mechanic, married and a father of four. Three of his children are in school.  He has been successful in his business because he makes a strong effort to provide good customer care. He has been in this business for 12 years now.  He has one employee who assists him in the business.  He was employed before he started this business.  He desires to expand his business to a large workshop in the future. He has requested a loan of Kes 20,000 from Faulu Kenya to buy a spraying machine. He describes himself as ambitious and enterprising.

loans.use: To buy a spraying machine

loans.name: Marjorie

texts.es:
Marjorie R. H.  es un señora de 38 años de edad la cual vive con su esposo  y sus tres hijos en una comunidad llamada Caño Negro localizada en Los Chiles, provincia de Alajuela; está comunidad se destaca por ser una zona montañosa y por estar muy cerca de la frontera norte de nuestro país. Sus principales actividades económicas son la ganadería y la agricultura específicamente se da la siembra de granos básicos, caña de azúcar, naranja.


Desde hace 1 año  Doña Marjorie se dedica a la cría de pollos para engorde y gallinas ponedoras para la producción de carne y huevos, ella vende sus productos a los vecinos de su comunidad los cuales se muestran muy satisfechos. Ella dice que tener el apoyo y la ayuda de sus hijos le  facilita seguir con el proyecto. Además dice que el proyecto le es muy interesante   ya que ha visto como desde el inicio su negocio le ha generado ganancia y poco a poco va creciendo por que  la demanda cada vez es más fuerte.

 Actualmente doña Marjorie está solicitando un micro crédito de ¢657.000 (seiscientos cincuenta y siete mil colones) para la compra de más pollos y gallinas; concentrado, y productos para el tratamiento de enfermedades. Con esto ella espera hacer crecer más su negocio y mejorar su calidad de vida. Su negocio va bien pero por falta de dinero no ha podido hacerlo crecer más. Con el préstamo que está solicitando espera aumentar las ventas y así mejorar la condición económica de su familia.


Doña Marjorie forma parte de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal Emcrecoba, una de las 100 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Este será su primer préstamo. Pero doña Marina destaca que gracias a este tipo de organizaciones y medios facilitadores de crédito se puede dedicar más tiempo a las actividades productivas.
texts.en:
Marjorie R. H. is 38 year old woman who lives with her husband and three children in the community of Caño Negro located in Los Chiles, in the province of Alajuela. This community is known for its mountainous terrain and for its proximity to country's northern border. The area's principal economic activities are livestock farming and agriculture, growing specifically basic grains, sugar, and orange. Marjorie has been raising and feeding laying hens to produce meat and eggs. She sells her products to her neighbors, who are very satisfied. She has the support and help of her children which makes it easier to continue with her business. Additionally, she believes this endeavor is very interesting as she has seen how her business generates earnings and grows little by little as demand increases. Currently, Marjorie is asking for a microloan of ¢657,000 (six hundrend fifty seven thousand colones) for the purchase of more chickens and hens, concentrate, and supplies for the treatment of diseases. With it, she expects to grow her business and improve her quality of life. Her business is doing well but because of lack of capital, she has been unable to grow it even more. With the loan she's asking for she expects to increase sales, thereby improving the economic conditions of her family. Marjorie belongs to the "Empresa de Crédito Comunal Emcrecoba," one of the 100 partner organizations for EDESA in Costa Rica. This will be her first loan. She mentions that because of organizations like those and others that facilitate credit she is able to devote more time to productivie activities.

Translated from Spanish by Rocio Vargas, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of chickens, construction of shop to sell chickens

loans.name: Benard

texts.en: Benard is a 32-year-old married man with three children who go to school.  He has been doing carpentry for five years. He makes furniture for sale.  He has one employee to assist him in the business.  He also practices farming together with his wife to increase their earnings.  He hopes to open other outlets and improve his living standards in the future.  He has requested a loan of Kes 20,000 from Faulu Kenya to purchase timber and equipment such as a saw, nails and pliers for his business.

loans.use: To purchase timber and equipment

loans.name: Leandra Yesenia

texts.es: Leandra Yesenia de 33 años de edad es casada, no tiene hijos, se recibio como Administradora de Empresas, pero actualmente trabaja para el Sr. Nolberto Mendoza como vendedora de productos farmaceuticos desde hace 2 años, pero ademas es pequeña comerciante de cosmeticos, carteras, ropa, etc, tiene su negocio ubicado en el mercado Mayales de la ciudad de Juigalpa, y en este momento necesita financiamiento para invertirlo en compra de productos para fortalecer su inventario, ya que como es epoca de verano quiere comprar sandalias, sobreros y otras cositas que se venden  en semana santa.  El mayor sueño de Leandra es poder fortalecer su negocio para cuando lleque a tener su propia familia, pueda brindarle las condiciones basicas del hogar.
texts.en:
Leandra Yesenia, 33, is married and has no children. She graduated with a business administration degree but has been emplyed by Mr. Nolberto Mendoza selling pharmaceuticals for the last 2 years. In addition, however, she is a merchant selling cosmetics, purses, clothing, etc. She has a small business in Juigalpa's Mayales market. She needs funding to invest in stock items to increase her inventory especially with Summer items like sandals, hats and other things that sell well during Holy Week. Leandra's greatest wish is to strengthen her business so that, when she has her own family, she will be able to provide her home with basic conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sandals, hats and other inventory items.

loans.name: Rosa Josefa

texts.es: LA SRA. ROSA ES UNA CLIENTE ANTIGUA (SEPTIMA SECUENCIA),  HA MOSTRANDO RESPONSABILIDAD Y PUNTUALIDAD EN LOS PAGOS D. SUS CREDITOS, ELLA TIENE LA DETERMINACION D. LLEGAR A VENDER POR MAYOR, ES EMPRENDEDORA, EL PUESTO D. VENTA  SE  ENCUENTRA EN LA POPULOSA  ZONA D. LA 16 D. JULIO,LA SEÑORA SE ESFUREZA POR SUPERARSE YA QUE TRABAJA DESD. LA MADRUGADA HASTA QUE SE PONE EL SOL, EL ESPOSO D. DOÑA ROSA ES COSTURERO QUIEN LA APOYA EN SU SUEÑO D. SER UNA EMPRESARIA, EL MAYOR ANHELO D. LA CLIENTA ES LLEGAR A SER RECONOCIDA POR LA SOCIEDAD EN SU LUCHA D. MEJORAR SU CALIDAD D. VIDA. CON EL DINERO DEL CREDITO COMPRARA MERCADERIA AL POR MAYOR COMO ZAPATOS ULTIMOS MODELOS D. LA TEMPORADA, ESTA AGRADECIDA CON EMPRENDER Y KIVA POR LA CONFIANZA BRINDADA EN LA OTORGACION DEL CREDITO.
texts.en:
Rosa is an old client (in her seventh loan cycle). She has demonstrated responsibility and punctuality in the payments of her loans. Rosa is determined to sell better, and is an enterprising woman. She has a stand located in the populous 16 D. Julio zone. Rosa works very hard to better herself and works from sunrise until sunset. Her husband is a tailor and supports her in her dream to be a businesswoman. Her greatest longing is to become recognised by society in her quest to improve her quality of life. With the money Rosa is seeking she will purchase merchandise such as the latest styles of shoes. Rosa is thankful to Emprender and Kiva for the confidence they have shown in granting her loans.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase new styles of shoes

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose is 42 years old. She buys fish in bulk from fishermen and resells them to consumers.  Before she became a member of Faulu Kenya, she had a lot of challenges. She needed money to provide her family with their basic needs as well as to start a business.  She has been in this business for four years. She wishes to expand her business and improve her living standards in the future. She has requested for a loan of Kes 10,000 from Faulu Kenya to add more fish, energy saving cookers, spoons and a fish rack.

loans.use: To buy fish, energy saving cookers, spoons and a fish rack

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Jose Javier

texts.es: Jose Javier de 26 años de edad es soltero, vive en union libre con la joven Rosa Adilia Hurtado con quien procreo a su hijo de nombre Wiston, que tiene 2 añitos de edad; Jose trabaja para la Alcaldia Municipal de Juigalpa como Policia Municipal desde hace casi 3 años, esta solicitando su 2do credito con el objetivo de mejorar su vivienda, cambiando el techo que se encuentra en mal estado antes que inicie el invierno, ademas desea ponerle perlines en vez de madera para que dure mas tiempo.  Jose Javier es un joven con gran espiritu de superacion, pues a pesar de los horarios que tiene que cumplir con su trabajo en los turnos de la noche, tambien estudia los domingos su 4to año de secundaria, su esposa tambien estudia el 5to año de secundaria, pues el mayor sueño que tienen es poder coronar una carrera universitaria para obtener mejores oportunidades de trabajo que le permitan darle a su familia y a su hijo un mejor porvenir.
texts.en:
Jose Javier, 26, is single and lives in a common-law union with Rosa Adilia Hurtado, with whom he has son, Wiston, 2. Jose has been a police officer with the city of Juigalpa for almost 3 years now. He is asking for his 2nd loan to do some home improvements, specifically replacing the damaged roof before Winter. Besides, he wants to install metal sheeting because it lasts longer than wood Jose Javier is a young man with a great self-improvement spirit because, despite his work schedule-he works the night shift-he is also finishing 10th grade on Sundays; his wife is finishing 11th grade. Their greatest dream is to complete a college degree so that their work opportunities will be better and they will be able to provide their family and son a better future.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To replace the roof.

loans.name: Mardonia

texts.es:
Mardonia tiene 36 años, es muy laboriosa y atenta, vive en casa de su mamá, Alejandrina de 66 años, a quien cuida, al igual que sus 4 hermanas y dos sobrinas que viven con ella también. Lleva 7 años dedicados a la venta de productos comestibles, en un espacio que sus padres le cedieron. Es así que se dedica a esta actividad, siendo su tienda la preferida de sus vecinos, pues su manera tan amable de atender a las personas que le visitan su tienda, hace que gane la atención de ellos. Paralelamente a su trabajo, se dedica también a la siembra maíz, alverja, papa y cebada, cultivados en terrenos propios que tiene y gracias a la ayuda de operarios, es que aún conserva esta actividad.
De esta manera la venta de comestibles le ha sido rentable, permitiéndole cubrir sus gastos, por lo que espera mas adelante ampliar su tienda para vender más productos que son muy solicitados por sus clientes. En un futuro desea tener un local comercial, que le permitan dar más utilidades. Este es su octavo crédito con MFP, por lo que espera concretar sus planes. Además como integrante de su grupo comunal, ha aprendido a valorar  el esfuerzo que emprende cada uno de sus compañeros para efectuar puntualmente cada pago, es por eso que le agrada laborar a lado de ellos. Con los tres mil nuevos soles que solicita, comprará productos para abastecer su tienda, asimismo desea comprar una bolsa de semilla de alverja y 5 sacos de abono para continuar con su actividad agrícola.
texts.en:
Mardonia, 36, is very attentive and hard-working. She lives in her mother, Alejandrina’s, 66, house. She cares for her mother, her two sisters and two nieces that also live with her. She has sold groceries for the last 7 years in a locale her parents gave her. Her store is her neighbors’ favorite because of the kindness she shows to those who come to her store. In conjunction with her store, she also farms; she grows corn, pea, potato and barley on her own farmlands. Thanks to help from field hands, she still has this commercial activity. Grocery sales have been a profitable endeavor which has produced enough for her to meet basic expenses. She hopes to enlarge her store later on to sell more products that are in high demand by her customers. In the future, she’d like to have a commercial location that will allow for higher profits. This is her 8th loan with MFP which she hopes will help her consolidate her plans. In addition, as a member of a communal group, she has learned to value the effort which each member places into repaying each installment on time; this is why she likes to work with them so much. She will use the 3000 new soles to buy stock items for her store as well as a sack of pea seed and 5 sacks of manure to continue with her farming activity.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy stock items for her store as well as pea seed and manure.

loans.name: Ramiro Antonio

texts.es: Ramiro de 48 años de edad es soltero, labora para el MINED desde hace 25 años, vive en union libre con la Sra. Elieth Portillo, tiene 5 hijos, 4 ya estan casados y tienen su propia familia, la menor de 17 años se llama Victoria y esta estudiando 3er año de secundaria a quien apoya.  El profesor Ramiro esta solicitando su 5to credito a AFODENIC con el objetivo de construir una habitacion en su casa, para asi tener mayor comodidad y privacidad, ya que la familia es grande y no cuentan con el sufiente espacio para vivir todos, pues en la casa viven los hijos del matrimonio anterior de doña Elieth.  El mayor sueño de Ramiro es poder brindarle a su señora las condiciones basicas de un hogar acorde a sus posibilidades.
texts.en:
Ramiro, 48, is single and has worked for the Ministry of Education for the last 25 years. He lives in a common law union with Elieth Portillo; they have 5 children, four of whom are married and have their own families. Their youngest, Victoria, 17, is in 3rd year of secondary school and he supports her. Ramiro is asking AFODENIC for his 5th loan which he will use to build a bedroom in his house in order to be more comfortable and have more privacy since they are a large family and they lack sufficient space for all of them to live because Elieth's children from a former marriage live in the house, too. Ramiro's greatest wish is to provide his wife with basic home conditions according to his means.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To build a bedroom.

loans.name: Juan De La Cruz

texts.es: Juan de la Cruz de 27 años de edad es soltero, vno tiene hijos, trabaja para la Alcaldia Municipal de Juigalpa como Operario de Limpieza desde hace 2 años, habita junto a su mamá la Sra. Dominga E., quien recibe una pequeña pension por parte del INSS, Juan esta solicitando su 2do credito con el objetivo de mejorar la vivienda de su mamá, pues desea comprar zinc y perlines para cambiar el techo de la casa que se encuentra en mal estado antes que llegue el invierno, pues el mayor sueño que tienen es poder ayudarle a su mamá en lo que mas pueda, ya que ella lo cuido cuando era pequeño y dio todo por el, ahora el desea mejorar las condiciones de vida de ella para que tenga una vejes tranquila, pues considera que ya trabajo lo sufiente.
texts.en:
Juan de la Cruz, 27, is single and has no children. He has been employed by Juigalpa's City Hall as a sanitation worker for the last 2 years. He lives with his mother, Dominga E., who receives a small social security pension. Juan is asking for his 2nd loan to do some improvements to his mother's house because he wants to buy zinc metal sheeting and gutters to replace the damaged roof before Winter arrives. His greatest wish it to help his mother all he can because she has cared for him since he was a baby and gave everything for him. Now, he wants the best living conditions for her so that she can have a peaceful old age because he feels she has already worked more than enough.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To replace the roof.

loans.name: Felix

texts.es: Félix a sus 63 años, continúa dedicándose a la agricultura. Es soltero y junto a él, vive su hermana menor Eutenia y su sobrina Xianela,  en la casa que le heredaron sus padres. La dedicación que le brindó a su madre en vida, hizo que Félix, no tenga su propia familia, sin embargo no le quitaron la voluntad de trabajar como se debe, por eso lleva 40 años dedicado a la siembra de alverja, papa, maíz y algunas verduras, en sus terrenos propios y con la ayuda de operarios que contrató, pueden aún mantenerla, además su hermana menor la apoya preparando el almuerzo diariamente. Paralelo a esta actividad, también se dedica al oficio de albañil, porque siempre se esforzó por brindarle lo mejor a sus seres queridos, es que le gusta lo que hace, considerándolo como un padre en la familia. Lo que más le gusta es sembrar alverjas, ya que disfruta ver como crece y florece esta planta. En el futuro piensa reparar y mejorar la construcción de su casa, para que sus sobrinos dispongan del inmueble, de igual manera desea arrendar sus chacras, para tener mayores utilidades y con ello continuar ahorrando, para así asegurar su vejez. Este es su décimo crédito con MFP, además está satisfecho de pertenecer a su grupo comunal, por ser un grupo bien organizado y en donde aprendió a ahorrar. Entretanto solicita, dos mil quinientos nuevos soles para comprar ocho sacos de abono y dos bolsas de semilla de alverja.
texts.en:
Felix who is 63 years old continues to devote himself to agriculture. He is single and lives with her younger sister Eutenia and niece Xianela, in the house he inherited from his parents. The devotion he had towards his mother while she was living caused Felix not to have his own family. However, that didn't make him want to work any less, that is why she's been working for 40 years growing peas, potatoes, corn, and other vegetables in his own land and with help that he has hired. He is still able to take care of his land and his sister supports him by preparing his lunch every day. Additionally, he is also a bricklayer. He always made an effort to provide for his loved ones and that's why he likes his job and the reason that he is consided a father by his own family. What he enjoys most is to grow peas since he likes to see how the plant grows. In the future he plans to repair and improve his house so that his nephews can have it. Additionally, he wants to rent his land so that he can increase his earnings and continue savings and thereby secure his retirement. This is his tenth loan with MFP. He is glad to belong to his communal group because it is very organized and taught him how to save. He is asking for PEN 2,500 to purchase eight bags of fertilizer and two bags of pea seeds.

Translated from Spanish by Rocio Vargas, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of pea seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: America Janeth

texts.es:
America O. de 32 años, vive en una zona periurbana en Paraíso de Guayaquil, su casa es de cemento y cuenta con todos los servicios básicos, su esposo es albañil ellos tienen tres hijos. 

America inicio con la tienda y la venta de arroz  ya hace 5 años atrás. Debido a la falta de oportunidades tuvo que invertir todos sus ahorros en arroz y empezar a vender a sus conocidos, poco a poco implemento mas alimentos a la venta. 

Ahora ella tiene una pequeña tienda en la que vende todo tipo de víveres y carnes. Trabaja desde las 07:00 am hasta las 23:00 pm todos los días. Ella atiende sola la tienda y tiene miedo de la delincuencia. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar carnes, arroz y legumbres para su tienda. Una de las metas que quiere cumplir en el futuro es tener una de las mejores tiendas en todo Paraíso de Guayaquil.
texts.en:
America O., 32, lives in a periurban zone of Paraíso de Guayaquil. Her house is cement and has all basic utilities. Her husband is a bricklayer and they have three children. America started her store selling rice 5 years ago. Because of the lack of opportunities, she had to invest all her savings in rice and start to sell to her acquaintances; gradually, she added more food items to her inventory. Now, she has a small store where she sells all sorts of food items and meats. She is open for business from 7am until 11pm every day. She tends to her store by herself and is afraid because of delinquency. She will use the funds to buy meats, rice and vegetables for her store. One of her goals for the future is to have one of the best stores in all of Paraíso de Guayaquil.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Meats, rice, vegetables.

loans.name: Verónica Danixia

texts.es:
Este cliente es originario de la comunidad el ojochal y ella se dedica a dar clase de secundaria en el instituto de telica.
Y ella con el fin de mejorar su cas internamente para que haya mejor comodidad para la familia es que está acondicionando mejor el hogar y con el espíritu de venir cambiando la forma de vida.
texts.en:
This client is a native from the community of Ojochal. She works as a teacher in a secondary school in the Telica Institute. Verónica has the objective of making internal home improvements, to give better comfort to her family by fitting it out better and in this spirit change their way of living.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Home improvements

loans.name: Rosa Maria

texts.es: La Señora Rosa María tiene 31 años. Ella tiene varios años de trabajar con Fundación. Por lo que su actividad económica es la venta de ropa ambulante. Pues siempre le ha gustado este medio de vida. Hace más de 11 años que se dedica a este negocio. Dio inicio a este negocio no tenía mucho tiempo para dedicarle a esta actividad, sus hijos mayores que le ayudan en su negocio. El financiamiento será para invertir en la compra de materia prima. Sueña con mejorar cada día su actividad.
texts.en:
Rosa María, 31, has collaborated with the Fundación for several years. She is a clothing merchant. She has always enjoyed this way of life. She has been in this line of work for over 11 years. When she started out in this business, she didn't have much time to dedicate to it; now, her oldest children help her with it. She will use the funds to buy stock items. She dreams with improving her business every day.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy clothing.

loans.name: Guillermo

texts.es: Guillermo tiene 62 años, es un hombre correcto, espontáneo y muy emprendedor. Casado con Ana, de 52 años, y juntos tienen 3 hijos, de los cuales solo vive con uno de ellos y juntos viven en su casa propia. Desde hace 45 años que se dedica a la agricultura, pues le gusta sembrar todo tipo de verduras, pues cuenta con terrenos en donde cultiva y cosecha hortalizas, comercializándolos cada dos meses en los mercados de sus ciudad, obteniendo mayores ingresos económicos, permitiéndole adquirir bienes, y sobre todo poder cubrir los gastos educativos de sus hijos, quienes ya son profesionales y eso le llena de mucho orgullo. Paralelamente a esta actividad, también se dedica a la compra y venta de vehículos. En adelante piensa mejorar la construcción de su vivienda y reabrir dos tiendas para la venta de comestibles que algún tiempo las tuvo que cerrar por falta de tiempo. Este es su décimo préstamo con MFP, y por tanto espera concretar sus planes y mejorar su vivienda. Siendo una persona responsable y puntual dentro de su grupo comunal, le agrada motivar a cada uno de ellos para emprender actividades que los beneficie. Entretanto solicita, mil quinientos nuevos soles para comprar bolsas de semilla de maíz y alverja, así como latas de semillas de lechuga y espinaca, además de productos químicos para proteger sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Guillermo, 62, is a dignified, spontaneous and very enterprising man. He is married to Ana, 52, and they have three children, only one of whom still lives with them him in their own home. He has been a farmer for the last 45 years because he likes to plant all kinds of vegetables; he has fields where he grows and harvests vegetables. He sells them every two months in the city’s markets where he gets higher profits that make it possible for him to acquire assets and, above all, pay for his children’s educational expenses; they are all professionals now and this fills him with much pride. Alongside the farming, he also buys and sells automobiles. In the future, he plans to make some home improvements and reopen two grocery stores that he had to close a while back due to lack of time. This is his 10th loan with MFP and he hopes to finalize his plans and improve his home. He is a responsible and punctual person within his group and he enjoys motivating each one of them to undertake activities that will benefit them. In the meantime, he is asking for 1500 new soles to buy sacks of corn and pea seed, cans of lettuce and spinach seed as well as chemical products to protect his crops.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy corn, pea, lettuce and spinach seed as well as chemical products to protect his crops.

loans.name: Norman  Hilario

texts.es:
Este cliente es un profesor que se dedica a dar clase en el sector del apante, y él es de la comunidad del Jicarito.
Y este señor con el propósito de obtener otra fuente de ingreso el compro un camión donde el objetivo principal transportar  personal de trabajo y de esta forma mejorar las condiciones de vida del nucleo familiar.
texts.en:
Norman is a teacher who gives classes in the neighborhood of Apante, which is in the community of Jicarito. With the goal of having an additional source of income, he bought a truck to transport people to work and to thereby improve the living standards of his family.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy spare parts to do an overhaul

loans.name: Martha Del Socorro

texts.es: Martha del Socorro tiene  50 años de edad, es casada y tiene un hijo de 30 años. La señora se dedica al negocio de compra-venta de cosméticos, además de esto también tiene una crianza de pollitos de engorde, además que también vende comida para aves de corral. Ella inicio con este negocio desde hace 10 años y tiene ya 2 años de tener la crianza de pollos y la venta de comida de aves. Ella actualmente está solicitando un crédito en Fundación León 2000 para ser invertido en la compra de productos Avon, ya que actualmente posee bastantes pedidos, además de esto desea invertirle un poco al local donde tiene las aves de corral. Con los dos negocios ahora obtiene mayores ganancias, sobre todo obtiene más ganancias en la crianza y engorde de pollo. Su sueño siempre ha sido llegar a tener una tienda grande ubicada en el nuevo mercado.
texts.en:
Martha del Socorro, 50 is married and has a 30-year-old son. She is a cosmetics merchant but also raises chickens and sells feed for barnyard fowl. She started the cosmetic sales business 10 years ago and has been raising chickens and selling bird feed for two years. She is requesting funding from Fundación León 2000 to buy Avon products, since she currently has several pending orders, and also to invest a bit in improving the corrals in which she keeps her chicks. Her two businesses produce good profits, she makes the most profits in the chicken raising business. Her dream has always been to have a large store located in the new market.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy Avon cosmetics.

loans.name: Claudio Jose

texts.es:
Perfil del Cliente 	
Este cliente es originario de la Calle Real de Tolapa y el se ha dedicado al comercio de artesanía y en época de verano el vende producto de perecederos.
El comenzó a vender cerámica y su esposa procesaba dicho producto y él lo vendía fuera de la comunidad salía a vender para el norte pero el año pasado comenzó a traer cebolla, tomate y ponía a vender en su casa la esposa. 
Algo relevante en el es que con sus negocio que el a tenido compro un solarcito para contruir donde vivir hoy ya tiene su propia casa  no muy comoda pero ya es propio con miras a mejorarla en un futuro.
texts.en:
Client Profile This client is from Calle Real de Tolapa. He works in the selling of handicrafts and in the summer he sells perishable goods. He started selling ceramics and his wife processed said product and he would sell it outside the community. He would go north to sell, but last year he started to bring onions and tomatoes and his wife began to sell it from the house. Something relevant is that with the businesses that he has had, he bought a little piece of land to build on and he has his own house now. It's not very comfortable, but it's their own and he is looking to improve it in the future.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase perishable products (mango, guayaba, melon)

loans.name: Juana Jacqueline

texts.es:
Juana González de 32 años, vive en una zona periurbana en Paraíso de Guayaquil, su casa es de cemento y cuenta con todos los servicios básicos, su esposo es reciclador de plásticos y de metal. Ellos tienen  dos hijos de 4 y 8 años.

Juana tiene siete años vendiendo productos Yambal y Avon, invirtió unos pequeños ahorros que tenia en mercadería para uso personal. Esta actividad de comerciante ambulante la realiza todos los días desde las 09:00 am hasta las 16:00 pm. Ahora ha implementado vender ropa marca Leonisa ya que tiene mucha demanda. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar perfumes, cremas, ropa para tener más variedad y vender aun más mercadería. En el futuro quiere tener un local establecido para la venta de su mercadería.
texts.en:
Juana González, 32, lives in a periurban area of Paraíso de Guayaquil. Her house is cement and has all basic utilities. Her husband is a plastics and metal recycler. They have two children, a 4-year-old and an 8-year-old. Juana has been selling Yambal and Avon products for 7 years. She invested a few savings she had in merchandise for personal use. She peddles her wares daily from 9am until 4pm. She has recently added clothing of the Leonisa brand to her inventory and she already has much demand for it. She will use the requested funds to buy perfumes, creams and clothing to have wider variety and sell still more merchandise. She would like to have an established locale from which to sell her products in the future.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Pefumes, creams, clothing.

loans.name: Feliciano

texts.es: Feliciano tiene 65 años, casado con Eusebia de 57 años, y ambos tienen 7 hijos, de los cuales viven con 5 de ellos en una casa alquilada. Desde hace 40 años que trabaja en las tierras que lo vieron crecer, por lo que aprecia mucho la actividad que realiza, sembrando siempre maíz, papa y todas clase de hortalizas, y que son cultivados en terrenos arrendados, que junto a su hijo menor, lo ayuda en la labor agrícola, mientras su esposa se esmera en preparar los alimentos, para que de esa manera puedan continuar y resistir este trabajo, bajo el calor intenso del sol. Con las ganancias que ha obtenido ha podido solventar los gastos de su hogar así como la  educación de sus hijos, quienes ya son independientes. Para su futuro, piensa comprar terrenos agrícolas, además de una casa para que pueda vivir cómodamente. Este es su tercer crédito con MFP, y en este tiempo ha aprendido a valorar el trabajo en  equipo, dentro de su grupo comunal, por eso le gusta participar de cada reunión que tiene. Con los tres mil nuevos soles que solicita, comprará varias latas de semilla de coliflor, lechuga, espinaca y culantro, así también comprará productos químicos para proteger sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Feliciano, 65, is married to Eusebia, 57. They have 7 children, 5 of whom still live with them in a rented house. He has worked the land of his birth for 40 years; something that makes him appreciate what he does very much. He grows corn, potato and all kinds of vegetables on leased lands. His youngest son helps him with the farm chores while his wife prepares the meals so that they can carry on and withstand this work beneath the intense heat of the sun. The profits that have been obtained have allowed him to meet household expenses as well as pay for the education of his children, who are now independent. He plans to buy farm lands in the future as well as a house in which to live comfortably. This is his 3rd loan with MFP. During this time he has learned to value teamwork within his communal group; he enjoys taking part in all the meetings. He will use the requested 3000 new soles to buy several cans of cauliflower, lettuce, spinach and coriander seed as well as chemical products to protect his crops.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy vegetable seed and chemical products to protect his crops.

loans.name: Mariano Alexander

texts.es: El Sr. Marinao tiene 23 años de edad es conviviente tiene una hija de 2 años  de edad, su conyugue se dedica como ama de casa, ellos viven en la casa de sus padres ubicado en el Distrito de parcona en casa de un piso de material noble. El se dedica a prestar servcio de transporte urbano en su vehiculo propio, el adquirio su vehiculo hace un año, anteriormente se dedicaba  a trabajos en la mina artesanal. Ellos son una pareja joven con muchas metas y sueños uno de ellos es poder tener su casa propia. Con el dinero que solicita inevrtira en la compra de un terreno.
texts.en:
Mariano, 23, lives with his life partner and has a 2-year-old daughter. His wife is a housewife and they all live in their parents' house located in Parcona district; the house is single story and made of substantial materials. He provides public transportation services in his own vehicle, which he got a year ago. He used to work as a miner. They are a young couple with lots of goals and dreams, one of which is to own their own home. He will use the requested funds to buy a lot.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a lot.

loans.name: Manuel Alberto

texts.es:
El señor Manuel Alberto B. S., tiene 54 años de edad vive en Villa Libertad tiene 1 hijo el cual ya no depende de él economicamnete, su esposa es manicurista y comparten los gastos del hogar, trabaja como chofer.

Ellos son una familia que vive en una casa muy himilde, construida hace 40 años en donde se notan los deterioros que el tiempo ha dejado, es por esta razon que solicita un prestamo para la compra de materiales de construccion, y cambiar en primera instancia el techo de su vivienda debido ha que las temporadas de lluvias se aproximan y esta inversion los apoyaria de gran manera  ha habitar en un espacio mas seguro y comodo para toda la familia.
texts.en:
Manuel Alberto B. S., 54, lives in Villa Libertad with his manicurist wife. They have a son, who no longer depends on him economically; his wife and he share household expenses; he works as a driver. They are a family living in a very humble home, built 40 years ago, which is showing the signs of deterioration that the passage of time has caused. For this reason, he is asking for funding to buy building materials to, primarily, replace the roof because the rainy season is approaching and this investment will make it possible for them to live in safer surroundings that are more comfortable for the whole family.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy building materials and supplies to replace the roof.

loans.name: Benjamin

texts.es: Benjamin tiene 62 años, es un hombre muy entusiasta, casado con Rosalía de 65 años, y juntos tienen 4 hijos, de los cuales solo vive con uno de ellos, en su casa propia, hecho de material rustico. Desde hace 18 años que se dedica a la agricultura, cultivando maíz, papa y todas clase de  verduras que producen es esta zona y con la ayuda eventual de su esposa, quien se encarga la mayor parte del tiempo a su hogar. Él manifiesta no quejarse de lo sacrificado que es su labor, pero si le molesta tener que trasladar sus pesados sacos, llenos de productos hacia el mercado de su ciudad, y aún más cuando se eleva el precio de fertilizantes, elementos que le ayuda para mejorar la producción de sus siembras. Como siempre, Benjamin piensa en el bienestar de su familia, como se muestra en la foto, en donde esta cavando la instalación de desagüe para su casa y de esa manera mejorar su calidad de vida, asimismo con el tiempo, busca convertirse en criador de cuyes y en el cebado de toros, por la demanda que tiene en el mercado. Este es su noveno crédito con MFP, por lo que espera cumplir con sus propósitos, asimismo desea continuar trabajando con su grupo comunal, por estar integrado por personas responsables. Con los dos mil quinientos nuevos soles que solicita, comprará varios sacos de abono orgánico y fertilizantes, además de una bolsa de semilla de alverja.
texts.en:
Benjamín, 62, is an enthusiastic man, married to Rosalía, 65. They have 4 children, of whom only one still lives with them, in their own home, which is made of rudimentary materials. He has been a farmer for the last 18 years growing corn, potatoes and all kinds of vegetables that grow in this area with occasional help from his wife who, for the most part, is in charge of her household. He does not complain about the hard work but he is bothered by having to lug the heavy sacks full of his products to market in the city even more so when prices of fertilizer, which he needs to improve crop yields, rise As always, Benjamín is concerned with his family’s wellbeing as is shown in the photo where he is digging a drainage ditch for his house thereby improving his quality of life. I time, he’d like to become good at raising guinea pigs and cattle because they are in high demand in the market. This is his 9th loan with MFP and he hopes to meet his goals; he also wants to continue to work with his communal group because it’s composed of responsible persons. He will use the 2500 new soles requested to buy several sacks of organic manure and fertilizers as well as a sack of pea seed.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy pea seed and fertilizers.

loans.name: Gilberto José

texts.es:
El señor B. es una persona que trabaja en un pequeño negocio por su cuenta ya que se dedica a realizar viajes a personas ya que cuenta con una camioneta en donde a él lo buscan para realizar viajes dentro de los departamento de Nicaragua además que es el sostén de sus padres.

Este crédito lo solicita para la compra de llantas para su vehículo ya que atreves de esta actividad él apoya a sus padres en los gastos alimenticios y básicos
texts.en:
B. is a person who works for himself in a small business. He transports people. He has a pickup truck and people go to him to make trips in the department of Nicaragua. It is his parents' support. He is asking for this loan to buy tires for his vehicle. With this activity he supports his parents with food and basic expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Personal expenses

loans.name: Unidas Triunfaremos Group

texts.es:
La señora Antonieta, con sus 60 años es D. apariencia rígida y dura, su historia es conmovedora la dureza que refleja su rostro solo esconD. un gran corazón, ella cuenta que antes no trabajaba por  que su esposo no lo permitía. Tiene 2 hijos  mayores D. 35 y 25 años lamentablemente uno D. ellos dejo el país por motivos D. trabajo y  esto la entristeció mucho a punto D. enfermarse y caer en depresión. Fue una amiga que la anima a vender productos D. belleza y así empieza en este negocio, al principio  por entretenerse en algo, pero hace 2 años empezó con mucha dedicación ya que vio que era muy rentable y sobretodo el echo D. estar ocupada la ayudo a superar en parte la ausencia D. su hijo. 
Una vecina le hablo sobre EDAPROSPO y se animo a formar el grupo “UNIDAS TRIUNFAREMOS” todas  amigas del barrio la Sra.Antonieta es la presidenta, es su  carácter la que la ayuda a  llevar su grupo adelante, por otro lado le va muy bien en su negocio y tiene mucha clientela. A pesar del desanimo D. su esposo ella sigue adelante y no se amilana  tiene proyectos que desea cumplir como tener su propia tienda donD. pueda mostrar sus productos D. belleza, con el dinero que D. su actual préstamo comprara  mercadería en productos D. belleza para vender ya  que tiene  pedidos pendientes.
 Antonieta aun tiene sueños por cumplir y sabe que mantenerse ocupada no solo la ayuda a superar la ausencia D. su hijo sino que pueD. ganarse la vida y demostrar que la edad no es un impedimento para seguir trabajando.

*lA Sra. Antonieta es la primera aparece sentada con blusa floreada.
texts.en:
Antonieta, 60, has a hard and rigid appearance. Her story, however, is touching and the harshness of her expression only masks her great heart. She tells us that she didn’t used to work because her husband wouldn’t permit her to. She has two adult children, a 35- and a 25-year-old. Unfortunately, one of them left the country to look for work and this saddened her very much to the point of becoming ill and depressed. A friend of hers motivated her to sell beauty products and this is how she started her business. At the beginning, it was just to have something to do that would keep her mind occupied. However, two years ago she started to really become dedicated to it when she saw how profitable it could be but, above all, being busy helped her to partly overcome her son’s absence. A neighbor in town told her about EDAPROSPO and motivated her to join the “UNIDAS TRIUNFAREMOS” (Together We Will Succeed) group. All the members are from the neighborhood and Antonieta is the group president. Her strong character makes it possible for her to lead the group. On the other hand, she does well with her business and she has many customers. Despite her husband’s lack of enthusiasm for her work, she continues ahead and doesn’t become discouraged; she has projects to meet, like having her own store in which to display her beauty products. With the funds from this loan she will buy beauty products merchandise because she has several pending orders to fill. Antonieta still has dreams to fulfill and knows that she must keep busy, not only to overcome her son’s absence, but to earn a livelihood and show that age need not be a barrier to continue working. *Antonieta is seated in front wearing the flowered blouse.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy beauty products.

loans.name: Elmer David

texts.es:
Elmer tiene 44 años de edad, es casado y tiene dos hijos a su cargo. Vive junto a su familia en el distrito de Paiján, en la provincia de Ascope de la región La Libertad, ubicado a dos horas y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Tiene instalado en el centro de su distrito un establecimiento donde vende ropa para bebés y para niños desde hace mas de 18 años. El nos comenta que la idea del negocio fue de su esposa, que decidió inciar este negocio complementando el que ya tenía su madre, que vendía ropa y accesorios en el mismo lugar. Este negocio es una fuente importante de ayuda para los ingresos familiares, por lo que ellos le brindan el mayor esfuerzo y dedicación para sacarlos adelante.

Debido al inicio de clases escolares en todo el país, Elmer desea comprarle a sus hijos los útiles que necesitarán durante todo el año, por ello se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que piensa utilizar en el logro de este objetivo.

Elmer es un padre bastante entregado a su familia y a su trabajo. Su mayor anhelo es ofrecerle a sus hijos la oportunidad de estudiar una carrera superior. El ya ha trabajado anteriormente con Nuestra Institución y ha demostrado ser un cliente puntual y responsable al momento de asumir sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Elmer is 44 years old. He is married and is responsible for his two children. He lives with his family in the district of Paiján, in the province of Ascope, La Libertad region, located two hours from the city of Chiclayo, capital of the Lambayeque region. He has a place in the center of his district where he has sold baby and children's clothes for more than 18 years. He tells us that it was his wife's idea to start the business. She decided to start the business because to supplement the one her mother already had selling clothes and accesories in the same place. This business is an important source of help for the family income, and this is why they put a lot of effort and dedication in getting it ahead. Due to school starting in the whole country, Elmer wants to buy his children the supplies they need for the entire year. This is why it has become necessary to ask for a loan of 1000 nuevos soles from Edpyme Alternativa that he plans on using for this reason. Elmer is a father who is very dedicated to his family and his work. His greatest wish is to give his children the chance to have a university education. He has worked before with our institution and has shown himself to be a punctual and responsible client when it comes to making his payments.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: School expenses for his minor children

loans.name: Silvio Agustín

texts.es:
El señor Silvio es un pequeño agricultor y ganadero de este municipio donde gracias a los prestamos que ha obtenido con ceprodel ha logrado salir adelante en su hogar lo que le ha permitido mejorar la casa además de aumentar su hato ganadero con el fin de producir más leche la cual el ordeña las vacas y vende la leche o produce cuajada.
Este crédito es para financiarle la compra de vaquillas preñadas con el fin de mejorar su ganado y aumentarlo
texts.en:
Silvio is a small-scale crop and livestock farmer in this town, where the loans he's received from Ceprodel have helped him get ahead. He's improved his home and expanded his herd in order to produce more milk. He milks the cows and sells the milk or makes curd. This loan will finance the purchase of inseminated cows in order to improve and expand his herd.

Translated from Spanish by Andrea Rosenberg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase inseminated cows

loans.name: Marta Estebana

texts.es:
Perfil del Cliente 	Este Cliente es de Telica y tiene 20 años de dar clase y durante este tiempo ella ha buscado como superar y crear buenas condiciones para su núcleo familiar. 
A raíz que ella está trabajando y con los préstamo que ha tenido ha logrado construir un cuarto para estar más cómoda y crearle mejores condiciones al hogar.
texts.en:
This client is from Telica and she has been giving classes for the past 20 years. During this time, she has searched for a way to succeed and create good conditions for her nuclear family.

As a result, she is working and with the loans that she has had, she has been able to build a more comfortable room and create better housing conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Housing repairs

loans.name: Jenny

texts.es: Jenny tiene 39 años, es casada y vive con su esposo y sus cinco hijos menores en la casa de su  madre, por ser la única hija. Desde hace 10 años, se dedica a la venta de ropa extranjera, en un puesto ubicado en el mercado de su distrito. Es entonces que atiende a su clientela, desde las 8:00 de la mañana hasta las 5 de la tarde. Previo a iniciar su trabajo, se levanta por la madrugada para preparar el alimento de sus hijos, y de ese modo aprovecha en llevar su propio almuerzo, porque durante el día tiene mucha gente por atender, que no tiene tiempo para salir a comer algún lugar. Lo que más le gusta de su negocio es que las prendas no se malogran y le deja muy buenas rentas, además le ayuda a cubrir lo gastos de su hogar, mientras que su esposo, que es taxista, se encarga de pagar la educación de sus hijos, por lo que anhela Jenny que sus hijos sean profesionales. Se encuentra en su séptimo crédito con MFP, y se compromete una vez más a pagar toda s sus cuotas en las fechas establecidas. Con el crédito que solicita, desea incrementar su mercadería  para que de ese modo siga cumpliendo con la demanda de sus compradores.
texts.en:
Jenny is 39 years old, married, and lives with her husband and their five young children in her mother's house. For 10 years, she has made a living by selling foreign clothing, at a stand located in her district's market. She attends to her clientele from 8:00 in the morning until 5:00 in the afternoon. Before starting work, she gets up early in the morning to prepare food for her children, and also to prepare her own lunch to take with her, because during the day she has many people to attend to and no time to leave to eat. The thing she likes most about her business is that the garments leave her with a good income, which helps her cover domestic expenses. Meanwhile, her husband, who is a taxi driver, takes cares of paying for the education of their children. since Jenny's greatest wish is for her children to become professionals. This is her seventh credit through MFP, and she is committed once again to making her payments on the established dates. With the loan that she is requesting, she wishes to increase her merchandise, so that she can continue meeting the demand of her shoppers.

Translated from Spanish by Mark Broscoe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase more garments for her business

loans.name: Eneyda De Los Ángeles

texts.es:
Doña Eneyda se dedica a la crianza de cerdos la cual ella compra cerdas hembras y cerdos machos para luego estos se cubran y al termino de 6 meses estos dan crías y ella vende estas crías con lo cual se ayuda para los gastos del hogar.
Actualmente ella cuenta con la cantidad de 3 cerdas hembras las cuales tienen un promedio de 10-12 crías cada cerda con este negocio ella ha logrado mejorar la construcción de su vivienda lo que le ha permitido dar mayor seguridad a su familia.
Este crédito es para la compra de 3 cerdas mas y un cerdo macho con lo cual le permitirá generar más ingresos y así darle un mejor futuro a sus hijos
texts.en:
Doña Eneyda raises pigs. She buys male and female pigs and breeds them. After six months they produce piglets which she sells and uses the income to cover household expenses. Currently she has three sows which produce an average of 10-12 piglets per sow. With the profits she has managed to renovate her house and provide a safer home for her family. This loan will be used to buy three more sows and a male pig. This purchase will allow her to earn more money and thus provide a better future for her children.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy pigs

loans.name: Monica

texts.es: Mónica tiene 37 años, separada de su esposo, por lo que vive con sus dos hijos en la casa de su madre.  Tras su ruptura matrimonial, cayó en depresión, pero gracias al apoyo de sus padres, le cedieron un espacio dentro de su casa, por el cual instaló su negocio. Desde entonces se siente una mujer muy útil para sus hijos, y está contenta con su tienda, empezando su actividad desde las 6 de la mañana hasta las 11 de la noche,  resultándole muy rentable los fines de semana, por vender cervezas y gaseosas, ganando por cada caja  S/ 10.0 soles, capital que le ayuda a cubrir la alimentación y educación de sus hijos. Por lo pronto desea abastecerse de cajas de cervezas, y con ello asegurar el bienestar de sus hijos hasta cuando sean mayores de edad. Este es su séptimo préstamo con MFP, y se compromete nuevamente a seguir trabajando como hasta ahora lo ha hecho dentro de su grupo comunal, por ser una persona muy responsable. Con el dinero va comprar gaseosas y más cajas de cervezas, para que pueda generarle más ingresos económicos.
texts.en:
Monica is 37 years old and separated from her husband, for which she lives with her two children in her mother's house. After the break-up of her marriage, she fell into depression, but thanks to the support of her parents, she was able to set up a business in a space that they gave her inside their house. Since then, she has felt like a very useful woman for her children, and she is happy with her store, which is open from 6 in the morning until 11 at night. This turns out to be very profitable for her on weekends, selling beer and soda, for which she earns 10.0 soles per box. This income helps her cover food and education expenses for her children. For now, she would like to stock up her store with cases of beer, thereby assuring the well-being of her children until they are grown up. This is her seventh loan with MFP, and she is committed once again to continue working as she has up to this point within her communal group, since she is a very responsible person. With this money, she is going to purchase soda and more cases of beer, in order to generate more income.

Translated from Spanish by Mark Broscoe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase soda and beer for her store

loans.name: Gabriela

texts.es:
Gabriela P. C. construyo su hogar con ahorros propios de muchos años para ofrecerles a sus hijos un patrimonio digno. La señora quiere poner tela mosquitera en su casa ya que en el verano por el calor abre las puertas de su casa para que entre el aire y como vive cerca de un rio hay muchos insectos como mosquitos que se introducen a su vivienda y les hacen piquetes en las partes mas expuestas del cuerpo lo cual hacen un roncha grande.
Por ello Gabriel quiere preverse para que en este año no suceda lo mismo que en años anteriores, por eso ella recurre a nosotros para que se le apoye con capital para comprar las telas y colocarlas en las puertas y así en este verano poder estar cómoda y tranquila.
texts.en:
Gabriela P. C. built her own house. She did this with many years of her own savings in order to give her children a decent heritage. She wants to put screens on her house. Because it is hot in the summer, she opens the doors of her house to let the air in. She lives close to a river, and there are many insects like mosquitoes that enter the house. They bite on the exposed skin and make large welts. That is why Gabriela wants to prevent the same thing happening this year as in previous years. She comes to us in order for get help to buy the screens. She will put them on the doors, and this summer will be more calm and comfortable.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Install screens on the doors

loans.name: William José

texts.es:
William es un joven que al morir su padre él como hijo mayor se hizo cargo de la finca y de su madre que con el tiempo ha logrado salir adelante gracias al apoyo brindado por organismo como ceprodel además que gracias a su desempeño en la finca esta ha logrado mejorar enormemente ya que busca como sacar provecho de todos los recursos existente en la propiedad, el ya ha tenido dos préstamos con ceprodel el cual le ha brindado que el ya tenga su propia casa dentro de la misma finca  ya que anteriormente vivía en la casa de su madre.
El crédito el cual se le financio es para la compra de terneros de desarrollo el cual los engorda y al término de 12 meses este lo vende a un mayor peso del que lo compro lo que le permite tener una ganancia.
texts.en:
When his father died, William, as the oldest child, took charge of the farm. He also became responsible for his mother. In time he was able to get ahead thanks to the support from Ceprodel. Thanks to his work on the farm, he made enormous improvements because he looks for how to take advantage of all of the existing resources on the property. He has had two loans with Ceprodal. They helped him get his own house on the farm. He previously lived in his mother’s house. The loan is to buy calves to raise and fatten. After 12 months he sells them at a greater weight than they were when he bought them. This allows him to have earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy calves to fatten

loans.name: Juana

texts.es: Juana C. M. cuenta con un negocio de abarrotes desde hace 4 años denominado Mini Súper “La Escondida”, este se encuentra en su misma casa para estar al pendiente de los quehaceres del hogar. Como su negocio ha ido prosperando poco a poco ella desea invertirle en productos para así tener mejores ganancias.
texts.en:
Juana C. M. has had a business selling groceries for 4 years, called Mini Súper “La Escondida." The business is located in her home, so that she can also be there to carry out the household tasks. As her business has been gradually increasing, she wants to invest in products so that she can increase her earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to stock her store with groceries

loans.name: Abel Leonidas

texts.es: el joven abel tiene 23 años de edad es soltero vive en la casa de su hermana, cuenta con el ingreso de servcio de transporte en su vehiculo propio lo adquirio con sus ahorros producto de su trabajo en mina artesanal, no cuenta con carga familiar, como todo joven tiene muchos sueños y objetivos , uno de ellos es poder tener mas vehiculo y casa propia. Con el dinero que solicita invertira en areglos de su moto.
texts.en:
The young man Abel is 23 years old, single, and lives in his sister's house. He earns income from his transportation service in his own vehicle. He acquired it with his savings from his job in the mine. Like any young man, he has many dreams and goals; one of them being to have more vehicles and his own house. With the money that he is requesting, he will invest in repairing his car.

Translated from Spanish by Mark Broscoe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Car repairs

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es: Rosa tiene 50 años, es casada y tiene cuatro hijos, D. las cuales viven con tres D. ellos, en su casa propia. Anteriormente vendía frutas en el mercado D. su distrito, pero lo tuvo que dejar, debido a que no lograba vender toda su mercadería.
