DesD. entonces trabaja haciendo limpieza en casas ajenas, tres veces por semana y el resto D. días que le queda, trabaja con su esposo, ayudándole en la carpintería, lijando la madera, además D. cocinar para su familia. Está contenta con lo hace y no le es nada tedioso ya que adquirió mucha habilidad  en sus manos, por  lo que lleva 5 años realizando esta actividad. Lo que más anhela es techar su casa, y D. ese modo  pueda  ampliar el taller D. carpintería, para la fabricación D. puertas grandes, que suele hacer. Este es su primer crédito con MFP, y se compromete a pagar todas las cuotas, con tal D. seguir contando con nuevos créditos mas adelante. Con el crédito obtenido, desea comprar herramientas  D. carpintería, además D. algunas bolsas D. cemento para terminar D. techar su casa.
texts.en:
Rosa is 50, married, and has four children. She lives with three of her children in her own house. She previously sold fruit in the market in her district. But, she had to leave that business because she did not sell all of her merchandise. Since then she has been working cleaning other people’s houses three times a week. The rest of the days she works with her husband. She helps him by sanding wood for his carpentry work. She also cooks for the family. She is happy with what she does. It is not tedious for her, and she has gained much ability with her hands. She has been doing this activity for five years. What she yearns for the most is to put a roof on her house. That way she will be able to expand the carpentry shop in order to make large doors. This is her first loan with MFP, and she promises to make all of her payments. She wants to continue to get new loans later on. She will use the loan to buy carpentry tools. She will also buy bags of cement to finish the roof on her house.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy carpentry tools and sacks of cement to finish the roof on her house

loans.name: Efraín Joel

texts.es:
Efrain tiene 27 años de edad, es casado y no tiene hijos. Vive junto a su esposa y a la familia de su hermano en una casa heredada de su padre, en el sector El Paraiso del distrito de Rázuri, situado en la provincia de Ascope de la región La Libertad, a dos horas y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica a bridar servicio de transporte de carga y pasajeros en una mototaxi. Lleva varios años en esta actividad y hace medio año, gracias a  sus ahorros, pudo adquirir un vehículo propio con el cual actualmente viene trabajando y percibiendo más ganancias. El cubre rutas entre la zona de Macabi y Paiján todos los dias, paralelamente se dedica a trabajar eventualmente como peón agrícola y con esta actividad ayuda al sostenimiento de su hogar.

El continuo uso otorgado a su unidad movil ha hecho que esta empiece a sufrir algunas fallas en el motor que requieren de urgente reparación para su correcto funcionamiento, por este motivo, Efraín se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 600 nuevos soles que piensa invertir en el mantenimiento y reparación de su vehículo.

Efraín es un padre de familia trabajador y responsable que dia a dia da lo mejor de si para sacar a su familia adelante, sus vecinos y conocidos le tienen mucha estima y lo consideran una persona de confianza.
texts.en:
Efrain is 27, married, and does not have children. He lives with his wife and his brother’s family in a house inherited from his father. They live in the El Paraiso section of the Rázuri district, which is situated in the Ascope province in the La Libertad region. It is two and a half hours from Chiclayo, the capital of the Lambayeque region. He provides transportation services for cargo and passengers in his “mototaxi” (three wheeled motorized vehicle). He has been doing this for several years. Thanks to his savings, he was able to buy his own vehicle a year and a half ago. He is currently working with the vehicle, and he is getting more earnings. Everyday he covers the routes between the Macabi and Paiján areas. He also sometimes works as a farm worker, which helps support his household. The continual use of his vehicle has caused it to suffer some problems with the motor. It urgently needs to be repaired to function properly. That is why Efraín has seen the need, for the first time, to ask Edpyme Alternativa for a loan for 600 PEN. He will use it for the maintenance and repair of his vehicle. Efraín is a hard-working and responsible family man. He works day to day to improve himself in order to get his family ahead. His neighbors and acquaintances hold him in high esteem and consider him to be a trustworthy person.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Maintenance and repair expenses for his mototaxi

location.town: El Paraiso - Razuri - Ascope - La Libertad

loans.name: Marcelina Guadalupe

texts.es:
Marcelina tiene 62 años de edad, es viuda y tiene cinco hijos de los cuales solo el último vive con ella. Vive en el sector Manco Capac del distrito de Paiján, en la provincia de Ascope de la región La Libertad, ubicada a dos horas y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Desde hace mas de 25 años se dedica a la venta de pescado fresco en el mercado de la ciudad de Casagrande (ubicada a 20 minutos de Paiján). Ella nos comenta que antes vendía en una parada (mercadillo) situada en los exteriores del lugar, hace veinte años tuvo la oportunidad de empezar a vender su producto en un puesto ubicado en el interior del mercado y eso aumentó sus ventas.

Actualmente ella se vale de la ayuda del último de sus hijos para sacar adelante a su negocio. El va todos los dias muy temprano al terminal pesquero de la ciudad de Trujillo y compra el pescado que venderán durante el dia. Marcelina ofrece su mercadería hasta el mediodia y luego se dirige a su vivienda. Esta actividad le ha ayudado a salir adelante y trabajar por el progreso de sus hijos ya que enviudó hace 20 años y tuvo que sacarlos adelante sola.

Debido al incremento del precio del pescado en la zona norte del país ella se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que piensa utilizar en la compra de mas pescado para mantener su negocio.

Marcelina es una mujer bastante responsable y entregada a su trabajo. Ella ya ha trabajado anteriormente con Nuestra Institución y ha demostrado ser una cliente puntual y responsable al momento de asumir sus pagos
texts.en:
Marcelina is a 62 year old widow. She has five children, but only the last one lives with her. She lives in the Manco Capac section of the Paiján district in the Ascope province of the La Libertad region. It is located two and a half hours from the city of Chiclayo, which is the capital of the Lambayeque region. For over 25 years she has been selling fresh fish in the market in the city of Casagrande (located 20 minutes from Paiján). She tells us that she used to sell outside of a street market. Twenty years ago she had to opportunity to start selling her product at a stall located inside of the market. This increased her sales. Her youngest child currently helps her get ahead in her business. Very early everyday he goes to the fishing terminal in the city of Trujillo and buys the fish they will sell during the day. Marcelina sells her merchandise until midday, and then she heads home. This activity has helped her get ahead and to work for her children’s progress. She was widowed 20 years ago, and she had to get them ahead by herself. Due to the increase in the price of fish in the area north of the country, she has seen the need to ask Edpyme Alternativa for a loan for 1,000 PEN. She will use it to buy more fish to maintain her business. Marcelina is a very responsible woman who is devoted to her work. She has worked with our institution previously, and she has demonstrated herself to be punctual and responsible with her payments.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fish to expand her business

loans.name: Gumercinda

texts.es:
Gumercinda tiene 62 años D. edad, es casada y vive con tres D. sus diez hijos en el sector Miraflores del distrito D. Paiján, en la provincia D. Ascope D. la región La Libertad, situada a dos horas y media D. la ciudad D. Chiclayo, capital D. la región Lambayeque.

DesD. hace cuatro años tiene instalada una pequeña bodega en su vivienda en la que ofrece golosinas. Ella nos comenta que anteriormente vendía verduras en el mercado y que luego optó por las golosinas debido a que considera que este negocio es mas rentable. Actualmente no sólo ofrece sus productos en su casa sino que también va tres veces al dia va a un colegio D. la zona para vender sus productos. 

El negocio tiene mucha acogida, sobretodo cuando va a vender su producto en el colegio durante las horas D. receso y salida, Gumercinda desea ampliar su negocio con la compra D. mas golosinas, por ello se ha visto en la necesidad D. solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito D. 1000 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.

Gumercinda es una mujer bastante responsable y que dia a dia trata D. salir adelante para hacer progresar a los suyos. Ella ya ha trabajado anteriormente con Nuestra Institución y ha demostrado responsabilidad y puntualidad al momento D. asumir sus pagos.
texts.en:
Gumercinda is 62 years old, married, and lives with three of her ten children in the Miraflores sector of the Paiján district, in the province of Ascope in the Libertad region. This is two-and-a –half hours from the city of Chiclayo, capital of the Lambayeque region. For four years, Gumercinda has had a small store in her house selling candies. Before that, she sold vegetables in the market, but switched to candies because she considered it more profitable. Now, she not only sells from her house, but goes three times a day to a local school to sell her products. The business has had much success, especially sales at the school during recess or at the end of the day. Gumercinda would like to enlarge her business by buying more candy. To this end, she has applied to Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of 1000 soles. Gumercinda is a very responsible woman who tries to advance day-by-day. She has worked with Edpyme Alternativa before and has demonstrated responsibility and punctuality with her payments.

Translated from Spanish by jeffrey hersk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy candy

loans.name: Sandra Beatriz

texts.es: La Sra. Sandra es madre soltera tiene 2 hijos menores de edad, cuenta con casa propia de material noble de un piso  y el segundo piso semi contruido, ella se dedica al cuidado de niños en su casa, ademas cuenta con el ingreso de una pequeña tienda  y la venta de hamburguesas. Ella cuenta con metas es de poder terminar de cosntruir su casa, para poder tener mas niños a su cuidado. Con el dinero que solicita terminara de techar dos cuartos.
texts.en:
Sandra is a single mother with two young children. She has her own house, built of quality materials. The first floor is finished and the second floor only partially completed. Sandra works caring for children in her house. She also has a small store and sells hamburgers. Her goal is to be able to finish construction of her house. This would enable her to care for more children. With this loan, she will finish putting a roof over two rooms.

Translated from Spanish by jeffrey hersk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Finish the roof over two rooms

loans.name: Guillermo Isaias

texts.es: El Sr. Guillermo tiene 42 años de edad el es conviviente tiene una hija de 16 años de edad, su conyugue se dedica como ama de casa, el cuenta con casa propia el cual esta en construccion, actualmente esta viviendo en la casa de sus suegros en Av. Aviacion distrito de la Tin guiña. El cuenta con el ingreso del alquiler de su vehiculo, lo adquirio, con ahorros producto de trabajao en la mina artesanal, actualmente tambien continua laborando en la mina, con el dinero que solicita invertira en compra de algunos articulos para la mina.
texts.en:
Guillermo is forty-two and has a common-law wife and sixteen-year-old daughter. His wife is a homemaker. He has his own house, which is under construction, so he currently lives with his in-laws in the Aviación Avenue District of La Tinguina. He brings in income by hiring out a vehicle that he bought with his savings from working at the artisanal [small-scale] mine. He still works there, and he plans to use his loan to buy some mining items.

Translated from Spanish by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To invest in mining items

loans.name: Juana

texts.es: La Sra.Juana tiene  43   años de edad es madre soltera, tiene 2 hijos en edad escolar. Cuenta con casa  propia de material noble ubicado en alta tension del Distrito de la Tinguiña. Ella se dedica  a la venta de comida y tiene un pequeño negocio de venta de cerveza y gaseosas en su casa. Ella se dedica a este negocio hace 10 años. Cuenta con muchas metas y objetivos uno de ellos es poder tener un negocio de la venta de cerveza (bar) y Billar. Con el dinero que solicita terminara sus acabados de su local.
texts.en:
Sra. Juana, age 43, is a single mother with 2 children of school age. She has her own house constructed of strong materials located on Avenida Alta Tension in the district of La Tinguiña.

She is engaged in the sale of food and has a small business selling beer and soft drinks in her house. She has been in this business for 10 years.

Sra. Juana has many goals and objectives. One of these is to be able to have a business with a bar selling beer and a pool table. With the money that she is applying for, she will finish the interior of her business.

Translated from Spanish by Richard Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Finishing the interior of her business.

loans.name: Teresa Gaby

texts.es: TERESA ES CLIENTE YA RECURRENTE CON UN EXCELENTE HISTORIAL CREDITICIO, CUENTA CON UN STATION WAGON TOYOTA EL CUAL LO TRABAJA DIARIAMIENTE, CUENTA CON SERVICIO ESCOLAR Y A SU VEZ BRINDA SERVICIO DE TAXI Y COLECTVIO EN LA RUTA SAN JOAQUIN – CERCADO DE ICA, TIENEN UNA HIJA A SU CARGO YA QUE LOS DEMAS SON MAYORES E INDEPENDIENTES, SOLICITAN FINANCIAMIENTO PARA INVERTIR EN SU CASA YA QUE ES HUMILDE Y DESEAN COMPRAR TRES MODULOS PRE FABRICADOS YA QUE SE ACERCA EL INVIERNO, TAMBIEN NECESITA HACER MANTENIMIENTO A SU HERRAMIENTA DE TRABAJO.
texts.en:
Theresa is a repeat customer with an excellent credit history. She has a Toyota station wagon that she puts to work on a daily basis. She's got a school transportation business as well a taxi and van service on the San Joaquin Route near Ica. They have one daughter at home, as the rest are grown up and on their own. They're requesting a loan to invest in their house; it's modest and they want to buy three pre-fab modules for it since Winter is coming. They also need to do some maintenance on their vehicle.

Translated from Spanish by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Vehicle maintenance

loans.name: Las Risueñas Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama Las Risueñas, porque todas son muy alegres y siempre están sonriendo. Está ubicado en la ciudad de Pachuca, perteneciente al municipio de Pachuca en el Estado de Hidalgo, en México. El grupo está conformado por 9 integrantes y es la 5ª vez que solicita un crédito a CrediComún. 

La Sra. Gloria A. D. V. es presidenta D. grupo, tiene 45 años y dos hijos de 18 y 14 años. Se dedica a la venta de antojitos mexicanos (sopes, quesadillas, tamales, atole y café) en la central de abastos de Pachuca desde hace cuatro años. Sus clientes son las personas que van a hacer sus compras a la central y la buscan por su buena sazón. Ella quiere su préstamo para invertir en insumos para el negocio. Su deseo más grande en la vida es poder darles a sus hijos estudios para que sobresalgan en la vida y tengan lo que ella no ha tenido.

La Sra. Irene V. C., integrante D. grupo, tiene 61 años y ya no tiene dependientes, vende mole rojo, mole verde y chiles rellenos, ella los prepara en grandes cazuelas y con ingredientes originales dando como resultado los mejores moles de la central. Por eso sus clientes la prefieren, y ella los vende en los pasillos y también los reparte en tortillerías y tiendas de verduras. Ella trabaja mucho para vivir tranquila con su esposo, le gustaría irse de vacaciones y cambiar de peinado pues piensa que la haría sentir más joven y bonita.

Los otros integrantes D. grupo son:
A. D. V. GLORIA	VENTA DE ANTOJITOS
C. F. ANA MARIA	VENTA DE ANTOJITOS Y VERDURAS
C. A. GUADALUPE	VENTA DE ZAPATO Y ROPA
E. A. FILIBERTA	VENTA DE VERDURAS
I. I. SANDRA YANET	PAPELERIA Y CAFÉ INTERNET
L. C. TERESITA DE JESUS	ABARROTES
M. A. REYNA	FRUTAS Y LEGUMBRES
M. S. MA  GUADALUPE	JUGOS Y LICUADOS
V. C. IRENE	VENTA DE COMIDA
texts.en:
This group is called Las Risueñas (The Cheerful) because they are all very happy and always smiling. The group is located in the city of Pachuca, which belongs to the Pachuca municipality in the state of Hidalgo, Mexico. The group is comprised of nine members, and this is the fifth time they have asked CrediComún for a loan. Gloria A. D. V. is the president of the group. She is 45, and has two children. The children are 18 and 14 years old. She sells Mexican snacks like “sopes” (fried tortilla topped with refried beans, onion and hot sauce), quesadillas, tamales, “atole” (a hot corn drink) and coffee. She has been selling in the supply center of Pachuca for four years. Her customers are the people who go to the center shopping. They look for her good cooking. She wants the loan to buy supplies for her business. Her greatest desire in life is to be able to give her children an education so that they can succeed in life and have what she has not had. Irene V. C., a member of the group, is 61 and has no dependents. She sells red and green “mole” (chili sauce) and stuffed chilies. She makes them in large pots with original ingredients. She makes the best moles in the center. That is why her customers prefer her. She sells in the walkways. She also distributes to tortilla stands and vegetable stores. She works a lot in order to live peacefully with her husband. She would like to go on vacation and change her hairstyle. She thinks it would make her feel younger and pretty. The other members of the group are: A. D. V. Gloria: Sells snacks C. F. Ana Maria: Sells snacks and vegetables C. A. Guadalupe: Sells shoes and clothes E. A. Filiberta: Sells vegetables I. I. Sandra Yanet: Stationery store and Internet café L. C. Teresita de Jesus: Groceries M. A. Reyna: Fruits and Vegetables M. S. Ma Guadalup: Juices and Shakes V. C. Irene: Sells food

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business supplies

loans.name: Florida's Group

texts.en:
Florida S. is from the village of San Lorenzo, Ilagan, Isabela. She is 35 years old. Florida is the group leader of a 9-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is 'Florida S.'.

Florida is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Florida owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector, raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from raising pigs for fattening and for sale. Florida has been engaged in her business for over 12 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Florida joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Florida has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from ASKI. Florida is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in future. This will be the fourth loan taken out by Florida from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in future

loans.name: Elsa's Group

texts.en:
Elsa I. is from the village of Palattao. She is 53 years old. Elsa is the group leader of a 7-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is 'Elsa I.'.

Elsa is married and has 2 adult children. To make a living, Elsa owns & operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling vegetables, fish and meat in the local community. Elsa has been engaged in her business for over 20 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Elsa joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Elsa has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Elsa is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the second loan taken out by Elsa from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Lilia's Group

texts.en:
Lilia B. is from the village of San Vicente. She is 56 years old. Lilia is the group leader of a 9-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is 'Lilia B.'.

Lilia is married and has 3 adult children. To make a living, Lilia owns & operates a general store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Lilia has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Lilia joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lilia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 9,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Lilia is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the fifth loan taken out by Lilia from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

loans.name: Venus

texts.en:
Venus D. is from the village of Brgy. Magsaysay, Bayombong, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 38 years old. Venus is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Venus owns & operates a general store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Venus has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 9000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Venus joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Venus has successfully repaid a previous loan of 25,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Venus is requesting a new loan of 35,000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand product offering. This will be the third loan taken out by Venus from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

loans.name: Lailanie's Group

texts.en:
Lailanie G. is from the village of Sta. Isabel. She is 41 years old. Lailanie is the group leader of a 6-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is 'Lailanie G.'.

Lailanie is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Lailanie owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector, raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from raising pigs for fattening and for sale. Lailanie has been engaged in her business for over 1 year and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Lailanie joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lailanie is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in future. This will be the first loan taken out by Lailanie from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

loans.use: to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in future

loans.name: Beenu

texts.en:
Miss Beenu A., age 35 and unmarried, is a tailor who works in the town of Patan. She opened her shop two years ago and specializes in making custom-fitted dresses and other clothing items for women as well as school uniforms for both boys and girls. Before starting her business, Miss A. took a six-month training course.

Miss A. has applied for a 30,000-Npr loan to buy the raw materials she needs to make more clothing for her customers. She wants to use her increased income to upgrade her family's standard of living.

loans.use: To buy materials for her tailoring work

loans.name: Sarita

texts.en:
Mrs. Sarita M. is a 34-year-old married woman who lives in Tangal, Lalitpur. She lives with her father-in-law, mother-in-law, husband, and their two sons. Her husband, Mr. Manish M., is a plumber. Her older son is in grade 10, while her younger son is in grade 3.

Mrs. M. opened a grocery shop five years ago. She sells different types of groceries in her shop. Due to a lack of capital, she cannot expand her business on her own. As a result, she is seeking a loan in the amount of 30,000 NPR ($425) to invest in her business. Specifically, she would like to purchase goods such as rice, noodles, and biscuits for her shop.

loans.use: To expand her business by purchasing additional inventory (e.g., rice, noodles, and biscuits)

loans.name: Bimala

texts.en:
Mrs. Bimala N. is a grocery storekeeper in the town of Tangal. She opened her grocery store in order to improve the economic condition of her family. In her store, she sells different varieties of grocery goods such as rice, maize, snacks, and cold-drinks. She uses her income to meet the basic needs of her family.

She is now requesting a loan in the amount of Rs 30,000 in order to buy grocery goods for her shop. 

Mrs. Bakarmi lives with her husband and three children. Her husband, Mr. Krishna N., works in Nepal Telecom. She has two sons and a daughter, all of whom presently attend school.

loans.use: To buy grocery goods for her shop

loans.name: Yoshoda

texts.en:
Mrs. Yoshoda N. is a 26-year-old married woman who lives in Tangal, Lalitpur. She lives with her husband and their one daughter. Her husband, Mr. Gagan N., is a marketing officer, and her daughter is in pre-primary school.

Mrs. N. opened a grocery store a year ago to improve her family's standard of living. In her grocery store, she sells various types of groceries, including maize, rice, and snacks. Currently, Mrs. N. is requesting a loan in the amount of 10,000 NPR ($150) to invest in her grocery store. Specifically, she would like to purchase additional groceries for resale purposes.

loans.use: To expand her business by purchasing additional inventory

loans.name: La Promesse Group

texts.fr:
Amani S.  est présidente du groupe de crédit la Promesse, elle lève la main sur la photo , cliente au 5e  cycle de crédit, agée de 42 ans, mariée. Elle est mère de  10 enfants  parmi lesquels   6   vont à l’école et 3 autres n’étudient  pas par manque des frais  scolaires. Son mari a un petit job, il est  chauffeur auprès d’un particulier. 
Elle a commencé son petit commerce de vente de braises avec son fond propre reçu de son mari, soit une somme équivalant  à 10$. Son business est de vendre les braises  dans un petit marché se trouvant dans la zone urbano - rurale de Ndosho à 12 km du centre ville de Goma.  Notons qu’avant de se lancer dans l’activité de vente de braises, elle avait commencé par  le petit commerce de vente de tomates. 
Avec  le crédit de l’IMF Hekima , elle souhaite accroitre son chiffre d’affaire en achetant 6 sacs de braises et 4 paniers de tomates .
Dans l’avenir, elle planifie d’acheter des  planches  pour renforcer son projet de construction de sa maison et scolariser confortablement ses enfants.  
Elle remercie  l’IMF Hekima, pour les crédits qu’elle reçoit sans aucune garantie matérielle, car grace à ces crédits, elle a déjà acheté 85 planches et 25 toles qu’elle utilisera pour la construction de sa maison. 
Le groupe la Promesse  est composé de 6 membres qui sont  toutes femmes. Il sied d’indiquer que derrière la  photo on retrouve les pierres  du volcan Nyiragongo.
texts.en:
Amani S. is the president of the loan group that calls itself "La Promesse"; she's the one raising her hand in the group photo. She is on her fifth loan, aged 42 and married. She is the mother of 10 children, among whom six are enrolled in school and three others are not because she can't pay school fees. Her husband has a little job working as a driver for an individual. Amani started up her little business selling charcoal with her own funds, received from her husband, in the amount of about 10 USD. Her business consists in selling charcoal in a little market located in the urban/rural zone of Ndosho, 12 km from the center of the town of Goma. It must be noted that before opening this business, Amani had already begun selling tomatoes on a small scale. With the loan from the MFI Hekima, Amani hopes to increase her turnover by buying six sacks of charcoal and 4 baskets of tomatoes. In future, she plans to buy planks to further the construction of her house and to be able to pay school fees easily for her children. She thanks Hekima for the loans that she has received without any tangible collateral, since thanks to those loans she has already bought 85 planks and 25 tin roofing panels which she will be using in building her house. The "Promesse" group is composed of six members who are all women. Behind the group you can see stones from the Nyiragongo volcano.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: 6 sacks of charcoal and 4 baskets of tomatoes

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Maribel Zulema

texts.es: LA SRTA. MARIBEL ES UNA CLIENTE RELATIVAMENTE NUEVA HA TRABAJADO ANTES EN GRUPO SOLIDARIO, HA MOSTRANDO RESPONSABILIDAD, Y DINAMISMO EN SU TRABAJO, ELLA TIENE LA DETERMINACION DE LLEGAR A TENER UN TALLER MAS GRANDE Y EMPLEAR A PERSONAS QUE NECESITAN TRABAJAR, ES EMPRENDERORA, SU TALLER Y DOMICILIO ES DE CARACTER FAMILIAR JUNTO A SUS PADRES. LA SRTA. SE LA ENCUENTRA EN LA CALLE RAFAEL PABON EN LA  ZONA DE LA BALLIVIAN, LA VENTA DE SUS MANTAS LA REALIZA A VENDEDORES DE LA CEJA Y LA CALLE MAX PAREDES DE LA CIUDAD DE LA PAZ,  QUEDANDOSE HASTA PARTE DE LA TARDE PARA PODER DISTRIBUIR SUS MANTAS. LA SRTA. PRODUCE LAS MANTAS POR MENOR, JUNTO A SUS FAMILIARES, SU MAYOR ANHELO DE MARIBEL ES AMPLIAR SU NEGOCIO MEJORARNDO SU CALIDAD DE VIDA. LA SRTA. MARIBEL DESEA ESTUDIAR ALGUNA CARRERA EN LA UNIVERSIDAD EN SUS TIEMPOS LIBRES, CON EL DINERO DEL CREDITO COMPRARA TELA PARA LA PRODUCCION DE SUS MANTAS, ESTA MUY AGRADECIDO CON EMPRNDER Y KIVA POR LA CONFIANZA BRINDADA EN LA OTORGACION DE SU CREDITO.
texts.en:
Srta. Maribel is a relatively new client who had previously worked with a solidarity group. She has demonstrated responsibility and enthusiasm in her work. Maribel has the determination to make her workshop bigger and hire people who need work. Being an entrepreneur who is near her parents, her workshop and her home are all part of her family business. Srta. Maribel lives on Rafael Pabon Street in the area of La Ballivian. She sells the blankets she produces to the vendors at La Ceja and Max Paredes Streets in the city of La Paz. Maribel designates part of the afternoon to distributing her blankets. Together with her relatives, she produces blankets in small quantities.

Her greatest wish is to expand her business so that she can improve her quality of life. Maribel hopes to study for a university degree in her free time. With the loan proceeds, she will buy fabric for making blankets. She is very grateful to Emprender and Kiva for their confidence in her by providing this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fabric for making blankets

loans.name: Hilda

texts.es: LA SRTA. HILDA ES UNA CLIENTE ANTIGUA HA TRABAJADO MUCHO TIEMPO CON CREDITOS INDIVIDUALES, ES MUY CUMPLIDA HA MOSTRANDO RESPONSABILIDAD A LA HORA DEL PAGO DE SUS CUOTAS, ELLA ES SOLTERA, ESTUDIA EN UN INSTITUTO A NIVEL TECNICO, VIVE EN LA CASA DE SUS PADRES JUNTO A ELLOS, SU ACTIVIDAD DE LA SEÑORITA ES EL TEJIDO DE MANTAS DE LANA SU TALLLER DE LA SRTA. HILDA SE ENCUENTRA EN LA CALLE CHAHUIRA EN LA POPULOSA ZONA HUAYNA POTOSI, LA VENTA DE SUS MANTAS LA REALIZA LOS DIAS JUEVES Y DOMINGO, DIAS DE LA GRAN FERIA 16 DE JULIO, QUEDANDOSE HASTA EL MEDIO DIA PARA PODER  DISTRIBUIR SUS PRODUCTOS. LA SRTA. PRODUCE LAS MANTAS DE LANA POR MENOR, JUNTO A SUS FAMILIARES, SU MAYOR ANHELO DE HILDA ES AMPLIAR SU NEGOCIO MEJORANDO SUS CALIDAD Y CONDICIONES DE VIDA. CON EL DINERO DEL CREDITO COMPRARA LANA AL POR MAYOR Y DESEA AMPLIAR SU TALLER, ESTA MUY AGRADECIDA CON EMPRENDER Y KIVA POR LA CONFIANZA BRINDADA EN LA OTORGACION DEL CREDITO.
texts.en:
Miss. Hilda is a recurring client; she has worked for a long time with individual financing. She is very responsible and has shown accountability in fulfilling her payments. She is single and studies in an institute at the technical level. She lives with her parents in their home. She knits wool blankets in her shop located in Chahuira Street in the densely populated Huayna Potosi zone. She sells blankets on Thursdays and Sundays, and on the day of the July 16th fair, staying until noon to be able to distribute all of her products. She makes blankets in small amounts with some of her family members. Hilda’s wish is to enlarge her business and to improve the conditions and quality of her life. With the money from the loan she will purchase wool in bulk and enlarge the shop. She is very grateful to Emprender and Kiva for the confidence in providing her with this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Esteban Riojas, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of wool and enlarging a knitting shop

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es: EL SEÑOR FRANCISCO ESTA CASADO Y TIENE UN HIJITO PEQUEÑO, SE DEDICA A LA FABRICACION DE BUJES DE GOMA PARA MUELLES Y AMORTIGUADORES DE LOS AUTOMOVILES, EL SEÑOR FRANCISCO YA LLEVA EN LA PROFESION MAS DE 6 AÑOS. VIVE EN CASA DE SUS SUEGROS, Y POR LO GENERAL RECIBE CONTRATOS DE EMPRESAS MECÁNICAS POR SER EXELENTE EN SU TRABAJO, EL SEÑOR ACCEDIO AL CREDITO CON TASA PREFERENCIAL POR SER UN CLIENTE BUENO Y RESPONSABLE CON EL PAGO DE SUS CUOTAS. EL DESTINO DEL CREDITO ES PARA COMPRAR MAS LLANTAS Y PODER PRODUCIR MAS BUJES. ANTES EMPEZO COMO AYUDANTE DE BUJES, Y POCO A POCO SE HIZO DE CAPITAL PROPIO Y ABRIO SU TALLER DE BUJES. EL DESEO DEL SR. FRANCICO ES TENER SU CASA PROPIA, ESTA MUY AGRADECIDO CON EMPRENDER Y KIVA POR LA CONFIANZA BRINDADA EN LA OTORGACION DEL CREDITO.
texts.en:
Mr. Francisco is married with a small son. He is dedicated to the manufacturing of rubber bushings for docks and shock absorbers for cars. He has been in this profession for over 6 years. He lives in his parents in law’s house, and in general he wins contracts from mechanical companies because he excels in his work. He has agreed to the loan with a preferential rate since he is a good client and responsible with his payments. The proceeds of the credit are for purchasing more tires to make more bushings. First he started as a bushing assistant, and slowly he got his own capital and opened his own bushing shop. Mr. Francisco’s wish is to have his own home. He is very grateful to Emprender and Kiva for the confidence in providing her with this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Esteban Riojas, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase tires for rubber bushings used in docks

loans.name: Alcira

texts.es: LA SEÑORA ALCIRA ESTA CASADA Y TIENE HIJOS QUE SE ENCUENTRAN EN EDAD ESCOLAR, DEDICA A LA VENTA DE ROPA. LA SEÑORA VIVIA EN UN PRECARIA CASA DE ADOBE ALQUILADO POR LA ZONA DE TICTI NORTE, LA SEÑORA ALCIRA ES UNA MUJER SUFRIDA Y TRABAJADORA, POR ESO ACCEDIO A LA TASA PREFERENCIAL KIVA POR SER UNA PERSONA RESPONSABLE Y PUNTUAL, ANTES VENDIA AMBULANDO DE UN LADO A OTRO EN UN MERCADO DE LA ZONA PERO LOS COMISARIOS DE LA ALCALDIA LE BOTABAN YA QUE NO ES PERMITIDO AMBULAR EN LOS MERCADOS, TIENES QUE TENER TU PUESTO PROPIO PARA VENDER, AHORA MEJORO SU CALIDAD DE VIDA DE ELLA Y DE TODA SU FAMILIA, LA SEÑORA ALCIRA CON EL DESTINO DEL CREDITO COMPRARA MERCADERIA AL POR MAYOR Y PODER VENDER  A SUS CLIENTES YA QUE AHORA TIENE MUCHOS PEDIDOS. EL DESEO DE LA SR. ALCIRA ES DE TENER SU CASITA PROPIA Y VER A SUS HIJOS PROFESIONALES, ESTA MUY AGRADECIDA CON EMPRENDER Y KIVA POR LA CONFIANZA BRINDADA EN LA OTORGACION DEL CREDITO.
texts.en:
Ms. Alcira is married and has young children, and she is dedicated to selling clothes. She lived in a precarious house made of adobe, rented in the Ticti zone in the north. Ms. Alcira is a hard working woman, and this is why she agreed to a preferential Kiva rate because she is a very responsible and punctual woman. She used to be an ambulatory saleswoman in a market in the region but the deputies from the mayor’s office kicked her out since it is not allowed to be an ambulatory salesman in the markets; it is necessary to have a stall. She has now improved the quality of her family's life. She will use the proceeds of this loan to purchase merchandise in bulk, to be able to sell it to her customers since she now has a lot of orders. Ms. Alcira’s wish is to have her own little house and see her sons as professionals. She is very grateful to Emprender and Kiva for the confidence in providing her with this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Esteban Riojas, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of spare parts and bicycle frames

loans.name: Aissatou

texts.fr: Madame Aissatou  G. est une parente bénéficiaire  de 49 ans qui habite a Ouakam. Avant elle voyageait sur la Mauritanie pour acheter des marchandises destinées  a la vente .Mais maintenant elle  a rompu avec cette activité et s’est plutôt orientée  vers la vente de thiakry et de jus. Elle sollicite un crédit de 100 000 frs pour acheter en grande quantité  du sucre, du mil et d’autres éléments  de base  qu’elle  utilise pour les besoins de son commerce. Ses bénéfices  lui permettent d’entretenir ses 3 enfants.
texts.en:
Mrs. Aissatou G. is a 49-year old parent member, who lives in Ouakam. Previously she travelled to Mauritania in order to buy goods intended for sale. However, now she has halted this activity and has turned her hand to the sale of "thiakry" (a West African dessert made from millet) and juice. She is applying for a loan of 100,000 francs, in order to buy a large quantity of sugar, millet and other basic items which she needs to run her business. Her profits allow her to look after her three children.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase of funds

loans.name: Jose Andres

texts.es: Don José es un hombre muy trabajador y de pocos recursos económicos, tiene 38 años de edad, se dedica a la venta de leche agria, y acarreo ya que tiene una camioneta que compro hace mucho de sus trabajos de albañil. Su esposa lo ayuda hacer la leche agria para poder apoyarse mutuamente. Su casa de don José es toda de madera ya muy vieja y lo que desea hacer con este financiamiento es poder comenzar hacerla mitad de piedra y el resto de madera para empezar y poder tener una casa con mejores condiciones Para su familia. Lo cual comprara piedra, arena, cemento para comenzar las mejoras. Las dificultades es que a veces se le daña su vehiculo que es su fuente de trabajo también, y no tiene el dinero en efectivo para repararlo de inmediato. Sus planes es poder aumentar las ventas de leche agria, como captar más clientela para mejores beneficios.
texts.en:
Don José is a very hardworking man with little economic resources. He is 38 years old. He makes and transports buttermilk now that he has a truck, which he bought a while ago when he worked as a bricklayer. His wife helps him make the buttermilk so she can help support them. Don José's house is very old and made of wood. With this loan he wants to begin making the house half stone and half wood so that he and his wife can have a house that offers better living conditions. To begin making the improvements, he was to buy stone, sand, and cement. The problem is sometimes his vehicle--the source of his work--gets damaged, and he does not have the money to repair it immediately. The couple's plans is to increase sales of buttermilk and get more customers, so they can receive more benefits.

Translated from Spanish by Lydia Brantley, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying construction materials for house

loans.name: Titus C.osondo

texts.fr: Monsieur Osondo tient un local a l’entrée  du marche de Ouakam ou il expose ses chaussures. Il évolue  dans le domaine de la cordonnerie  depuis 14 ans et il a beaucoup de passion et d’expérience  pour la confection de chaussures. Ce qui l’intéresse  le plus c’est l’aspect lucratif.  Il sollicite un crédit de 500 000 frs. Une partie du financement sera  destine a  développer  une nouvelle activité  de restaurant par l’achat de matériels  à cuisiner et l’autre partie sera orientée  vers la confection  de chaussures. Le prêt lui permettra ainsi de diversifier son activité de commerce et en plus d’accroitre ses profits
texts.en:
Mr. Osondo has premises at the entrance to the market in Ouakam where he displays his shoes. He has been a developing a cobbler's business for the past 14 years and he has a lot of passion for and experience in making shoes. What interests him most is the profitability of this business. He is applying for a loan of 500,000 francs. Part of this loan will be used to buy equipment to develop a new activity in restauration, and the rest will be used for making shoes. The loan will thus allow him to diversify his business and also to increase his profits.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Strengthening of funds

loans.name: Yovana

texts.es: La Señora Yovana es casada y tiene hijos pequeños, se dedica a la venta de pollo frito con la ayuda de su esposo su venta es por las noches en la casa de sus suegros donde vive, ademas es promotora de perfumes desde hace 2 años,  su esposo trabaja como mecanico desde hace 8 años. Son clientes nuevos en EMPRENDER que tienen como objetivo comprar mesas y sillas para poder aumentar su venta de pollo y de esa manera poder superarse en beneficio de sus hijos. Uno de sus deseos es el de comprarse una casita propia, esta muy agradecida con Emprender y Kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgacion del credito.
texts.en:
Ms. Yovana is married and has several young children. She is dedicated to selling fried chicken with the help of her husband. She sells at night from her father-in-law’s house where she lives, and she has also been a perfume promoter for 2 years now. Her husband has been working as a mechanic for 8 years. They are new clients for Emprender and their goal is to buy tables and chairs to increase their sales and in this way improve their quality of life for the benefit of their children. One of their wishes is to buy their own little home. She is very grateful to Emprender and Kiva for the confidence in providing her with this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Esteban Riojas, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy tables and chairs to sell fried chicken

loans.name: Karla Jesennia

texts.es: La señora Karla tiene la edad  de 35 años, vive en el barrio  Memorial Sandino, su esposo trabaja como cadete de taxi, ella trabaja en servicios domésticos desde hace varios años, un trabajo cansado pero tiene que trabajar para apoyar  a su familia dos hermosas hijas  las cuales cursan sus estudios, como padre de familia es mucha responsabilidad, es por eso ambos trabajamos para lograr el equilibrio de los gastos. A si como lograr hacer las mejoras para su pequeña casa, que es cerrada de madera el piso aun de tierra. Con este financiamiento lograra cambiar el zinc que esta en mal estado, como hacer el arranque de piedra. Y poco a poco ir haciendo bonita y segura su casa. Sus planes es poder cambiar de trabajo para lograr mejores ingresos
texts.en:
Karla is thirty-five and lives in the Memorial Sandino neighborhood. Her husband is a taxi driver, and for a number of years she has been working in domestic service. It's a very tiring job, but she has to work to support her family, including two beautiful daughters who are still in school. Being a parent carries a lot of responsibility, so they both work to be able to keep up with expenses, as well as make improvements to their small house, which is made of wood and even has a dirt floor. The loan will allow them to replace the zinc that's in ill repair and to put in stone. Little by little they're making the house pretty and secure. Their plan is to be able to change jobs to improve their income.

Translated from Spanish by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy zinc to replace the roof on her house.

loans.name: Maguete

texts.fr: Mademoiselle Maguette G. a 33 ans et habite à Ouakam. Elle est membre de la caisse de Ouakam depuis 5 ans. Elle est célibataire  et a en charge deux enfants. Elle évolue  depuis un an dans le domaine de la restauration, activité qu’elle a hérité  de sa mère  qui est d’ailleurs une ancienne membre active de la caisse qui a beaucoup bénéficié  des services de l’institution(voir photo).Elle sollicite un crédit de 50 000 frs pour acheter les denrées  de base qui lui permettent de préparer  en vue de constituer un stock. Ses bénéfices lui permettent de faire face aux besoins de ses enfants et de leur payer les études.
texts.en:
Ms. Maguette G. is 33 years old and lives in Ouakam. She has been a member of the savings institution in Ouakam for the past five years. She is single and has two children in her care. She has for the past year been developing a restauration business, which she inherited from her mother; the latter was, by the way, an active member of the savings institution and benefited significantly from the institution's services (see photo). She is applying for a loan of 50,000 francs to buy basic groceries which will allow her to prepare food with a view to building up a stock. Her profits allow her to meet the needs of her children and to pay for their studies.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase of funds

loans.name: María Félix

texts.es: La Sra. María Félix es originaria del municipio de El Sauce, se desempeña como una pequeña costurera donde tiene 10 años de ejercer este oficio. Tiene cuatro años de laborar con Ceprodel donde le han otorgado seis créditos consecutivos para agricultura, mejora de vivienda y gastos personales. El crédito lo solicitó para gastos universitarios de su hijo el cual estudia en la ciudad de León una carrera de profesión.
texts.en:
María Félix comes from the municipality of El Sauce. She works as a little seamstress, and has practiced this work for 10 years. She has 4 years of working with Ceprodel. They have given her 6 consecutive loans for agriculture, improving her home and personal expenses. This loan requested is for expenses for her son's university where he is studying for a professional career in the city of León.

Translated from Spanish by Kimberly Baker, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: University expenses

loans.name: Maria Lourdes

texts.es: Perfil del Cliente 	Este cliente es originario de la mina el limón trabaja como afanadora de limpieza en el centro de salud de la comunidad de minvah, es madre soltera y ha logrado desarrollar a sus hijos una de ella se graduó de enfermera  y trabaja en el centro de salud de la mina el limón.
texts.en:
Client Profile: This client comes from the El Limón mine. She works as a cleaning woman in the health center in a MINVAH community. She is a single mother and has successfully raised her children - one of them graduated from nursing school and works in the health center of the El Limón mine.

Translated from Spanish by Kimberly Baker, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Blocks, cement, zinc, sand, smooth fastening wire

loans.name: Luis Alberto

texts.es: El Señor Luis esta casado y tiene hijos pequeños, es mecanico, se dedica a este rubro desde hace tres años, tiene muchos clientes ya que el Sr. Luis es muy bueno en su trabajo, él es una persona joven y muy responsable, es la primera vez que solicita un crédito para comprar las cosas que necesita para su taller como herramientas de trabajo, el vive en casa con sus padres y contribuye a la economia del hogar. Su sueño convertir su taller en uno más grande, ampliarlo para poder atender mejor a sus clientes. Esta muy agradecido con Emprender y Kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgacion del credito.
texts.en:
Sr. Luis is married and has young children. He has been working as a mechanic for three years and has many customers. Luis is very good at his job and is a very responsible young person.

This is the first time he is requesting a loan. He will buy the things he needs for his shop, such as work tools. Luis lives at home with his parents and contributes to the household finances. He dreams of converting his shop into a much larger garage so that he can better serve his customers. Luis is very grateful to Emprender and Kiva for their confidence in him by providing this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase tools for his work

loans.name: Ibrahima

texts.fr: Monsieur  Ibrahima D. est un jeune garçon  ambitieux de 24 ans qui vit à Ouakam et est membre de la caisse depuis quelques années. Il a déjà bénéficié  d’un prêt antérieur  au sein de l’institution. Il a une activité très diversifiée  de commerce car il vend en même  temps des vaisselles, des matelas, des lits, des armoires et des produits de quincaillerie. Il a une expérience  de 10 ans dans  le commerce. Et c’est par le biais de son père qu’il exerce aujourd’hui cette activité. Il sollicite un crédit de 500 000 frs dans le but d’acheter des lits et armoires destines a la vente. Les prêts  l’aident a acquérir  d’autres biens.
texts.en:
Mr. Ibrahima D. is a 24-year old young man who lives in Ouakam. He has been a member of the credit association for a few years. He has already received previous loans from the institution. He has a very diversified retail activity. He sells dishes, mattresses, beds, cupboards, and hardware items. He has a ten-year experience in the business. He learned the business he is practicing today through his father. He is requesting a loan of 500, 000 Francs [XOF] ] in order to buy beds and cupboards for resale. The loans help him acquire other items.

Translated from French by Véronique Fourment, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Strengtening capital

loans.name: Fatim

texts.fr: Madame Fatim S. habite dans la localité  de  Ouakam. Elle est âgée de 42 ans et est membre de la caisse depuis 5 ans. Elle a déjà bénéficié  de 3 prêts  antérieurs. Elle s’active depuis 10 ans dans le commerce et la vente de vaisselle. Sa maman l’a beaucoup encourage à opter pour cette activité qu’elle aime beaucoup. Et ce qui l’y intéresse  le plus c’est la rapidité de la vente et le caractère non périssable  de ses produits. Elle sollicite un crédit de 500 000 frs pour renforcer ses marchandises. Ses crédits  lui ont permis d’acquérir  des matériels  pour la maison.
texts.en:
Fatim S. lives in the city of Ouakam. She is 42 years of age and has been a member of the microfinance group for five years. She already obtained three previous loans. She has been selling dishes and kitchen stuff for ten years. Her mother encouraged her towards this business that she likes a lot. She is really interested in the fact that the selling of this products is quite quick and that they are non-perishable. She is requesting a loan of 500 000 frs to stock more supplies. Thanks to the previous loans she could buy materials for her house.

Translated from French by MONICA URBAN, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Stocking

loans.name: Rafael

texts.es: El Señor Rafael esta casado y tiene ya hijas que se encuentran en la Universidad, es un cliente antiguo de Emprender que se dedica al área de la construccion, vive en la zona del Barrio San Antonio, el se dedica a trabajar muy duro para mantener a su familia y poderles brindar todo lo que necesitan, él sale muy temprano todos los días para comenzar su jornada de trabajo, es maestro contratista, lo buscan para que construya casas ya que el hace un buen trabajo por eso es que siempre esta con trabajo y es una persona muy responsable y ha sido un buen ejemplo para sus hijas que ahora se encuentran en la universidad. El Sr. Rafael con el dinero del credito requiere invertir en nuevas herramientas de trabajo ya que las herramientas que el tiene ya estan gastadas y no le son de gran utilidad por eso quiere renovarlas, es por eso que ha solicitado este nuevo credito. Esta muy agradecido con Emprender y Kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgacion del credito.
texts.en:
Rafael is married and has daughters who are already in the university. His is an old client of Emprender, who works in the area of construction. He lives in the San Antonio neighborhood, and he works very hard to support his family and provide for all of their needs. He leaves very early each day to begin his day of work. He is a master contractor, and is sought after to build houses because he does a good job; for this reason his always has work. He is a responsible person who has been a good example for his daughters, who are now at the university. Rafael will use the money requested to invest in new tools for his work, since the tools he has now are worn and are not very useful. For this reason he wants to renew his stock of tools and this is the reason he is requesting this new loan. He is very grateful to Emprender and Kiva for the trust provided in granting this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy new tools for work

loans.name: Aissata Abdoul

texts.fr: Madame Aissata  Abdoul Dème  a pendant 15 ans évolue  dans le commerce de thiakry, de tissus voile et de portables. Elle a toujours voulu éviter l’oisiveté. Elle fait régulièrement  des voyages vers la Mauritanie ou elle se procure les tissus et les portables qu’elle vend. Elle sollicite un crédit de 200 000 frs pour voyager, compléter  son fond et renouveler son stock de tissus et de portables.  Pour Madame  Dème ses crédits  consentis antérieurement (2),lui ont permis d’augmenter son fond de commerce et d’avancer  dans son activité. Elle parvient à assurer ses besoins personnels et d’acheter des matériels  de maison.
texts.en:
Madame Aissata Abdoul Dème has been selling thiakry, sail fabric and mobile phones for 15 years. She has always wanted to avoid idleness. She make regular trips to Mauritania where she purchases the fabric and the phones she sells. She requested a loan of 200 000 francs to travel, to increase her operating funds and renew her stock of fabrics and notebooks. Her two previous loans enabled her to improve her business and move forward in her activity. She managed to ensure her personal needs and to purchase materials for her house.

Translated from French by MONICA URBAN, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating funds

loans.name: Mirian Del Socorro

texts.es:
La seoñra Mirian N. es una dama muy trabajadora que se ha preocupado por el bienestar de sus hijos ya que ella es madre soltera y busca la manera de como llevar el sustento a su casa de habitacion.

Se ha dado cuenta que para mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia es necesario el mejoramiento de su vivienda y por esta razón es que ella está solicitando el crédtio para invertirlo en la compra de materiales de construcción y así llevar a cabo esta obra de construcción.
texts.en:
Mirian is originally from the town of Quezalguaque. She works at the Rubén Darío Institute as a caretaker. Mirian is a single mother who is supported financially by her children who also work. They live with her in the same house.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Compra de materiales de construcción

loans.name: Awa

texts.fr: Madame Awa D. est une ouakamoise de 53 ans qui a adhéré  depuis deux ans a la caisse de l’U-IMCEC ou elle a déjà bénéficié  d’un prêt antérieur. Elle est parente bénéficiaire, mariée et mère  de 9 enfants.  Elle a pendant 5 ans  évolué  dans le commerce de couscous et de produits locaux. Elle a choisi cette activité dans le but d’éviter le chômage  mais aussi dans le but de se procurer des revenus. Elle sollicite un crédit de 75 000 frs pour acquérir une table dans le nouveau marche de Ouakam qui est en cours d’installation ce qui lui donnera l’occasion de diversifier son activité en incorporant dans son activité la vente de légumes. Son premier crédit lui a permis d’épargner de l’argent et elle a note une progression dans son activité.
texts.en:
Mrs. Awa D. is a 53-year old woman from Ouakam who has been a member of the U-IMCEC savings institution for the past two years and has already had one loan. She is a parent member, married and mother to nine children. For five years she has been developing a couscous and local products business. She chose this activity with the aim of escaping unemployment but also to procure an income. She is applying for a loan of 75,000 francs to acquire a table in the new market at Ouakam which is being installed; this will give her the opportunity to diversify her business by incorporating the sale of vegetables. Her first loan allowed her to save some money and she is noticing that her business is making progress.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase of funds

loans.name: Andrea

texts.es: La Sra. R. es originaria del municipio de El Sauce, se desempeña como Responsable de cocina del Centro de Enseñanza Técnica Agropecuaria CETA donde tiene 20 años de laborar para dicho centro. Tiene cinco años de laborar con Ceprodel donde se le han otorgado seis créditos para compra de bienes para el hogar. El último crédito lo solicitó para la compra de un Tricitaxi con el fin de obtener mayores ingresos para su hogar.
texts.en:
Sra. R. is a native of the municipality of El Sauce, she is in charge of the kitchen of the Centro de Enseñanza Técnica Agropecuaria (CETA - "Center of Technical Agriculture Education"), where she has been working for 20 years. For five years she has been working with Ceprodel where they have granted her six loans for the purchase of home goods. The last loan she requested for the purchase of a Tricitaxi (a pedal powered three-wheeled taxi) in order to obtain higher income for her home.

Translated from Spanish by Amy McGinty, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a Tricitaxis

loans.name: Carlos Alberto

texts.es:
El señor Carlos Alberto S. M. es originario del municipio de san Juan de Limay departamento de Estelí cuenta con una pequeña finca de 22 mz donde realiza actividades agrícolas y ganaderas se le otorgo un crédito para la compra de tres vacas paridas ya que es su principal negocio para obtener ingresos ,su negocio comenzó comprando una pequeña finca con la ayuda de su papá después a través de un pequeño negocio (pulpería ) compro algunas vacas paridas para dedicarse a la venta de leche  y sus derivados.

Carlos espera aumentar sus ingresos  con la compra de estas vacas ya que obtendrá una mayor producción y mejorará su finca  por lo tanto el espera mejorar el nivel de vida de su familia. Carlós es casado y tiene un hijo en edad escolar, él no vive con sus papas pero siempre les  brinda su ayuda y los apoya como familia,
este es el primer crédito que Carlos tiene con ceprodel
 y espera que le vaya muy bien para mejorar su negocio y sus condiciones económicas.
texts.en:
Sr. Carlos Alberto S. M. is a native of the municipality of San Juan de Limay, in the departament of Estelí. He has a small farm of 22 square meters, where he does his agricultural and livestock farming activities. He was granted a loan for the purchase of three recently born calves since it is his main business to earn income. His business began when he bought a small farm with the help of his father. After, through a small business (local store), he bought some calves to sell milk and its by-products.

Carlos hopes to increase his income with the purchase of these cows, since he will obtain higher production and will improve his farm, and therefore he hopes to improve the quality of life for his family. Carlos is married and has one school-aged son. He doesn't live with his parents, but he always offers them his help and support as family. This is the first loan that Carlos has with Ceprodel and he hopes that it goes very well to improve his business and his economic conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Amy McGinty, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy three calves

loans.name: Maximo Antonio

texts.es:
El señor Maximo B. es originario del poblado de Quezalguaque en Telica y por mucho tiempo se ha dedicado a la actividad ganadera que es con la que obtiene el capital para el sustento de su hogar para beneficio de su familia.

Actualmente ha atravesado la necesidad de mejorar en la actividad y para ello requiere la compra del ganado para proceder a su crianza y luego extraer la leche o comercializar dicho ganado. Es por esta razón que espera que su crédito sea otorgado de manera inmediata y así comprar dicho ganado para beneficio propio y de su familia.
texts.en:
This customer is a native of the village of Quezalguaque, working in the Rubén Darío institute as a caretaker. She is a single mother and is economically supported by her children who also work and live together with her in the same house.

Translated from Spanish by Amy McGinty, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy 2 calves

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick is a 43-year-old married man with four children, all of whom attend school. To earn a living, he offers transportation services as a driver. His business is located in Kitengela, which is located in the outskirts of the city of Nairobi. He explains that he has been in this business for five years, and that he was previously employed as a mechanic before he started this business. To supplement his income, he also runs a retail shop. In general, he is a very hardworking person who is very dedicated to his family.

He hopes to generate more income in the future and to thereby improve his family's standard of living. As a result, he is requesting a loan in the amount of 20,000 KES ($275) to start another business. Specifically, he plans on selling clothes in his community.

loans.use: To embark on a new business venture by selling clothes

loans.name: Lydiah

texts.en:
Lydiah is a 46-year-old married woman with one child who attends school. To earn a living, for the past six years she has been running a kindergarten school. She explains that the children at her school (who are pictured with her) are taught to develop basic skills through creative play and social interaction. She was previously running a grocery store before she ventured into this business.

As a member of Faulu Kenya, she has been very productive from an economic standpoint. At the same time, though, she hopes to expand her school into a primary school in the future. As a result, she is requesting a loan in the amount of 20,000 KES ($275) via Faulu Kenya to buy cement and ballast to develop her school.

loans.use: To expand her school by purchasing building materials such as cement and ballast

loans.name: Mayra

texts.es:
En el municipio de Telica, la señora Mayra R. se dedica a laborar arduamente con el fin de mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda para brindarle a su familia un techo digno donde vivir y que ellos se sientan muy satisfechos del apoyo brindado por ella.

Actualmente ella ha acudido a Ceprodel para soliictar un crédito que será utilizado en la compra de materiales de construcción para mejorar las condiciones de dicha vivienda y así continuar mejorando en su localidad. Ela comprará zinc, cemento, bloques, madera, clavos, entre otros materiales.
texts.en:
Mayra is a client who is originally from the mining town of El Limón. She was an elementary school teacher, but had to retire because of illness. Mayra currently runs a business from her home. She sells clothing and manages a grocery store. Mayra has the support of her husband, who works for the Triton Mining Company.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase zinc, cement, blocks, sand, wood, and nails

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es:
Francisco es un padre de familia de 60 años de edad que vive junto a su esposa en el sector La Pilca del distrito de Olmos, en la provincia de Lambayeque, ubicado a hora y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales menores desde hace más de tres años. El cría ganado ovino y caprino en un ambiente instalado en la parte posterior de su vivienda para venderlos a los negociantes que frecuentan la zona. Este negocio es de suma importancia para la economía de su familia, ya que le provee de ingresos permanentes con los cuales puede mantenerse. Adicionalmente se dedica a la agricultura, pero esta actividad no le provee de ingresos permanentes.

Francisco da lo mejor de si para sacar su negocio adelante, el desea aumentar las ganancias de su negocio brindandole buena alimentación a sus animales para que la calidad de estos sea mejor, por ello se encuentra solicitando a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 500 nuevos soles que piensa invertir en la compra de alimento balanceado.

Francisco es un padre bastante responsable y que siempre ha velado por el bienestar de los suyos. El ya ha trabajado anteriormente con Nuestra Institución y ha demostrado ser un cliente puntual y responsable al momento de asumir sus pagos.
texts.en:
Francisco is a 60 year old father who lives with his wife in the sector of La Pilca in Olmos District, Lambayeque Province, which is located 1½ hours away from the city of Chiclayo.

He has been raising and selling small animals for more than three years. The sheep and goats that he raises are kept in an area behind his house and are sold to dealers who frequent the area. This business is of great importance to his family’s economic situation, since it provides a steady income in order for them to survive. Francisco is also engaged in farming, but this activity does not provide steady income.

Francisco gives his best in order to succeed in his business. He wants to increase his business earnings by providing better nutrition to his animals so that their quality will improve. For this reason, he is requesting a loan of 500 PEN from Edpyme Alternativa so that he can invest in the purchase of nutritional feed.

Francisco is a responsible father who always provides for the welfare of his family. He has worked previously with our Institution and has demonstrated that he is a punctual and responsible client when making his payments.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase feed for his sheep & goats

loans.name: Daniel

texts.es:
El señor Daniel H. D. es originario de la comunidad el palmar municipio de san Juan de Limay departamento de Estelí tiene una finca de 153 mz de terreno siendo esta la mayoría ganadera y cuanta con una pequeña cantidad de ganado de aproximadamente 38 reses además  se dedica a la siembra de sorgo y maíz, se le otorgo  el crédito para la compra de cinco vaquillas en desarrollo ya quiere aumentar la producción de lácteos y darle un mejor uso a su finca.

Daniel siempre se a dedicado a estas actividades desde niño gracias al apoyo de su papa y dice que aprendió bastante por lo tanto tiene experiencia en su negocio y desea invertir en la finca y por ende mejorarla. 
Daniel es casado y no tiene hijos sus padres viven con él y trabajan en conjunto para el mejoramiento de su familia.

Este es el primer crédito que tiene con ceprodel y espera seguir trabajando y dice que espera que le baya muy bien y de esta  manera seguir mejorando sus condiciones de vida y por ende ofrecerle un buen futuro a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Daniel H. D. is from the Palmar community in the San Juan de Limay municipality, in Estelí. He has a farm with acreage that is, primarily, for grazing. He has a small livestock herd of approximately 38 animals. In addition, he dedicates himself to planting sorghum and corn. He was granted credit to buy 5 young cows, as he would like to increase his production of dairy products and thus put his farm to better use. Daniel has dedicated himself to farming since he was a boy, thanks to his father’s help. He tells us that he learned a lot, and therefore has good experience in his area of business and he would like to invest into his farm to improve it. Daniel is married and does not have children. His parents live with him, and work by his side to improve the family’s standard of living. This is his first loan with Ceprodel, and he hopes to keep working and that things go well for him so he can offer a better future to any children he may have.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy young livestock.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John, age 26 and married, has a cafeteria where he serves delicious dishes. He has been in this business since 2006. His wife is employed in a hotel and they work together to improve their home. 

John's business is really growing because of his many customers. He has one employee to assist him in the business. He dreams of owning a hotel in the future. 

He has requested a loan in the amount of kes 20,000 in order to buy a popcorn machine as well as construction materials to build a fruit parlor.

loans.use: To buy a popcorn machine as well as construction materials to build a fruit parlor

loans.name: Amalia Ivoon

texts.es: Este cliente es originario del poblado de mina el limón y actualmente está apoyando a su mama en el desarrollo del negocio de comideria, y estudiando sabatino, ya que la experiencia trasmitida por la antes mencionada tradicionalmente se extiende en manos de la solicitante.
texts.en:
This client is from the mining town of the El Limón, and currently is supporting her mother while trying to grow her food business. She also studies on Saturdays, as the experience transmitted by the aforementioned is traditionally extended into the hands of the requestor.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Red brick, cinder blocks, cement, corrugated zinc, smooth zinc, metal rods, wire, lumber, etc.

loans.name: Antonia Digna

texts.es: La señora Antonia de 43 años de edad, es comerciante de un tramo en el mercado del Mayoreo en la capital de Managua, tiene vaR. años administrando este negocio que es la venta de gorras, fajas, bolsos, sondaleza, carcasa de celulares, batería y una variedad de productos. Su esposo trabaja en servicios de seguridad, tiene una hija el cual cursa la secundaria, y es la que queda en la casa cuidando.  Inicie mis ventas con poco dinero propio, luego con dinero que la institución financio. Las dificultades es que las ventas se bajan, pero no se deja de vender lo cual quiere invertir en más productos para lograr mejores resultado. Comprara gorras al por mayor en variedades para adulto y niños, bolsos, calzonetas, toallas para aprovechar la temporada del verano. Sus planes es lograr hacer mejoras a su casa.
texts.en:
Sra. Antonia is 43 years old and a merchant who has a vending post at the Wholesale Market in the capital of Managua. For several years she has been managing her business of selling caps, belts, handbags, nautical rope, mobile phone cases, batteries, and a variety of other products. Her husband provides security services. They have a daughter who attends high school and is left to look after the house.

Antonia started her sales with a little bit of her own money and later utilized money from a financial institution. Her difficulty has been when sales were low as a result of not being able to invest in more products to achieve better results. She will buy a wider variety of caps for adults and children, handbags, bathing suits, and towels to take advantage of the summer season. Her plans include making improvements to her home.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase caps, handbags, bathing suits, and towels

loans.name: Syprosa

texts.en: Syprosa is a diligent and determined 33-year-old lady. She has owned a car repair shop in the market place since 2005. With her business income, she helps her husband with the household expenses; they support each other as a family to provide better living conditions. Syprosa hopes to expand her business and improve her living standards in the future. She has requested a loan of 20,000 KES from Kiva partner, Faulu Kenya, to buy paints and car sprays for her business.

loans.use: To buy paints and sprays for cars

loans.name: Maria Lourdes

texts.es:
En el municipio de Telica, la señora María Lourdes C. se ha dedicado con mucho orgullo a laborar para llevar el sustento a su mesa y así beneficiar a su familia.

Actualmente está solicitando un crédito para ser invertido en la reconstrucción de su vivienda como lo es la compra de algunos materiales de construcción y también en el pago de la mano de obra para así llevar a cabo sus sueños de llegar a tener un techo digno donde sus hijos puedan vivir.
texts.en:
This client is originally from here in Telica. Maria Lourdes is the director of the Señor de Esquipulas Institute. She is single and also has a small business at home. Maria Lourdes lives with a nephew since she does not have children of her own.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Inversión en la reconstrucción de su vivienda

loans.name: Daniel

texts.es:
El señor Daniel H. D. es originario de la comunidad el palmar municipio de san Juan de Limay departamento de Estelí tiene una finca de 153 mz de terreno siendo esta la mayoría ganadera y cuanta con una pequeña cantidad de ganado de aproximadamente 38 reses además  se dedica a la siembra de sorgo y maíz, se le otorgo  el crédito para la compra de cinco vaquillas en desarrollo ya quiere aumentar la producción de lácteos y darle un mejor uso a su finca.

Daniel siempre se a dedicado a estas actividades desde niño gracias al apoyo de su papa y dice que aprendió bastante por lo tanto tiene experiencia en su negocio y desea invertir en la finca y por ende mejorarla. 
Daniel es casado y no tiene hijos sus padres viven con él y trabajan en conjunto para el mejoramiento de su familia.

Este es el primer crédito que tiene con ceprodel y espera seguir trabajando y dice que espera que le baya muy bien y de esta  manera seguir mejorando sus condiciones de vida y por ende ofrecerle un buen futuro a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Daniel H. D. comes from the El Palmar community in the San Juan de Limay municipality, Estelí department. He has a farm of 153 manzanas (1 Manzana = 1.68 acres). The majority is used for livestock and he has small quantity of livestock - approximately 38 animals. He also grows sorghum and corn. He was granted the loan to buy five heifers to raise as he wants to increase the production of milk and make better use of his farm. Daniel has always done this work since he was a child thanks to his father's support and he says that he has learnt a lot and therefore has experience in his business. He wants to invest in the farm and consequently improve it. Daniel is married with no children. His parents live with him and they work together to improve the family's conditions. This is the first loan he has had with Ceprodel and he hopes to continue working and he says that he hopes that things go really well so that he can keep improving his living conditions and therefore offer a good future to his children.

Translated from Spanish by Catherine Dent, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase heifers to raise

loans.name: Juana Del Carmen

texts.es:
La señora Juana del Carmen O. G., tiene la edad de 36 años vive en el barrio Pablo Calero, es casada y su esposo se dedica a la agricultura, ellos tienen 3 hijos de las edades de 16, 15, y 12 años de edad, todos ellos apoyan a sus padres en los trabajos de la finca.
