Se dedican a la agricultura desde los 21 años y dentro de los principales problemas a los que han enfrentado esta la escases de agua potable de la zona, ellos se iniciaron en los trabajos de la agricultura gracias a la reforma agraria, y dentro de los planes que tienen para la cosecha esta la diversificación de los cultivos, ellos solicitan un préstamo para la compra de fertilizantes y foliares que le ayuden al productor a brindarle a la cosecha un mejor mantenimiento que garanticen
texts.en:
Sra. Juana del Carmen O. G. is 36 years old, married, and lives in the neighborhood of Pablo Calero. Her husband is a farmer. They have three children (ages 16, 15, and 12) who all help with the work around the farm.

Juana and her husband have been farming for 21 years. The main problems they have faced are related to the scarcity of drinking water in the area. They started farming as a result of land reform and now have plans to diversify their crops. Juana is requesting a loan to buy fertilizers and plant nutrients to help better maintain her crops for the harvest season.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fertilizers & plant nutrients

loans.name: Maria Del Socorro

texts.es: Este cliente es originario de la de la comarca pueblo redondo, es madre  soltera, trabaja en el instituto señor de esquipulas, se desempeña en el cargo como docente, además cuenta con el apoyo económico de su hija.
texts.en:
This client is from Pueblo Redondo. She is a single mother. She is a teacher at the Señor de Esquipulas Institute. Her daughter contributes to her support.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To pay for home improvement labor costs.

loans.name: Simon

texts.es:
Simon tiene 42 años de edad, es casado y tiene 5 hijos aún dependientes. Vive junto a su familia en el distrito de Santa Rosa, un distrito cuya economía depende principalmente de la pesca y que se encuentra ubicado a 25 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a trabajar en la pesca desde hace mas de 21 años. Empezó a trabajar como tripulante en las embarcaciones de la zona y poco a poco fue saliendo adelante, actualmente es propietario de una chalana (Embarcación menor, de fondo plano, proa aguda y popa cuadrada, que sirve para transportes en aguas de poco fondo) con la cual se hace a la mar para pescar. Esta actividad es la unica que le provee de ingresos por lo que trata de esforzarse al máximo para tener éxito en su negocio.

Los productos que Simón logra extraer los ofrece en venta a los comerciantes que compran los pescados en la playa. Gracias a esta actividad ha podido construir su vivienda y la está construyendo poco a poco. El se encuentra solicitando a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1200 nuevos soles que piensa utilizar en la compra de nuevas redes para realizar su labor de modo mas eficiente.

Simon es un padre bastante entregado a su familia y que gusta mucho de su trabajo. El ya ha trabajado anteriormente con Nuestra Institución y ha demostrado ser un cliente puntual y responsable al momento de asumir sus pagos.
texts.en:
Simon is 42 years old, married, and has five dependent children. He lives with his family in the District of Santa Rosa, which is located 25 minutes away from the city of Chiclayo. The local economy is dependent on fishing.

Simon has been working in the fishing industry for more than 21 years. He began working as a crew member for the local fishing boats and slowly was able to get ahead. Simon now owns a “chalana” (a small flat-bottomed boat that can maneuver through shallow water) with which he uses to head out to sea in order to fish. This activity is his only source of income, so he puts in his best effort so that he can be successful in his business.

Simon sells the products he catches to the vendors who buy fish at the beach. Thanks to his work, he was able to gradually build his home. He is requesting a loan of 1200 PEN because he plans to buy new fishing nets so that he can carry out his work more efficiently. Simon is a father who is devoted to his family and greatly enjoys his work. He previously worked with our Institution and has demonstrated that he is a punctual and responsible client when making his payments.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase new fishing nets

loans.name: Brenda Mercedes

texts.es: Este cliente es originario de la de la comarca sanjon santo Cristo, es soltera, trabaja en el instituto señor de esquipulas, se desempeña en el cargo como docente.
texts.en:
This client is from Sanjon Santo Cristo. She is single and is a teacher at the Señor de Esquipulas Institute.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To pay for home improvement labor costs.

loans.name: Pedro Alonso

texts.es:
El señor Pedro Alonso R. C. es originario de la comunidad él coyol municipio de condega departamento de Estelí cuenta con una extensión de diez manzanas de terreno entre ellas tres de café  además se dedica al cultivo de granos básicos como el frijol y maíz se le otorgo el crédito para la compra de abono y alambre el cual le dará mantenimiento a su finca.
Su negocio de café comenzó  con la ayuda de organismos y el apoyo de su papá ya que él se dedicaba también a este tipo de rubro hoy en día don Pedro  lleva un buen manejo de su cultivo y cultiva granos básicos que es una de las principales actividades de la región antes de dedicarse a esta actividad el trabajaba ayudándole a su papá en el negocio del ganado.

El espera que con el crédito que se le otorgo le ayude a mejorar su finca ya que necesitaba invertir para la cosecha del próximo año para obtener un buen rendimiento.


Pedro Alonso es casado y tiene seis hijos pero solo dos están bajo su cargo en edad escolar el cual uno esta en secundaria y el otro en primaria.
Este es el tercer crédito que don Pedro tiene con ceprodel y trabaja desde el dos mil uno con la institución y expresa que sus créditos con ceprodel la han ayudado de mucho ya que a mejorado su finca y el nivel familiar
texts.en:
Pedro Alonso R. C. is from El Coyol, Condega, Estelí department. He has a 10-manzana (1 manzana = 1.73 acres) spread on three of which he grows coffee; he also farms basic grains like beans and corn. He was granted a loan to buy manure and wire fencing for farm maintenance. He started his coffee growing business with help from his father and organizations; his father was in the same line of work. Today, Pedro manages his crops well and farms basic grains, which is one of the main activities in this region. Prior to this, he used to help his father raise cattle. He hopes that this loan will allow him to make some improvements to his farm because he needs to invest in next year’s harvest in order to get good yields. Pedro Alonso is married and has six children only two of whom, one in secondary school and one in elementary school, are still school-aged and under his care. This is Pedro’s third loan with Ceprodel; he has been collaborating with the institution since 2001. He states that Ceprodel loans have helped him a great deal in that he has improved both his farm and his family’s standard of living.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For coffee crop maintenance.

loans.name: Ruth Samary

texts.es: Ruth Samary de 28 años de edad, es soltera  labora como docente de la Escuela Alfonso Cortes de Nueva Guinea desde hace 8 años, tiene una bebe de 4 años y seis meses,esta solicitando su 4to crèdito  para comprar mareiales de construcciòn y lograr repellar y hecarle el piso a una habitaciòn, para asi tener mejor comodidad en el hogar, su compañero de vida labora como agricultor en la finca de sus padres y le ayuda con los gastos familiares, con el credito anterior logro construir una habitacion, este es el segundo credito que tramita para mejoras de vivienda y expresa que se siente muy agradecida por el apoyo brindado por el fondo kiva, su sueño para el futuro es seguri mejorando poco a poco las condicones de vida de su familia y seguri estudiando para ser una mejor profesional.
texts.en:
Ruth Samary is 28 years old, single, and has a 4½ year old child. She has been working as a teacher at the Alfonso Cortes School in Nueva Guinea for eight years. Ruth is requesting her fourth loan so that she can buy construction materials to install a floor and whitewash a room so that her home will be more comfortable. Her partner works on her parents’ farm and helps with the family expenses.

Her previous loan was used to build a room. This is the second time she has used a loan to make improvements to her home. Ruth expresses that she is very grateful for the support provided by the Kiva funds. Her dreams for the future are to continue improving gradually her family’s living conditions and continue her studies so that she can become a better professional.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase materials to install a floor and whitewash a room

loans.name: Angelita Maritza

texts.es:
La señora Angelita Maritza R. B., tiene 46 años de edad vive en el Barrio Laureles Norte, es casada y su marido es albañil y le apoya económicamente, ella es concesionaria de la loteria nacional, son una familia rane de cuatro hijos los cuales son mayores de edad y le apoyan dentro de sus capacidades económicas a sus padres.

Ella solicita un prestamo para la construcción de un cuarto en su vivienda este apoyo les traera mejores condicioesde vida para toda la familia y la tranquilidad personal de vivir el resto de sus dias en un espacio digno de habitad.
texts.en:
Sra. Angelita Maritza R. B. is 46 years old, married, and lives in the neighborhood of Laureles Norte. Her husband works as a mason and provides financial support. Angelita works as a vendor for the national lottery. Her family consists of her four adult children who support their parents in a financial capacity.

She is requesting a loan in order to build a room for her house, which will bring better living conditions to the entire family. Angelita will be able to live peacefully the rest of her days in a space that is worthy of her home.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase construction materials to add a room to her house

loans.name: Martha Rosa

texts.es: La joven Martha vive en el barrio Jericó, es una mujer emprendedora con deseo de superación, desde hace varios años con iniciativa de poder apoyar a su esposo con los gastos, logro tener su propio negocio de venta de ropa, zapatos y cosméticos. El cual inicio con dinero propio de ahorros, luego opto por financiamiento para tener más mercancías. Su esposo trabaja como medico veterinario, tiene dos hermosos hijos, por el cual día a día desea incrementar las ventas para poder dar lo necesarios,  sus planes es poder comprar una dos vitrina para poder exhibir sus productos, aumentar las venta de ropa y zapatos es por eso con este préstamo hará la inversión en ropa y zapatos para cumplir con la demanda de los clientes, ya que tiene poca mercancía y desea aprovechar este verano,  así como la captación de clientes nuevos.
texts.en:
Martha is an enterprising young woman who lives in the neighborhood of Jericó and has the desire to excel. Several years ago, she took the initiative to help her husband with the expenses. Martha established her own business selling clothing, shoes, and cosmetics. Her husband works as a veterinarian. They have two beautiful children. Day after day, she hopes to increase her sales so that she can give her children what they need.

Martha plans to buy two display cases for exhibiting her products. To increase her clothing and shoe sales, she will invest this loan in more merchandise so that she can meet the demand of her customers because she is low on inventory at the moment. She would like to take advantage of the summer season to attract new customers.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase clothing & shoes to increase her summer sales

loans.name: Trancito Del Carmen

texts.es: Este cliente es originario de la cuidad de león, trabaja como docente en el instituto señor de esquipulas telica, es soltera su profesión es licenciada en biologia
texts.en:
This loan client is from the city of León. She works as a docent in the Señor de Esquipulas Telica Institute. She is single, and she is certified in biology.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Merchlewitz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To cover the costs associated with constructing a wall

loans.name: Francisco Rafael

texts.es: Este cliente es originario de telica, trabaja como docente en el instituto señor de esquípulas, en el area de  química y matemática, es casado su esposa es maestra en el area de ingles en el colegio Santiago apóstol de telica.
texts.en:
This client is a native of Telica. He is a chemistry and mathematics teacher in the Señor de Esquípulas institute. He is married; his wife is an English teacher at the Santiago Apóstol school in Telica.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: construction of a wall

loans.name: Carmen Rosa

texts.es:
Carmen Rosa es una madre de familia de 28 años que vive junto a su esposo en la comunidad de Ciudad de Dios perteneciente al distrito de San José de la provincia de Lambayeque, ubicado a 20 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde hace mas de cinco años a la venta de productos de primera necesidad, abarrotes y golosinas en una bodega instalada en un ambiente de su vivienda. Este negocio le brinda los recursos que necesita para salir adelante por lo que ella da lo mejor de si para sacarlo adelante, por eso trata siempre de brindar a sus clientes productos de calidad y trato amable.

El negocio también es de importancia para sus vecinos ya que les provee de productos de uso diario que no tienen a su alcance, ya que la zona se encuentra alejada del mercado del distrito, por ello la demanda por los productos que ofrece es estable. Carmen Rosa se encuentra solicitando por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles que piensa utilizar en la compra de más productos para ampliar su negocio.

Carmen es una joven emprenderora y que siempre trata de dar lo mejor de si en todas las actividades que realiza. Sus vecinos y conocidos la consideran una persona bastante responsable y de confianza.
texts.en:
Carmen Rosa is a 28 year old mother who lives with her husband in the community of Ciudad de Dios in San José District, Lambayeque Province, which is located 20 minutes away from the city of Chiclayo.

For more than five years she has been selling basic necessities, groceries, and candy from a store that she set up in a space in her home. This business provides the necessary resources for her to get ahead because this is the best way she knows how. Carmen tries to provide her customers with quality products and friendly service.

This business is also important to her neighbors because it provides them with daily products that they normally would not have at their disposal. Since her community is in a remote area far from the district market, the demand for her products is stable. Carmen Rosa is requesting her first loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 2000 PEN in order to buy more products to increase her business. She is an enterprising young woman who always attempts to give her best in all of her activities. Her neighbors and acquaintances consider her to be a responsible and trustworthy person.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise to increase her business

location.town: Ciudad de Dios - San José - Lambayeque

loans.name: Francisco Daniel

texts.es: Este cliente es originario de la cuidad de león trabaja en el instituto señor de esquipulas telica, en el area de computación,  soltero
texts.en:
This client is a native of León. He is a computer teacher in the Señor de Esquípulas institute. He is single.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to repair a roof

loans.name: Levy Abdiel

texts.es: Levy de 32 años de edad es casado, trabaja como docente de primaria desde hace 8 años  en la Escuela Paulino Halsall de Nueva Guinea, vive con su esposa y sus 2 hijos: el mayor de 9 y el menor de 1 añito de edad, su esposa tambien labora como docente en la misma escuela, por la mañana y por la tarde. Levy gracias a los creditos que ha recibido de AFODENIC y con muchos sacrificios ha logrado tener su propia casa y desea mejorarla, por lo que está solicitando su 4to credito  para hacer la division a 2 habitaciones  asi contar con mayor comodidad y privacidad, ya que su hijo esta creciendo y desea su propio espacio. Este es  el segundo crèdito que solicita para mejoras de su casa y gracias al fondo kiva con el credito anterior logro satisfactoriamente cambiarle el zinc a la vivienda que se encontraba en mal estado , ellos son una familia que sueñan un porvenir mejor para sus dos hijos, desean que estudien para que sean personas de bien y que sean buenos profesionales.
texts.en:
Levy is 32 years old and married. He has worked as a primary school teacher at the Paulino Halsall School of New Guinea for eight years. He lives with his wife and their two children. The oldest is nine, and the youngest is one. His wife also works as a teacher in the same school in the mornings and in the afternoons. Thanks to the loans received from Afodenic and with much sacrifice, Levy has been able to have his own house. He wants to improve it. That is why he is requesting his fourth loan in order to partition two rooms. That way they will be more comfortable and have more privacy. His son is growing and wants his own space. This is the second loan he has requested to make improvements on the house. Thanks to Kiva funds with the previous loan, he was able to satisfactorily change the zinc on the house, which was in bad shape. They are a family that dreams of a better future for their two children. They want them to go to school in order to become good people and good professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Partition two rooms

loans.name: Fátima Del Socorro

texts.es: Doña Fátima es una mujer trabajadora, de edad de 36 años, vive en el bario Villa Reconciliación, casada, su negocio es la venta de ropa, zapatos y cosméticos que vende de la Avon  por catálogos, todos estos productos los da al crédito y al contado. Inicio hace varios años con dinero de su liquidación de su trabajo. Las dificultades es que a veces le cuesta colocar los producto, es por eso trabaja mas con encargos para trabajar el dinero mas rápido. Con este financiamiento desea invertir en ropa, zapatos, y cosmético ya que no tiene en existencia todo lo tiene colocado y no le es refavorable es por eso desea aumentar su capital como su productos para lograr mejores beneficios, como la captación de nuevos clientes.
texts.en:
Fátima is a working woman, aged 36, who is married and lives in the Villa Reconciliación (Reconciliation) neighborhood. She sells clothing, shoes, and Avon cosmetics from catalogs. All these products she sells on credit or for cash. Her business was launched some years ago with money she received when her job was liquidated. The difficulty is that at times, it cost her to locate more products. For this reason, she does more sales on credit, so she can put more money to work quickly. With this loan she will invest in clothing, shoes and cosmetics because she doesn't have everything in stock that she anticipates selling. And if things aren't going well, she wants to augment her capital and her products to achieve greater benefits, including capturing new customers.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: BUYING CLOTHING, SHOES, AND COSMETICS TO COMPLY WITH CUSTOMER DEMAND

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase soap-making products

loans.name: Concepción

texts.es: Don Consepcion  de 39 años de edad es soltero,  trabaja para la empresa Auxilio Mundial de Nueva Guinea como operario de campo desde hace 7 años, tiene dos hijos de 7 y 10 años de edad,  los cuales viven con la mamá, pero siempre esta al pendiente con los gastos de ellos, està solicitando su 6to crèdito con el cual pretende construir una habitaciòn y asi tener mejor comodidad en el hogar  espera seguir siendo beneficiado por AFODENIC ya que es una instituciòn que le otorga  crèditos a personas de escasos recursos econòmicos y que  hay un nivel de  confianza por parte de la instituciòn.Ssu sueño en el futuro es que sus hijos estudien, salu y estabilidad laboral.
texts.en:
Concepción is 39 years of age, single, and has worked for the Auxilio Mundial de Nueva Guinea (World Help for Nueva Guinea) company for 7 years. He has 2 children, aged 7 and 10, who live with their mother, but it's always difficult to cover their expenses. He is soliciting his 6th loan and plans to construct a house, in order to provide more comfort at home. Concepción hopes to continue benefiting from AFODENIC as a source of loans to people with scarce economic resources, and that a level of confidence will continue on the part of the institution. His dream for the future is that his children can study and enjoy good health and job stability.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: CONSTRUCTING A HABITATION

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase ceramics and paint to improve his home.

loans.name: Alcides Domingo

texts.es:
Alcides tiene 49 años de edad, es conviviente hace 28 años, tiene 3 hijos los cuales 
ya son mayores de edad. El vive en casa propia. Alcides se dedica a brindar el 
servicio de transporte en su unidad vehicular, la cual adquirió con ahorros y el pago 
que recibió en compensación a su tiempo de servicio. El ya tiene experiencia en el 
negocio. Alcides sueña con poder culminar con la construcción de su vivienda, la cual 
fue afectada por el terremoto, solicita el crédito para realizarle mejoras a su 
inmueble y así su familia pueda tener seguridad.
texts.en:
Alcides is 49 years old and has lived with his partner for 28 years. They have 3 grown children and own the house they live in. Alcides provides transportation services using a vehicle he purchased with his savings and income as a taxi driver. He already has business experience. Alcides dreams of finishing construction on his home, which was damaged in the earthquake. He is requesting this loan to make repairs to his property and thus provide his family with better security.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Home repair

loans.name: Helping Hands Group

texts.en:
Wilson K. is the leader of a group of five borrowers called Helping Hands. He is 37 years old, married, and has four children aged 4, 8, 10 and 14. In addition to his wife and children, Wilson cares for one sibling.
For two years, Wilson has been selling charcoal at the Red Light Market in Paynesville, near Monrovia. He says he sells coal that is dried and ready for burning, which keeps customers returning. Wilson plans to use his 6,000 LRD portion of this 30,000 LRD group loan to buy more charcoal. His goal is to expand his business to other areas of Paynesville.
In the photo that accompanies this profile, Wilson is the one holding the sign.

About LEAP
The Local Enterprise Assistance Program (LEAP) is Liberia's largest and oldest continuously operating microfinance institution, with 13 branches across the country. Founded in 1994, the non-profit organization has survived periods of civil war and severe socio-economic hardship. LEAP seeks to help rebuild post-conflict Liberia through its group and individual loans to micro- and small-scale entrepreneurs, and puts emphasis on lending to women.

loans.use: To purchase more charcoal

loans.name: Errol

texts.es: El profesor Errol de 52 años de edad es soltero, no tiene hijos, vive en la zona # 3 de Nueva Guinea,  trabaja como docente de la Universidad Martin Lutero desde hace 7 años, el se dedica a  impartir la asignatura de ingles a estudiantes de la educacion superior en la zona urbana de municipio de Nueva Guinea,   està solicitando refinanciamiento de su 2do crèdito para cercar el solar que con mucho esfuerzo logro comprar con el credito anterior que le otorgo AFODENIC, el piensa comprar poco a poco materiales de construcciòn ya que el no cuenta con vivienda propias, pues son una familia de escasos recursos econòmicos pero con el sueño de que en el futuro podra construir su casita y seguir estudiando para reforzar mas sus conocimientos.
texts.en:
Professor Errol is 52 years old and single. He has no children and lives in zone 3 of Nueva Guinea. For 7 years he has worked at Martin Lutero University, where he teaches English to university students in the urban zone of the municipality of Nueva Guinea. He is applying to refinance his second loan in order to fence his property, which he worked hard to purchase with the previous loan he received from AFODENIC. Errol plans to buy construction materials bit by bit to build his own home. He doesn't own a house because his family has few financial resources but his dream is to be able to construct a home and continue studying for his professional career.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of materials.

loans.name: Bayardo Jose

texts.es: Bayardo Jose de 25 años de edad es casado con la joven Rosa Pierina Marin con quien tiene una niña de 4 añitos estudiando el pre-escolar. Bayardo trabaja en sociedad en una tienda desde hace 6 años, en donde vende ropa de bebé, zapatos, blusas y otros articulos que buscan sus clientes.  Esta solicitando su 2do credito con el objetivo de fortalecer su inventario, comprando articulos que se venden en esta epoca de verano, como es shorts, camisetas, sandalias, etc.  El mayor sueño que tiene es poder seguir con su negocio, pues con las ganancias obtenidas ha podido poco a poco reinvertir en su negocio y brindarle el sustento diario a su familia.  Ademas desea poder terminar la universidad, ya que actualmente esta estudiando Lic. en Administracion de Empresas.
texts.en:
Bayardo Jose is 25 years old. He is married to Rosa Pierina Marin, with whom he has a 4 year old daughter who is in pre-school. Bayardo has worked in his store for the past 6 years, where he sells baby clothing, shoes, shirts, and other goods his clients need. He is asking for his 2nd loan in order to increase his inventory, and purchase the goods he sells during summer time, such as shorts, t-shirts, and sandals. Bayardo's dream is to continue expanding his shop, through which he is able to continue investing in his business and improve his family's quality of life. Furthermore, he would like to finish his university studies, where he is currently studying Business Administration.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Lucas, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase inventory

loans.name: Magda Petrona

texts.es:
Perfil del Cliente 	Este cliente tiene 18 años de laborar como profesora y vive en la comunidad Pueblo Redondo.
Con el salario devengado mas los ingresos de su marido ellos han venido construyendo su hogar y además cubriendo la salud de sus hijos y de ellos mismos pero hoy tiene necesidad para este gasto que es mayor.
Por otro lado ellos crianza ganado y animales domésticos los que venden para pequeñas necesidades.
texts.en:
Magda is 18 years old and a teacher. She lives in the community of Pueblo Redondo. With the salary she earns and her husband's income, they have managed to build a home and also pay the family's health expenses. However, they now need help with this major expense. As well as teaching, Magda and her husband raise cattle and domestic animals which they sell in order to buy small necessities.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to pay for a scan, medicines, and medical expensesPago de tomografia, medicamentos, gastos medicos.

loans.name: Lévitique Plus Group

texts.en:
Nzumba D., aged 52, is the manager of the Banque Communautaire called “Lévitique Plus”. It is composed of 30 members who are united in solidarity to receive Kiva loans with the goal of developing their businesses.
Nzumba is married and the mother of five children aged between 8 and 25, four of whom attend school. She has been part of the micro-enterprise world since 1996. She sells shikwanges (a kind of bread made from manioc flour). Her business is developing progressively. With this loan she will buy one 50kg sack of manioc flour to sell retail with the goal of increasing her profits. Her business generates a profit of $60 USD per month.

loans.use: To purchase one 50kg sack of manioc flour for resale

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Maria Magdalena

texts.es:
Maria 56 años de edad, vive en casa propia, ya no tiene hijos bajo su carga familia. 
Ella inicio el negocio de bodega hace algunos años, con algunos ahorros y luego lo ha 
ido incrementando con las utilidades obtenidas. Ella atiende el negocio de manera muy 
calida y amable ya que la gran mayoría de sus clientes son niños los cuales estudian 
en la escuela la cual queda a una cuadra de su negocio, el sueño a futuro de Maria es 
incrementar su negocio y así poder tener mayores ganancias, y todo esto le permitirá 
mejorar su calidad de vida
texts.en:
Maria is 56 years old and lives alone in her own home as her children have moved out. She started her own shop a few years ago, with some savings and the business continued to grow with the profits the shop generated. Maria conducts her business in a very friendly way, as the majority of her customers are children who study at the nearby school. Maria's future dream is to increase her business and her income, as this will provide her with a better quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Lucas, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase inventory

loans.name: Octavio

texts.es: Octavio de 57 años de edad, trabaja para la Alcaldia Municipal de Juigalpa como Operador de Maquinaria Pesada desde hace 4 años, es originario de Santo Domingo, es casado con la Sra.Aura Lila Aguilar, con quien procreo 3 hijos, los 2 mayores ya estan casados y el menor de 19 años de nombre Helman estudia. Don Octavio de lunes a viernes pasa trabajando en Juigalpa y el fin de semana se va a Santo Domingo junto a su familia;  esta solicitando su 1er credito con el objetivo de mejorar su vivienda, cambiando el techo que se encuentra en mal estado antes que llegue el invierno.  El mayor sueño que tienen es poder tener su vivienda bonita, con las mejores condiciones para que viva su familia.
texts.en:
Octavio is 57 years old, and has spent the past 4 years working for the Juigalpa Muncipality as a Heavy Machinery Operator. He is originally from Santo Domingo, and is married to Aura Lila Aguila. They have 3 children together - two of whom are married adults, and one 19 year old named Helman, who studies. Octavio works from Monday to Friday, and spends his weekend in Santo Domingo together with his family. He is seeking his first loan in order to improve his home before winter and fix his roof, which is currently in poor shape. Octavio's dream is to have a nice home, with better living conditions for his family.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Lucas, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To fix his roof

loans.name: Minzoto Plus Group

texts.en:
Rose M. is the leader of a community bank named “Minzoto Plus”, which is composed of 26 clients.

Rose  is 43 years old and the mother of 4 children between the ages of 6 and 13. All of them attend school. Rose sells corn and manioc flour and has been in business for many years. After learning through her friend about Hope’s loan program, she decided to join one of its groups in 2009. Rose is a trustworthy client of the MFI HOPE RDC, having seven times obtained and correctly repaid loans. With her next loan, she is planning to purchase two 50 kg sacks of corn and manioc flour to increase her business' inventory. Currently, her business brings in about $170 per month. She runs her business in the eastern area of Kinshasa.

loans.use: to buy sacks of corn and manioc flour to resell for profit

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Elvin Jose

texts.es: Elvin Jose de 29 años de edad es soltero, habita en casa de su mamá junto a su hija Dayra Elena  de 13 años que estudia 6to grado de primaria. Elvin trabaja para la Alcaldia Municipal de Juigalpa como Operario de Limpieza desde hace 9 años, esta solicitando su segundo credito con el objetivo de seguir mejorarando su vivienda, ya que con el credito anterior solo logro reparar una pared de su cuarto que está construida de plycem, ahora desea terminar la obra construyendo las 2 paredes que le hacen falta para tener mayor privacidad. El mayor deseo de Elvin es poder brindarle a su hija las condiciones basicas del hogar y que ella estudie hasta que llegue a ser una profesional que le sirva a su pais, ya que es el patrimonio que puede ofrecerle.
texts.en:
Elvin Jose is 29 years old and single. He lives with his mother and daughter Dayra Elena, who is 13 and attending the 6th grade at primary school. For the past 9 years, Elvin has worked for the Juigalpa Municipality as a Cleaning Operator. He is requesting his 2nd loan in order to continue improving his house, as the 1st loan provided just enough funding to repair an interior Plycem wall. Elvin would now like to finish the job and construct 2 more walls to provide more privacy. Elvin's dream is to provide better living conditions for his daughter so she can complete her studies and become a professional who serves her country.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Lucas, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To build a wall

loans.name: Adonai Plus Group

texts.en:
Bernadette, aged 46, is the manager of the Community Bank named “Adonai Plus”. It is composed of 27 members united in solidarity for receiving Kiva loans with the goal of developing their businesses.

Bernadette has been part of the micro-enterprise world since 1992. She runs a restaurant. Her business is in the western part of Kinshasa. The loan she’ll obtain next will be used to increase the restaurant’s stock by buying chickens, two 50kg sacks of corn and manioc flour and vegetable oil with the goal of increasing her profits. Her business generates a profit of $480 per month. Bernadette is married and the mother of three children whose ages vary between 18 and 32 years old. Two of them attend school.

loans.use: To buy chickens, corn and manioc flour

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Walter Juan

texts.es: Walter Juan de 43 años de edad es casado, tiene 2 hijos, Maria Mileydi  de 17 años que ya es casada y la menor Gina de 15 años que no estudia pero ayuda con los quehaceres del hogar. Walter trabaja para la Alcaldia Municipal de Juigalpa como Operario de Limpieza desde hace 16 años, esta solicitando su 4to credito con el objetivo de mejorar su vivienda, que actualmente es la mitad de concreto y la mitad de madera, por lo que desea el credito para quitarle la madera y hacer toda la pared de concreto para mayor seguridad de la vivienda y de su familia, y si el dinero lo permite quiere embaldozar la casa para que con el invierno no se haga mucho lodo.  El mayor sueño de don Walter es que su familia cuente con las condiciones basicas del hogar, gozar de salud y estabilidad laboral.
texts.en:
Walter Juan is 43 years old and married with 2 children. His older daughter Maria Mileydi is 17 and married, while his younger daughter Gina is 15 and helps out at home instead of studying. Walter has worked for the past 16 years as a Cleaning Operator for the Juigalpa Municipality. This is his 4th loan request, with which he plans to improve his home. The house is currently 1/2 concrete and 1/2 wood, and Walter would like to replace the wood with concrete to improve the security of his house against the winter weather. Walter's dream is to provide his family with better living conditions, to have good health, and stable work.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Lucas, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To build a wall

loans.name: Dalila De Jesus

texts.es: Doña Dalila de edad de 53 años, trabaja como docente catedrática desde hace quince años, igual que su esposo, procreo dos hijos de edad de 20 y 24 años, uno trabaja y el otro cursa sus estudios. Pues inicio luego que término sus estudios, las dificultades que se le han presentado es que  le han disminuido las horas de clase a impartir lo cual le sale de menor valor su pago. Junto a su esposo han construido su casa todo de concreto pero aun le falta repellar paredes, pintar y poner cerámica, es por eso opto al financiamiento para lograr avanzar mas rápido ya que ha venido mejorando su casa poco a poco. Sus planes es poder jubilarse y poner un negocio de productos de cosmético de la Avon, en vitrinas. Contenta por que hará posible esta mejora en corto tiempo.
texts.en:
Mrs. Dalila is 53 years old. She has been a professor for the past fifteen years and her husband also. She has two children who are 20 and 24 years old. One works and the other is a student. She began teaching as soon as she finished her studies. The problem that she has now is that they have decreased the number of class hours she gives so she makes less. She and her husband together built the entire cement house but they still need to stucco the walls, paint and put in ceramic tiles. This is why she opted for financing, in order to advance more quickly because she had been improving her home little by little. Her plans are to be able to retire and start an Avon cosmetics business with display cases. She is happy because this will make the improvement possible in a short time.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Haynes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase ceramic tile, cement, sand to make home improvements

loans.name: Mother Blessing Group

texts.en:
Reuben F. is the leader of a group of five borrowers called Mother Blessing.  He is 35 years old, married, and has two children who are nine and 12 years old.  Reuben was only able to attend school through 10th grade due to a lack of support. For five years, Reuben has been selling jeans at the Red Light Market in Paynesville, which is near Monrovia.  He says he sells the jeans in an encouraging manner, which keeps customers returning.  One of the challenges he faces is that there are many competitors in the market. Reuben plans to use his 6,000 Liberian dollar portion of this 30,000 Liberian dollar group loan to buy more jeans.  His goal is to open a beauty salon one day. In the photo that accompanies this profile, Reuben is the one holding the sign. 
 
About LEAP:

The Local Enterprise Assistance Program (LEAP) is Liberia's largest and oldest continuously operating microfinance institution with 13 branches across the country.  Founded in 1994, the non-profit organization has survived periods of civil war and severe socio-economic hardship.  LEAP seeks to help rebuild post-conflict Liberia through its group and individual loans to micro- and small-scale entrepreneurs, and puts emphasis on lending to women.

loans.use: To purchase more jeans.

loans.name: Abel Antonio

texts.es: Abel Antonio de 38 años de edad es soltero, no tiene hijos, trabaja para el MINSA de Juigalpa como Conductor desde hace 12 años, habita en casa de su mamá a quien le ayuda con algunos gastos de la casa, esta solicitando su 9no credito con el objetivo de repellar su cuarto para tener mejores comodidades, ademas si el credito lo permite desea ponerle el piso, el mayor sueño que tienen es poder seguirle ayudando a su mamá en lo que mas pueda, tener salud y estabilidad laboral.
texts.en:
38 year old Abel is single and does not have children. He has worked as a driver for the Ministry of Health in Juigalpa for 12 years. He lives with his mother and helps her with the household expenses. He is requesting his 9th loan with the objective of plastering his room so it is more comfortable. If the loan makes it possible, he also wants to do the floor. His greatest dreams are to be able to keep helping his mother in all that he can, to have good health, and a steady job.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Hynd, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To plaster a room

loans.name: Bonne Semence Plus Group

texts.en:
Bakanikina L., age 37, is the president of the Community Bank “Bonne Semence Plus”, which is composed of 26 members united in solidarity to receive loans from Kiva through IMF HOPE RDC with the goal of developing their businesses. 

Bakanikina started her business in 2001. She sells fish at the market located west of the city of Kinshasa. She is a loyal client of IMF HOPE RDC who has already received six different loans and has repaid them properly. She intends to use the next loan to buy fish to resell with the aim of increasing her profits. Each day, her business brings in a profit of $10. 

Her ambition is to open a cold storage facility. Bakanikina is married and has four children who are between 8 and 9 years old. All of them go to school.

loans.use: To buy more fish to sell

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Carolina Aurora

texts.es: Carolina D. 36 años D. edad es soltera, trabaja como responsable D. bodega en el taller D. mecanica D. su papá, tiene 2 hijos: el mayor D. 19 años D. nombre Ramiro, quien vive con su abuela materna para acompañarla ya que vive sola y Belen D. 4 añitos D. edad estudiando el pre-escolar.  Carolina gracias a un proyecto D. vivienda en el Residencial Bosques D. Juigalpan obtuvo la oportunidad D. tener su propia vivienda con financiamiento a largo plazo, pero esta unicamente es embaldozada y como la niña esta pequeña y le gusta jugar mucho  esta solicitando su 2do credito para mejorarla poniendole ceramica a toda la casa y asi evitarle enfermedades a su hija.  El mayor sueño D. Carolina es tener una vivienda bonita con todas las condiciones que necesita su familia para vivir en un ambiente agradable, ademas desea que sus hijos sean personas D. bien y que en el futuro lleguen a ser profesionales que ayuden a salir adelante al pais.
texts.en:
Carolina is 36 years old and single. She is in charge of running the warehouse for her father's mechanic shop. She has two children. Her oldest son Ramiro is 19 and lives with his grandmother because she lives alone. Her daughter Belen is only four years old and is in pre-school. Thanks to a housing project in the Forests of Juigalpan residential development Carolina was able to purchase her own home with a long-term mortgage. The house has an unimproved floor and because her daughter is little and likes playing on the floor she would like a second loan to improve the house using ceramic tiles and thus avoid potential illnesses for her daughter. Carolina's dream is to have a beautiful home with all the necessities for her family to live in a comfortable environment. She also hopes that her children are upstanding people and that in the future they become professionals and help improve their country.

Translated from Spanish by Patrick King, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase materials to tile floor

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy plantain, grapefruit, oranges, bananas, corn, and other produce.

loans.name: If I Had Known Group

texts.en:
Sonnie K. is the leader of the group of five borrowers called If I Had Known Group.  She is 48 years old, married and has seven children who range from two to 35 years old.  Sonnie was never able to attend school because her parents refused to pay. For 35 years, Sonnie has been selling dried fish and palm oil at the Red Light Market in Paynesville, which is near Monrovia.  She says that she provides her customers with high quality dried fish and palm oil, which keeps them coming to her for business.  One of her challenges is that sometimes sales in the market can be slow. Sonnie plans to use her 6,000 Liberian dollar portion of this 30,000 Liberian dollar group loan to buy more dried fish and palm oil. In the photo that accompanies this profile, Sonnie is the one holding the sign.

About LEAP:


The Local Enterprise Assistance Program (LEAP) is Liberia's largest and oldest continuously operating microfinance institution with 13 branches across the country.  Founded in 1994, the non-profit organization has survived periods of civil war and severe socio-economic hardship.  LEAP seeks to help rebuild post-conflict Liberia through its group and individual loans to micro- and small-scale entrepreneurs, and puts emphasis on lending to women.

loans.use: To purchase dried fish and palm oil.

loans.name: Misioneras Group

texts.es:
El grupo Misioneras lo conforman tres mujeres trabajadoras, humildes y perseverantes; una de ellas es la señora Luz Marina Martínez C. quien desde hace dos años instalo una pequeña venta en su casa y empezó a comercializar CD, DVD y videos. 

Esta señora de 34 años junto a su compañero de vida laboran arduamente en sus negocios para poder impulsar a sus tres hijos de 15, 14 y 12 años respectivamente. Ella invertirá el crédito en surtir ambos negocios con mayor cantidad y variedad de productos.

Sus compañeras de grupo son Fedelina Alejandra C. la cual comercializa repostería, frescos naturales y gaseosas y Lisseth Antonia R. quien desde hace cuatro años empezó a distribuir productos de la Zermat, marca reconocida por sus ventas vía catalogo.  Ambas con el préstamo desean mejorar y ampliar sus negocios.
texts.en:
The Missionaries group is made up of three hard-working women who are humble and perservering. Two years ago Mrs. Luz Marina M. C. started to sell products like CD and DVD players and videos out of her house. She is 34 years old and lives with her partner both of whom work arduously on their businesses to boost the lives of their three children, aged 15, 14, and 12 respectively. Her partners are Fedelina Alejandra C., who sells desserts, fresh juices, and sodas, and Lisseth Antonia R., who four years ago started to sell Zermat products, which is recognized brand that sells through catalogs. With the loan they hope to improve and grow their businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Patrick King, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of basic grains and meats

loans.name: Margarita Group

texts.es:
El grupo Margarita está integrado por Manuela M., Yolanda M. y Perla D. tres féminas emprendedoras. La coordinadora  del grupo es la señora Manuela M., quien recuerda como si fuera ayer como en 1994 sus compañeros de trabajo pensando que ella vendía cosas y le encargaban ropa, zapatos, cosméticos…etc., de  ese hecho le surge la idea de empezar a comercializar ropa y cosméticos por encargo en lo cual le ha ido muy bien. 

Su compañera de grupo Perla D. desde hace ocho años comenzó realizando cobertores de tiras actualmente por medio de los préstamo además de producir mayor cantidad de dicho producto, realiza y vende ropa de cama (sabanas, fundas, cubrecamas) y cojines.  Mientras Yolanda M. se dedica al comercio de frutas y verduras.

 Ellas invertirán el crédito en sus respectivos negocios Manuela con el comprara mayor cantidad de mercadería especialmente veraniega por la temporada, Perla invertirá en materiales como telas, hilos, elásticos…etc. y Yolanda en la compra de cosechas de frutas y verduras de temporada.
texts.en:
The Margarita group is made up of Manuela M., Yolanda M., and Perla D., three entrepreneurial women. The coordinator of the group is Manuela M., who remembers like it was yesterday when in 1994 her co-workers asked her to buy clothing, shoes, and cosmetics for them. From this experience she decided to start a business selling clothing and cosmetics by orders, and she has had a lot of success. Fellow group member Perla D. has worked for eight years making blankets. With the loan money she will make more blankets as well as making and selling linens (sheets and bed covers) and cushions. Meanwhile, Yolonad M. works selling fruits and vegetables. They will use the loan money on their respective business. Manuela will buy more merchandise for the summer season. Perla will buy fabric, thread, elastic, and other products, and Yolanda will buy fruits and vegetables that are in season.

Translated from Spanish by Patrick King, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of clothing, sewing materials, and fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Rene Antonio

texts.es: El Sr. Rene Antonio López G., trabaja para un centro turístico desempeñando el cargo de guarda de seguridad, es padre de cuatro hijos todos en edad escolar,  tiene mas de cinco años de desempeñar dicha función, los créditos que ha solicitado con la institución han sido   para mejora de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Rene Antonio López G. works for a tourism company, fulfilling the duties of security guard. He is the father of four children, all of school age. He has been working as a security guard for more than five years. The loan he is seeking is for improvements in his house. It will be used to buy iron, cement, steel roofing, stone, and to pay for labor.

Translated from Spanish by jeffrey hersk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Building materials and labor

loans.name: Strong Business People Group

texts.en:
Sando G. is the leader of a group of five borrowers called Strong Business People.  Her business is selling soup, rice, and cold water at the Red Light Market, located on the outskirts of Liberia's capital Monrovia.  She says she will use her 6,000 Liberian dollar portion of this 26,000 Liberian dollar loan to buy rice, oil, fish, and charcoal to use at her food stall.

Sando is 32 years old, married, and has one boy and two girls, aged 11, 14, and 18, respectively.  Her children are all in school.  Sando herself was only able to complete school through the 9th grade due to the Liberian civil war, which disrupted her education.

Besides her children, Sando also helps care for her younger brother, who is 23 and lives with at her house with her family.

Sando started her business selling prepared food -- soup and rice -- about seven years ago.  She says she started small, selling cold water out of a container with only three cups to serve her customers.  Her business has grown, but it's hard work.  She wakes most days at 5:30 in the morning, is at the market by 8, and stays until dusk.  She hopes that one day her work will be easier on her.

If she's successful in business, Sando hopes she and her family will be able to build a house on the land they own.


In the photo that accompanies this profile, Sando is the one holding the sign.


About LEAP:
The Local Enterprise Assistance Program (LEAP) is Liberia's largest and oldest continuously operating microfinance institution with 13 branches across the country.  Founded in 1994, the non-profit organization has survived periods of civil war and severe socio-economic hardship.  LEAP seeks to help rebuild post-conflict Liberia through its group and individual loans to micro- and small-scale entrepreneurs, and puts emphasis on lending to women.

Join the Team LEAP - Liberia lending team on Kiva today: http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=10019

loans.use: To buy rice, oil, fish, and charcoal in order to make dishes served at a food stall.

loans.name: Beginning Group

texts.en:
Elizabeth S. is the leader of the group of five borrowers called Beginning Group.  She is 45 years old, widowed, and has six children who range from 5 to 24 years old.  Elizabeth was able to attend school through 11th grade.

For 6 years, Elizabeth has been selling charcoal at the Parker Point Market in Paynesville, which is near Monrovia, the capital of Liberia.  She says that she provides her customers with good quality charcoal, which keeps them coming to her for business.  One of her challenges is that there are many competitors in the market.

Elizabeth plans to use her 6,000 Liberian dollar portion of this 30,000 Liberian dollar group loan to buy more charcoal.

In the photo that accompanies this profile, Elizabeth is the one holding the sign.  Oretha G. is inset at lower left.

About LEAP:

The Local Enterprise Assistance Program (LEAP) is Liberia's largest and oldest continuously operating microfinance institution with 13 branches across the country.  Founded in 1994, the non-profit organization has survived periods of civil war and severe socio-economic hardship.  LEAP seeks to help rebuild post-conflict Liberia through its group and individual loans to micro- and small-scale entrepreneurs, and puts emphasis on lending to women.

loans.use: To purchase more charcoal.

loans.name: Darlan Alfonso

texts.es: El Sr. Darlan Alfonso Carrión Alemán, se desempeña como operador de equipos pesados trasladando materia prima para la elaboración del cemento desde las minas hacia la fábrica. Es padre de 2 hijos uno en edad escolar de estado civil acompañado el crédito lo solicito para terminar de construir su casa, y espera en créditos futuros realizar otras mejoras y de esta forma tener una  vivienda digna.
texts.en:
Darlan Alfonso Carrión Alemán works as a heavy equipment operator, moving raw materials for cement from the mines to the factory. He is the father of two children and lives with a partner. This loan will be used to buy iron and cement to finish construction on his house. He expects to take out future loans to make further improvements, and in this way to complete a quality home.

Translated from Spanish by jeffrey hersk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Building materials to improve house

loans.name: Rayito De Luz Group

texts.es:
El grupo Rayito de Luz  lo conforman tres personas trabajadoras y emprendedoras las cuales se dedican al comercio de ropa. Una de ellas es la señora Mercedes Francisca B. V.. Ella inicio con su negocio de recargas, alquiler de teléfono y venta de ropa por medio de un pequeño  espacio que le brindo su hermano para que comercializara en su pulpería. 

En la actualidad su negocio se ha expandido tiene un local solo para este e invertirá el crédito en mercadería para seguir mejorando cada día.

Su compañera de grupo Karen Patricia M. R. de 21 años empezó a vender ropa desde su adolescencia ya que le ayudaba a su abuela a comercializar este producto. Con el tiempo le agrado trabajar así y empezó a vende ropa interior, pantalones, blusas etc. Mientras Víctor Manuel Aydi O. comercializa pantalones de todo tipo y marca.

Ellos invertirán el préstamo en la compra de mayor cantidad de mercadería y surtir con nuevos estilos sus negocios.
texts.en:
The Ray of Light group is made up of three hard-working entrepreneurs who work selling clothing. One of them is Mrs. Mercedes Francisca B. V.. She started a business selling cell phone minutes and clothing from a small space in her brother's general store, which he lets her use. Her business has grown and she know has her own store. She will use the loan to invest in merchandise and continue improving her business every day. Fellow group member Karen Patricia M. R. is 21 years old and she began to sell clothing when she was a teenager helping her grandmother with her business. Over the course of the years she grew to like the job and started to sell underwear, pants, shirts, and other clothing. Victor Manuel Aydi O. is the last group member, and he sells all kinds and brands of pants. They will use this laon to purchase more merchandise and stock their businesses with new styles and products.

Translated from Spanish by Patrick King, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of clothing

loans.name: Dougla Rene

texts.es: El Sr. Douglas Rene B. Solís, se desempeña como jardinero en un hotel de playa, su estado civil es casado, es padre de tres hijos, dos en edad escolar, los créditos que ha solicitado le han beneficiado en gran medida, ya que esta es la única forma  de hacer mejoras en su vivienda, gracias a estos financiamientos, su casa era cerrada con latones y hoy en día, la casa es de concreto.
texts.en:
Douglas Rene B. Solís works as a gardener at a hotel at the beach. He is married and the father of three children, two of them of school age. Douglas has taken out loans in the past, which have helped him greatly. This is the only way he can make improvements in his house. Thanks to these loans, the house is now enclosed and made of cement. This loan will be used for more construction materials, such as cement, sand, arena, gravel, iron and metal roofing.

Translated from Spanish by jeffrey hersk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Construction materials such as cement, sand, gravel, iron, and roofing

loans.name: Eldard

texts.en:
N. Eldard is a 36-year-old married man with eight children. For the last four years, he has been selling coffee as a means of subsistence. He began the business in Rugaga trading center in Bushenyi district with only 100,000 Ugandan shillings. At length, banking on his hard work ethic, he was able to increase his capital in a short period of time to 2.5 million shillings.

Currently Eldard’s business generates him close to 150,000 shillings a month. This is little money by any Ugandan standards but it’s with this paltry monthly earnings that he has struggled to educate all his children.

Being a resolutely hardworking and experienced businessman Eldard remains upbeat that he is going to succeed. The one vital resource he has invariably relied on to keep his business afloat has been that friendly chord he has struck with his customers. The high quality coffee he sells is in high favor with many people and coffee outlets.

Eldard’s dream and future plan, as he makes steady progress in his business, is to have his own hybrid coffee plantations so that, from them, he can harvest coffee which he can competitively sell at a higher market price. It is for this reason that he requires a loan.

loans.use: To purchase high-quality parchment coffee to sell to his customers and coffee marketing unions

loans.name: Marisela Veronica

texts.es: La Sra. Marisela Verónica J. E., se desempeña como camarera en un hotel de playa, es madre de un hijo en edad escolar, este crédito lo utilizo para hacer reparación en el techo de su vivienda por aproximarse la época de lluvia.
texts.en:
Mrs. Marisela Verónica J. E. works as a waitress in a hotel on the beach. She is the mother of one school-age boy. This loan will be used to repair the roof of her dwelling before the rainy season arrives.

Translated from Spanish by Jeff Schell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Repair the roof of her house

loans.name: Rosana Del Socorro

texts.es: La Sra. Rosana  del Socorro L. Méndez, es madre de dos hijos en edad escolar, realiza las labores de camarera en un hotel de playa, se encarga de la limpieza de las habitaciones y otras actividades que le asignan en su trabajo, este crédito lo solicito para la compra de un equipo de sonido, esto por que en las casas comerciales tienen que pagar el doble del valor del articulo, con lo cual al solicitar este financiamiento se ahorran mucho dinero.
texts.en:
Rosana del Socorro L. Méndez is the mother of two school-aged children. She works as a housekeeper in a beach hotel, in charge of cleaning the rooms as well as other duties assigned to her on the job. She is requesting this loan to buy a stereo system. Customers who finance the purchase with the store have to pay double the value of the item, so this loan will save her a lot of money.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying electronic equipment

loans.name: Sophia

texts.en:
Sophia M. is 43 years old, married, and the mother of two children. She lives in Gacuthi inside Kikuyu, which is on the outskirts of Nairobi. 

Sophia supplies eggs to retail shops within Kikuyu and also to markets outside Nairobi. This has been her business for about 10 years. 

Sophia was introduced to KADET by a friend who was already a member. This is Sophia's fourth loan with Kadet. She has not borrowed from any other institutions. With this loan, Sophia wants to buy more broiler chicks as well as feed for her chickens. 

Sophia dreams of someday having a large poultry farm and also of keeping some dairy cows for milk production.

loans.use: To buy broiler chicks and chicken feed.

loans.name: Emma Hinzano

texts.en:
Emma Hinzano S. is a 36-year old married woman. She and her husband David have two girls and one boy. 

Emma sells fruit to the residents of New Market-Malindi. She makes a profit of 6,000 Kenyan shillings (Ksh) a month. 

Emma first heard about Kadet through an outreach program and she is among the founders of her group. She plans to use 10,000 Ksh of this loan to open a food kiosk, another 10,000 Ksh to add stocks of mangoes, oranges, and bananas to her vegetable stand, and the remaining 10,000 Ksh to buy sacks of fruit she can transport. 

With the extra income from this loan, Emma plans on adding to her previous savings and buying a tuk tuk (taxi). Emma is a hardworking woman who hopes of someday owning a big residential house in Malindi.

loans.use: To open a food kiosk, add stocks of fruit, and buy more sacks of fruit for transport.

loans.name: Grace Lukamika

texts.en:
Grace Lukamika M. is 56 years old, married, with six children. Her husband, Nahashon, is retired from his previous employment. 

In the past Grace was a fruit vendor, but she is now in the business of selling polythene-packaging paper bags. She decided to start her new business because selling fruit alone was not proving profitable and sustainable enough. Grace sells the wrapping bags in retail markets and she also distributes them to other small traders. 

Grace and her group joined Kadet from another microfinance organization. With this loan, Grace wants to establish her new business venture of selling wrapping bags.

loans.use: To buy more stock of polythene-packaging bags.

loans.name: Josphine Jemutai

texts.en:
Josphine Jemutai S. is a 39-year old mother of four, married to a man named Mathew Rugut. 

Josphine has been a farmer in Lemoru, Eldoret for the last four years. She plants mainly maize, both for home consumption and for resale. Most of her clients are her neighbors. Josphine was introduced to KADET by a KADET client. This will be Josphine's first loan from KADET and she plans to use the entire loan for the current season’s maize planting.

Josphine's goal is to expand her farm, educate her children to higher levels, and to buy a tractor that will make her digging work easier every planting season.

loans.use: For maize farming.

loans.name: Martha

texts.en:
Martha W. is a 38-year old businesswoman. She is married to Raphael Ndeche, a land surveyor. Together they have three children aged 15, 11, and 4, who are in their primary school level of education. They live in the Maraba area of Kakamega. 

Martha runs a computer services business offering printing, typing, photocopying, and related reprography. She has been in this business for three years. Martha learned of KADET through a friend who is an existing client. This is her first loan from KADET and she intends to use the money to purchase computer accessories and to repair faulty computer machines. She wants to maintain a good credit record with KADET so that she might be considered for another loan. Her wish is to get a lender through KADET to enable her to take her business to another level.

From the profits made, she aspires to buy a plot of land and construct a building to house her business.

loans.use: To buy computer accessories and repair faulty computers.

loans.name: Philip Kangogo

texts.en:
Philip Kangogo K. is a forty-six-year-old man who is married with five children who are all in school. He lives in Sergoit location in Eldoret. He has been in his maize farming business for eighteen years and, besides farming, he also sells milk, mostly to his neighbors. 

Philip was introduced to KADET by his friends; this will be his second loan from KADET. He plans to use all the loan proceeds on his farm to buy maize seedlings and fertilizer.

 In future, Philip would like to buy land in Eldoret Town and build rental houses so that he can increase his family income.

loans.use: To buy maize seedlings and fertilizer

loans.name: Reuben Alenga

texts.en:
Reuben is a fifty-four-year-old married man with eight children. He farms in Lusweti and has been farming for the last twenty-five years. He not only grows maize but also does dairy farming to enable him to feed and clothe his family.

Reuben was introduced to KADET by an employee of KADET. This will be Reuben’s second loan in KADET and he plans to use the loan for the planting, weed-spraying and fertilizing of maize on his land. 

Reuben's goal is to employ more people to work for him on his farm and thus eradicating poverty in and around his home area.

loans.use: To use for the planting, weed-spraying and fertilizing of his farm

loans.name: Julius Mkutano

texts.en:
Julius is a 50-year-old married man with four children. He lives in M'Chembe a rural part of Malindi and owns a private school where he targets children of the surrounding areas. The school is twelve years old and receives a monthly income of Ksh 12,000 a month.

Julius first learned about KADET when he saw a KADET group being trained. He inquired and joined the group. He is now on his third loan.

Julius will utilize this loan by building a classroom with Ksh 15,000, building a toilet with Ksh 5,000, opening a kiosk with Ksh 35,000 and will use Ksh 5,000 for miscellaneous expenses. With the extra income from this loan he plans to build more classrooms and employ more teachers.

A visionary and hardworking man, he dreams of building the school up to secondary school level.

loans.use: To build a classroom and toilet and to open a kiosk

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en: Rebecca G. is from the village of Minaog. She is 56 years old, is married, and has five adult children. Rebecca owns and operates a business making and selling food, selling barbecue in the local community (the photo shows Rebecca with a customer). Rebecca has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month. In 2007, Rebecca joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 14,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to used to purchase pigs for lechon (Philippine-style roasted pig) to sell in the community. Rebecca is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This loan will be her 6th from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Asuncion

texts.en:
Selling fruit and vegetables is the main activity of Mrs. Asuncion D., 50 years of age, who is married to Mr. Bartolome D., a resident of Baluc, Tangub City. They are blessed with five kids, now mostly adults.

Asuncion started this banana and vegetables business ten years ago to help her husband in supporting their family. Now she earns an average net income of not less than P4,000 a month. Her husband is presently cultivating a little parcel of farmland and also doing some trading in pigs, goats, chickens and other farm animals.

As a good member and an active center chief of Paglaum MPC under its PDP-LP (Paglaum Development Program for Landless People) program, Asuncion is given the privilege of obtaining her 4th loan of P14,900. The proceeds of this loan will be used to add to the capital of her existing business and the income will be used for their daily needs and loan repayment.

Asuncion is very thankful to PMPC for the trust given to her and also she is enjoying the other products and services offered to its members.

loans.use: To use as additional capital for her business

loans.name: Edith

texts.en:
Ms. Edith P., 26 years of age, is single and is a resident of Barangay I, Tangub City. She is very supportive of her family and her nephews and nieces.

To earn her living, Edith decided to engage in business and opened up an eatery, sari-sari (variety) store and mini rice mill for rice grains and cocoa. She’s been in this kind of business for almost ten years. Now she is earning an average gross income of P1,500 a day from her eatery, P150 net from her sari-sari store, and an average net income of P300 a day from her rice and cocoa milling.

Upon hearing the good news of Paglaum MPC being one of the most outstanding cooperatives in Northern Mindanao and the awarded coop for being “Most Outstanding Cooperative in the Philippines” during the search for COOP-LGU Partnership Award 2006, Edith joined the cooperative last year.

With a good credit record, Edith is given the privilege of obtaining P15,000 as her 2nd loan to add to the capital of her eatery and sari-sari store business. The future income from this loan will be used to meet her basic daily needs, loan repayments and support for her family circle.

loans.use: To use as additional capital for her eatery and sari-sari store business

loans.name: Loreta

texts.en:
A brave and gorgeous entrepreneur at the age of 35, living in Migcanaway, Tangub City, is what Loreta A. is. She is married to Jack A., an OFW (Overseas Filipino Worker).

Upon hearing the good news of Paglaum MPC being one of the most outstanding cooperatives in Northern Mindanao and the awarded coop for being “Most Outstanding Cooperative in the Philippines” during the search for COOP-LGU Partnership Award 2006, Loreta joined the cooperative last year.

Since business is her art in life, she opened up a sari-sari (variety) store that helps in meeting their daily needs in life with an average net income since 2008 of not less than P200 a day.

To make her dreams in life fully achieved, Loreta started another business: she opened up an Internet Café with ten computers. By doing that, she got a bulls-eye income of not less than P3,000 a month which she said is so helpful to their family income.

With a good credit record, Loreta was given the privilege of obtaining P50,000 as her 2nd loan. This she will use to add to her business capital and the remaining amount for the placement fee for her husband in applying abroad.

Loreta is hoping that her business will become more progressive and her husband will be successful in his application to work abroad.

loans.use: To purchase computer accessories and to pay her husband's placement fee

She has been engaged in her business for over seven years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month. She is requesting a loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her first from PMPC. Carmelita plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. loans.name: Raquel

texts.en:
A resident in Isidro D. Tan, Tangub City, and the mother of three children, is Mrs. Raquel T.. She is 34 years of age and is married to Ednel T., who is a Radio Television Technician with an average income of not less than P7,000 a month. All of their children are now of school age.

Raquel sent her children to school, before, with only the income from her husband but she found out that it’s not enough to rely on only one income. To help her husband’s income, she decided to engage in an RTW (Ready-To-Wear clothes) business a year ago. Now she is earning an average weekly income of not less than P7,000 gross from this business as a Group Manager of GTY, an RTW dealer.

Upon hearing the good news about Paglaum MPC, Raquel joined the cooperative just this year. As a new member under its regular loan program, she obtained P50,000 as her first loan to add to the capital of her RTW business (in the photo, customers are pictured behind her).

The future income from this loan will be used for their basic needs, for loan repayments and for savings.

loans.use: To use as additional capital for her RTW business

location.town: Isidro D. Tan, Tangub City, Mindanao

loans.name: Faizan's Group

texts.en:
Saima wants a loan to buy clothes for her clothes-selling business. Majidan wants a loan to buy flour for her bread making & selling business. Ramzana wants a loan to buy paint boxes to resell. Saleem wants a loan to buy plastic beans for her plastic shopping bag-making business. 

Faizan is the group leader for the above-mentioned ladies. They all live in a city called Borewala, in Pakistan. Borewala city is famous for its shrines. 

Faizan is a very talented lady. She is skilled at sewing clothes and preparing embroidered dresses. She generates income from her skills. She utilizes her income to pay the utilities. Her income also helps her to pay the education expenses of her kids: two sons and one daughter. 

Her husband's name is M. N. and he runs a cosmetics selling business. He purchases cosmetics from a city named Lahore because of its quality and trustworthy products. He has a good customer base. Presently, he is short of some cosmetics, therefore Faizan is applying for a loan of worth Pak Rs. 20,000 which would be a great help for him. 

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy cosmetics to sell

loans.name: Garneth Ange

texts.en:
Garneth Ange is from the village of Lumbayao, Tampilisan, Zamboanga del Norte. She is 26 years old, is married, and has two children which are now both in kindergarten school.

Garneth Ange owns and operates a business raising pigs for sale. She is just starting this business.

In 2010, Garneth Ange joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 3,000 PHP which will be used to purchase pig feed and other supplies. This loan will be her first from PMPC.

Garneth Ange plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 


About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

loans.name: Salma's Group

texts.en:
Salma is 36-year-old woman. She lives in a city called Borewala, in Pakistan. Borewala city is famous for its shrines. 
Her husband's name is L. A. and he has a paint-selling business. He runs a paint shop in the community and also offers painting services to his customers. Salma is also a very hard-working lady. She runs her own clothes-selling business. Her clientele base is in her community. They give her orders for seasonal clothes. She travels once a month to various cities (Lahore & Multan) to purchase the clothes. Her earning allows her to think about the betterment of her family. She is applying for a loan to buy cans of paint to expand her husband’s paint-selling business. 

Salma has three other ladies in her loan group. Shamim akhtar wants a loan to buy an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle). Bilquis wants a loan to buy material (lentils, cooking oil and rice) for her food stand. Another Shamim akhtar wants a loan to buy cans of paint to resell.

loans.use: To buy cans of paint to sell

loans.name: Allah Rakhi's Group

texts.en:
Shahnaz Bano wants a loan to buy an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle). Sabran wants a loan to buy paint for her paint-selling business. Sajida wants a loan to repair her auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle). Farzana wants a loan to buy sugar cane in bulk for her juice corner. Nasreen wants a loan to buy repair tools for her family's motor workshop. 

Allah Rakhi, wife of M. S., is the group leader for the above-mentioned ladies. They all are very active ladies. They live with the desire to give happiness to their families. They never lose hope and give courage to their families to move forward. They all live in a city famous for its shrines called Borewala, in Pakistan. 

Allah Rakhi is a very hard-working lady. She is a seamstress and also manages her household. Her husband respects her a lot. She uses her income to pay for the utilities. Her husband is a driver and drives an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle). They both do work for improving their standard of living. Currently, they need a loan to repair their rickshaw because its engine is creating a problem.

loans.use: To repair an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle)

texts.en:

Both of them are making this project to improve their family's living conditions. They can earn more from this project during the summer season. They also have their farm, which serves as their main source of income.

She joined PMPC to gain access for financial support and to engage in other business activities. She successfully repaid her previous loan of 6,000 Philippine pesos from PMPC. This loan was used to expand her project. 

She has a new loan of 7,000 PHP from PMPC, which is intended for additional capital of her project. She has managed this business for almost two years and is earning approximately 5,000 PHP a month. It is her third loan cycle at PMPC, a Kiva partner.

loans.name: Teresa

texts.en:
Mrs. Teresa M., 42 years of age and married, is a resident of Mantic, Tangub City. She is blessed with six children: four are now in their teenage years and the other two are still minor dependents. Presently, she buys and sells Chinese medicines. She has been in this business for six years and earns an average net income of not less than 3,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month. 

As a new member of the Paglaum Development Program for Landless People (a micro-finance program of PMPC) she was given the privilege of taking out 5,000 PHP as her first loan to add to capital for her current business. Her income is used to meet her family's daily needs and for savings. She is hoping that with this business she will be able to send all her children to school for a good future.
